mission.desc: Rayne ponders over their mysterious donor. The Elementals lack the resources for it to be one of them. She decides to investigate, and finds that the Avians aren't the only ones that have new supplies...

line.text: Awah! Just what I always wanted, a kit of sparkles to keep my form glittery and golden!
*SNAP SNAP* -A new board to sharpen my pincers, to improve my threatening atmosphere!-

mission.name: Mysterious Donor
mission.desc: Rayne tracks the packages' origin to the fringe of the Celestial Vault, where the hero's airship is docked. There, she sees a fuzzy form adjusting ribbon-wrapped boxes...

line.text: Everyone has received gifts! But who could possibly do something so wonderful?
Hm? What is that... fuzzy person with a red hat....

mission.name: The Giftbringer Culprit
mission.desc: The fuzzy tall form can only belong to one person. Ursurio works diligently to wrap all the packages, many more waiting to be given. Rayne approaches the bear.

line.text: Hohoho!
Ursurio! So you're the one giving out gifts to everyone. Thank you!
It's a great time to enjoy food and holiday cheer!

mission.name: Far from Over
mission.desc: The portal appears to reach its limit, waning to the smallest possible dot. Suddenly, it howls and tears itself open. A fiercely bright light covers the Vault's ceiling, above the portal's sheet of darkness, creating a brilliant paradox of light and dark.

mission.name: An Unknown Blessing
mission.desc: Magistrate Yakov holds his wings up, as if to receive the blessing of light and dark. A voice you have never heard before speaks an incomprehensible language from inside the portal. Light and darkness converge in a beam, firing straight at the Crimsonwing Avian.

mission.name: Newfound Powers
mission.desc: The portal has disappeared completely, the ensuing silence pronounced in its absence, save for Yakov's erratic breathing. His eyes aglow with wonder, a white-flame power flickering beneath, he moves his wing and Magistrate Agni is tossed by an invisible power, like a ragdoll.

mission.name: Heretical Strength
mission.desc: You face Magistrate Yakov alone. A single crimson feather spirals down to the earth, before Magistrate Yakov. White fire engulfs his body, imbued with new and powerful magic, he shouts praise to the forgotten hero, and promises to complete her will by defeating you.

mission.name: The Lava Orb's Strengths
mission.desc: The Crimsonwing Avian places his wing on the Lava Orb. Energy begins to transfer from the orb to his body. The lava island rumbles uncertainly...

line.text: You are very strong, as one would expect from the champion that defeated Bluefire... even if he was weakened at the time.

mission.name: Absorbing the Orb
mission.desc: The Crimsonwing Avian is draining energy from the Orb! Cedric redoubles his efforts, before island's energy source becomes imbalanced.

line.text: But can the same strength be said of your companions?

mission.name: Cedric's Respite
mission.desc: The Avians retreat again from your fearsome power. Cedric is still winded from your previous running, but there is yet one more orb to protect.

mission.name: For the Sake of Speed
mission.desc: The Avians shriek about one final chance, leaving you and Cedric to claim the Lava Orb. Cedric sits down, still catching his breath.

line.text: You go on ahead, adventurer. I'll protect the Lava Orb. I'm certain they'll be heading to the last island.

mission.name: Pursuing the Crimsonwings
mission.desc: You continue your pursuit to the final island, which houses the Basin Orb. You spot a group of Avians that have surrounded the Orb...

mission.name: Feather Versus Wing
mission.desc: Upon getting closer to the Basin Orb, you realize that there are two groups of Avians, each fighting each other! You recognize one as Magistrate Agni, who had beseeched the Elementals for aid.

line.text: It's about time you showed up. We wouldn't be able to last without reinforcements.

mission.name: Missing Mastermind
mission.desc: You and Magistrate Agni clear out the rest of the Crimsonwing Avians. However, you realize the leader of the Crimsonwings was not at this battle...

line.text: The Orbs should be safe now. However, the Crimsonwings revealed their plot. They want to enter the inner sanctum of the Celestial Vault.

mission.name: The Orbs' Light
mission.desc: The earth rumbles again. The Basin Orb begins to glow, enveloped by a mystical light. From the other two islands, you see similar glows in the distance. The lights converge above the islands...

mission.name: Trust Issues
mission.desc: You see the Crimsonwing Leader flying in the distance. He follows the light, disappearing where the three beams converge...

line.text: Only Elementals or those with wings can reach the sanctum of the Celestial Vault.
Do you trust me, adventurer? I can bring you to the sanctum.

mission.name: Belief in the Redfeather
mission.desc: You remember Cedric's warning and Groc's worry about the Avian Magistrate. However, something is clearly happening, and it would be unwise to ignore. You offer your hand to Magistrate Agni.

mission.name: To the Heart of the Vault
mission.desc: Magistrate Agni lifts you with all her might, her wings flapping furiously. She brings you closer to the light, and it envelopes the two of you completely...

line.text: Thank you, adventurer. I promise that this was the right decision.

mission.name: To the Celestial Vault's Core
mission.desc: You fall a short distance, tumbling as you hit tiled ground. Magistrate Agni collapses next to you, chest heaving from exerting so much strength. You can hear voices in the near distance.

mission.name: Mystical Realm
mission.desc: You have arrived at a shrine, with statues of the three factions, forming a triangle depiction of Aether, Wyld, and Chaos. At its center is a spring, glowing with energy. Standing before it is the Crimsonwing Avian.

line.text: This place is where Elementals cross from the spiritual world and into the physical realm.

mission.name: Crimsonwing Yakov
mission.desc: The Crimsonwing Avians surround you and Magistrate Agni, preventing you from getting close to their leader. They look prepared for a fight.

line.text: Magistrate Yakov!
Ah, Magistrate Agni. It must be fate indeed for us to meet this way.

mission.name: New Perspective
mission.desc: The two Avians glare at each other, while the Crimsonwings gather to fight you. It seems the two have a history together...

line.text: Shall we work together like the old times in Redfeather Village, or have you thrown in your lot with the wingless?
The Void has been sealed. Free from The Void's influence, my perspective has changed.

mission.name: The Winged Hero
mission.desc: The light has converged at the spring. But the beam flickers, the whiteness slowly turning darker until it is completely black...

line.text: Without this 'wingless' champion, I would still be under The Void's influence.
Ah, but that is where you are wrong. Although this adventurer dealt the final blow to Bluefire, there was a hero that weakened him before they fought...

mission.name: Lost to History
mission.desc: You fight back against the Avian soldiers. The ominious light is growing darker, enveloping the sanctuary's symbols of the three factions.

line.text: I speak of the hero who plucked Bluefire's heart from his form. The one whose name and very existence was cursed to be forgotten.
With The Void's disappearance, we Crimsonwings remembered everything.
What...?

mission.name: Darkened Elements
mission.desc: The dark light ends, leaving just the portal of darkness. The ground begins to tremble, originating from the depths of the darkness...

mission.name: Realm of the Mad
mission.desc: Elementals pour from the darkened portal. They shriek and writhe as if in agony, claws tearing across any they touch, as your battle rages with the Avian Crimsonwings.

line.text: Now, we will free her from this prison of the Celestial Vault!

mission.name: Burned Invitation
mission.desc: The portal diminishes, fading to a dot of light. The flow of Elementals ceases, leaving you to contend with the remaining Elementals and Avians. Magistrate Yakov yells loudly in frustration.

line.text: Where... where is the hero? Does she refuse to answer my summons, or is something missing?

mission.name: Elemental Frenzy
mission.desc: The portal has been destroyed by the Crimsonwing's actions, yet only Elementals passed through it. Magistrate Yakov pounds the wall in frustration, while the fight around him rages on.

mission.name: For Those Now Forgotten
mission.desc: Magistrate Yakov manages to regain his composure. He summons the white flame back to his form, preparing an attack.

line.text: It appears that your plan has failed.
Then we will take this as an opportunity to destroy this false Champion of The Void.

mission.name: Nothing Left to Lose
mission.desc: The Crimsonwing Avians relentlessly assault you and Magistrate Agni. With their plan no longer an option, they have resorted to fighting until they fall.

mission.name: Hint to Great Power
mission.desc: Magistrate Yakov laments Magistrate Agni's choice to ally with you. He also hints about the truth of his power, and that there might be others like him...

line.text: Those who have been touched by The Void and yet survived can awaken greater powers within them.
Magistrate Agni, if you join us, we can teach you the path to unlock your true powers.

mission.name: For the Celestial Vault
mission.desc: Magistrate Agni shakes her head. She remains loyally by your side. Crimsonwing Yakov gathers his remaining followers, his wings aglow with the orbs' power.

line.text: I've heard enough. I have learned from the past, and will not make the same mistakes.
We will defeat you, and restore stability to the Celestial Vault.

mission.name: The Mystic Library's Keepers
mission.desc: Small, wispy spirits float around the library's books. They seem particularly attracted to the glyphs that Yuriel has drawn. When you hold up Yuriel's books, the creatures gather to you....

mission.name: Word Eater Power
mission.desc: The little spirits imbue the books with magical powers. You sense within the pages even greater power. With more spirits, it seems you would unlock the tomes' abilities...

mission.name: Queen of the Angels
mission.desc: The Angel Queen has invited you to Skyhaven, claiming to have uncovered a great secret. You fly your airship to the Angels' home, preparing to meet their leader.

line.text: Hero, it is good to finally meet you. I am Leyla, the Queen of the Skyhaven Angels.
And this here is Sparky!
Rrr..... Rrrar!

mission.name: Royal Dragonling
mission.desc: Malchior bursts into the throne room. Grinning widely, he runs up to the Angel Queen, and takes the paw of her pet dragon. He shakes it vigorously, the dragonling snarling in response.

line.text: Oh I'm so glad to finally meet you, your Majesty!
Grraoww.... Rrrarh!
Who is this man...?

mission.name: Knowledgeable Friends
mission.desc: You explain to the Angel Queen that Malchior is an expert on The Void and all things arcane. She nods, petting the head of her young dragon, which continues to glower ferociously at Malchior.

mission.name: An Invitation to Share Secrets
mission.desc: Leyla's face brightens when you finish your explanation. She claps her hands together joyfully, properly welcoming Malchior to the Skyhaven Kingdom.

line.text: I see. Your expertise may be needed, Mr. Malchior. We have found the most peculiar hidden room, tucked away in our archive.
Perhaps it belonged to the original architects of Skyhaven.
How exciting!

mission.name: The Queen's Assistant
mission.desc: The Angel Queen Leyla calls out to one of her trusted servants. You see a familiar face that you have not seen in a long time...

line.text: Yuriel! Take them to the Mystic Library.
Whooo? ....Oh, you. I do hope you'll let bygones be bygones.

mission.name: Yuriel's New Life
mission.desc: Yuriel takes you further inside Skyhaven at the Queen's request. He tells you about what he's been up to since you last fought him in The Void. Now, Yuriel has been helping the Angel Queen in safeguarding powerful artifacts.

mission.name: Skyhaven's Library
mission.desc: You reach the library of Skyhaven. Well-kept tomes line the shelves, of various thickness and colors. It is brightly lit and clean, an empty table at its center.

line.text: I can't believe an entire room remained undiscovered for so many years!
Ho, hoo. 'Room' doesn't quite do it justice. Pull out that sea green book...

mission.name: Skyhaven's Secret Library
mission.desc: You pull out a misplaced book from the shelf. The ground rumbles as one of the shelves slides to the side, revealing a hidden passage. The inside is dark, but you can see the outline of more shelves and books, and the musty smell of ancient paper.

line.text: We tried to explore earlier, but we were attacked by strange guardians. Be careful; there's no telling how far this hidden library goes...
Somebody killed a lot of trees to make this library.

mission.name: Book Labyrinth
mission.desc: Yuriel leads you and Malchior into the secret passageway. The inside of shelves and books stretches farther than you can see, creating narrow paths.

line.text: This place is a veritable maze. A labyrinth of books!

mission.name: Tome Projection
mission.desc: A book on one of the shelves begins to rattle. Yuriel cautions you, and the group moves towards it slowly. The tome falls to the floor, projecting an angelic image that takes form, charging at you!

line.text: These books are bound with powerful magic. They must be set to guard against intruders.

mission.name: Guardian Angels
mission.desc: More dusty books rattle and fall to the earth. Each one summons a different angel, the guardians bringing their might against you.

mission.name: Archived Traps
mission.desc: The ranks of summoned angels begin to thin. Each one you defeat fades away like a ghost, leaving no trace of its existence, save for books which remain fallen on the ground.

line.text: I doubt those guardians are the only defense for this library. Keep an eye out for traps!

mission.name: Stone Visage
mission.desc: You continue farther in the ancient library. You eventually reach a branch in the path, with an angelic statue at the center of the crossroad. As you near it, the stone visage crumbles, the statue becoming like a real angel.

line.text: Greetings, knowledge seekers. I am Razi, the caretaker of the Arcane Library.

mission.name: Living Statue
mission.desc: Malchior gets dangerously close to the former statue Razi, poking the angel's arm. Razi recoils, staring with mixed confusion and anger at the sage.

line.text: How did you do that becoming a person out of a statue thing? Is your flesh still hardened like stone?
It is through stone that I have been immortalized through the ages. Now I wait to guide those who seek the truth.

mission.name: An Ally...?
mission.desc: Yuriel eyes the angel skeptically. He takes a look around the archive of books, as if expecting a trap or more fights. Razi waits patiently.

line.text: Are you saying that you'll help us get farther? What awaits us at the end?
It is the truth that awaits those who are worthy. Now come, follow me.

mission.name: Fighting for the Truth
mission.desc: For now, Malchior and Yuriel seem to accept Razi's offer of aid. You follow the angel, taking one of the two paths. She points to a clearing, warning that a fight is imminent with the library's guardians.

mission.name: Spike Traps
mission.desc: Razi points to a small depression in one of the tiles, claiming that it is one of the library's traps. Malchior tosses a book on the pressure plate. The tile crumbles, revealing dangerous-looking spikes, impaling the helpless book.

line.text: I must wonder, everything in this library has tried to kill us.
You claim to be the caretaker, and yet are guiding us through the traps, unlike your violent statue friends.

mission.name: Dungeon Progress
mission.desc: More guardians rise from the books, fighting against you, Malchior, and Yuriel. Razi stands off to the side, helping neither side, as the guardians ignore her and focus on your group.

line.text: Knowledge is meant to be shared, not hoarded. But it can also be a dangerous thing, if it falls in the wrong hands.

mission.name: Contingency Plan
mission.desc: The path through the archive seems to stretch on forever. Razi continues to guide you, expertly navigating through each turn and warning of the more dangerous traps, while letting you fight the guardians.

line.text: We've taken so many twists and turns, I'm starting to get all turned around.
I've marked each intersection with a small rune. Even if something happens to Razi, we'll be able to find our way back.

mission.name: Angel Agents
mission.desc: The archive's shelves eventually end. The path opens up to a wide area, with nothing visible except blank tile. Razi motions for your group to stop.

line.text: Be very careful. One stray step could close the true path.
You will face a number of Mystic Library protectors.

mission.name: Invisible Maze
mission.desc: Razi leads you through a complicated invisible maze, taking calculated turns without any marker. Yuriel carefully places a rune at each turn, creating an escape path should things go wrong.

mission.name: Test of Might
mission.desc: When Razi stops, more creatures materialize. The angelic guardians bring their might against you, while Malchior and Yuriel aid your efforts.

mission.name: Final Trial
mission.desc: Once the fighting ends, Razi continues the strange path. She stops a few more times, waiting for guardians to appear, and for you to ultimately defeat them.

line.text: How much farther must we go?
The truth is past this last trial.

mission.name: Innermost Chamber
mission.desc: Finally you reach a great door. Razi pushes it open, the hinges squeeking loudly. Past it lies a room filled with more books, this one with a great cathedral-like ceiling. Painted on it is a mural...

line.text: Now, you shall know this land's history.

mission.name: By a Higher Power
mission.desc: Razi lifts her hands, her gaze dark and yet seeming to stare into nothing. The ground rumbles. A great crack tears across the mural, scrawling across the ceiling.

mission.name: Daring Escape
mission.desc: Malchior grabs your arm and pulls on Yuriel's wing. You stumble at first but eventually catch your stride, the three of you racing towards the exit. Whispers of unintellible words echo quietly, while the earth splits and cracks and roars.

mission.name: Retracing Steps
mission.desc: Yuriel shouts to follow the glyphs, warning of untriggered traps. You weave through the invisible maze, desperately trying to find your way back through his markings. You finally make it through, only to be greeted by more guardians, rising from fallen books.

mission.name: Crimsonwing Secrets
mission.desc: Finally you clear the last of the guardians, the exit to Skyhaven looming before you. Light flashes, Razi appearing in its brilliance, blocking your path. Arms still outspread, her pupils are consumed, leaving nothing but white film. She blocks your path, the library collapsing behind you...

mission.name: Ancient Wars
mission.desc: The ceiling's mural shifts beneath your gaze. The pictures change the longer you stare, playing out a story. There appears small groups in the painting, of goblins and orcs. They fight against another group of creatures...

line.text: In the old days, the tribes were divided. Each one fended for itself.
However, the goblins and orcs formed an alliance, and invaded the other tribes' homes.

mission.name: Slayer of the Salt Wastes
mission.desc: A new symbol of red wings appears, uniting the creatures being attacked. The red wings rally the creatures, leading them against the goblins and orcs. Razi continues her history lesson.

line.text: It was a Crimson-Winged Hero who united the scattered tribes, leading them against their attackers.

mission.name: Eternal Devotion
mission.desc: As Razi talks, the mural shifts again. The angels in the picture become larger and more life-like. Next to you, Yuriel shouts in alarm and points towards the books. Identical warriors to the ones in the mural have appeared, prepared for combat!

mission.name: Unification
mission.desc: You fight off history's replicas, each defeated guardian disappearing as soon as you strike the final blow. The mural's image has shifted again, matching Razi's words.

line.text: The threat was gone, but the Crimson Hero imagined a greater future. She attempted to unify all the winged tribes...

mission.name: Bluefire's Promise
mission.desc: The painting changes to show a dragon, one with blue wings and a burning heart. It looms terrifyingly over the symbol of red wings...

line.text: A great dragon from another dimension reached out to the Crimson Hero. The Blue Dragon of Fire promised to unite the tribes peacefully...

mission.name: Trance Peace
mission.desc: Dark energy radiates from the dragon image. It taints the area around it, spreading across the mural.

line.text: But the peace that Bluefire offered was false. It rotted the land, and destroyed the minds of the Crimson Hero's loved ones.

mission.name: Tainted World
mission.desc: The red wings remain free from the dragon's darkness, but the area around it has been corrupted. The rest of the mural has been draped in spiderweb-like darkness.

line.text: The Hero cried out for the dragon to stop, but he did not listen.

mission.name: Hero's Fight
mission.desc: The red wings confront the dragon figure. Part of the mural's clarity is restored, the darkness creeping away from the two figures.

line.text: And so the Hero plunged into The Void Plane, where the dragon hid, to prevent his essence from tainting more of her world.

mission.name: Weak Heart
mission.desc: The image twists again, white spikes growing around the red wings and dragon images. A heart appears between the two...

line.text: A great battle ensued, but the Hero realized that Bluefire's heart was his weakness.
Without it, he could not leave The Void Plane. So she pulled it from his chest, and fled.

mission.name: Winged Battle
mission.desc: The dragon image contorts into a fierce snarl. Its claw lifts towards the heart, but the heart draws closer to the red wings.

line.text: Bluefire would not let her win so easily...

mission.name: Lost in the Abyss
mission.desc: The red wings, still holding the heart, vanish from the mural. The webbed darkness inverts, turning upon the dragon, eventually swallowing him and leaving nothing left.

line.text: Bluefire tossed the world's memories of the hero into the abyss.
The Crimson Hero's name and exploits, and those of her closest allies, would be forgotten by all.

mission.name: Curious Malchior
mission.desc: While Razi is telling her story, and while you and Yuriel fight off the strange statue apparitions, Malchior conducts his own search. He begins poking around the library surrounding the mural...

mission.name: The Hidden Tome
mission.desc: Malchior pulls out a book with a thick binder. It's black and with golden trim. He pages through it, eyes lighting up, and sidles up close to you while Razi continues to talk...

line.text: Psst.... adventurer, take a look at this. This book looks like it's written in a strange language, but I don't think it's that simple...

mission.name: Coded Writings
mission.desc: Malchior continues to go through the book. The words are strange, as if written in a different language, but Malchior seems to have a different theory...

line.text: This book is actually written in some kind of code!
Now wait a tick, there must be an amazing secret inside...

mission.name: Void-Touched Power
mission.desc: Malchior decodes part of the book. He surmises that there is some kind of great secret hidden in its pages, and believes he has found an important clue.

line.text: The general subject seems to be about a hidden power, accessible to those who were touched by The Void.

mission.name: Interrupted Story
mission.desc: Razi drones on her lesson of the past. As she nears finishing her story, she stops, seeing Malchior waving the book in front of you.

line.text: The Crimsonwinged Hero will return soon. The only way to avoid her reckoning...
... What's that book you're holding?

mission.name: Subtle Discovery
mission.desc: Malchior proudly holds up the book so that Razi can also see what he has found. Yuriel hisses at the sage, but Malchior is unashamed of the secrets he's uncovered.

line.text: I've found this amazing book about some kind of secret power, hidden away in a barren wasteland!
Malchior! Why did you tell her that?!

mission.name: Stolen Knowledge
mission.desc: Razi's face darkens. An uncomfortable amount of silence passes. Malchior slowly turns the book away from her, hiding the tome within his shirt. There is an extremely noticeable lump beneath his clothes where he's stashed it.

line.text: That power is reserved for those who have sworn their service to the Crimsonwings.

mission.name: Expected Betrayal
mission.desc: Malchior smiles awkwardly at Razi's furious glower. A light shines from the mural, tracing the shapes of angelic guardians, far more than you faced previously.

line.text: Razi? You're not going to try and kill us now, are you?

mission.name: Gathering Resolve
mission.desc: The outline of the images glow, taking form from the mural's drawings. Razi rises at their center...

line.text: You are a champion who defeated Bluefire. I know I lack that power, yet even so...

mission.name: Destroyed Knowledge
mission.desc: The library trembles. You turn to the room's exit, only to find that more guardians have arrived behind you, blocking your path.

line.text: I see you have no intention of leaving the continent.
If the knowledge here will be used against us Crimsonwings, then the library is better off destroyed!

mission.name: Inevitable Conflict
mission.desc: The ground lurches, a terrible cracking sound resounding through the walls. Razi points her winged allies to attack you and your group.

line.text: You have already wasted precious time here while our allies are busy.
Now, be trapped beneath the rubble!

mission.name: Angelic Flight
mission.desc: You, Malchior, and Yuriel fight against the legion of angels. You focus on clearing a path, while Yuriel and Malchior handle the angels behind you.

mission.name: Overstayed Welcome
mission.desc: The moment the path is clear, the three of you bolt towards the exit. However, the invisible maze and a host of other unactivated traps impede your progress.

line.text: As fascinating as this conversation is, I do believe it's time to leave!

mission.name: Yuriel's Escape Plan
mission.desc: Yuriel takes the lead point. He waves his wing, the runes activating and showing the path through the maze.

line.text: Don't panic! Follow the marks I made on our way in.

mission.name: Dragon Feed
mission.desc: In Goblin Rise Stronghold, there are a number of items that the goblins use for supplies. Some are traditional, but others include small explosives and metallic crafts. Fiona's dragons have become addicted to the little sparklers.

mission.name: Dragon Affection
mission.desc: A closer inspection reveals that, despite lighting on fire and smoking, the firework look-alike is actually candy. If you can become friends with Fiona's dragonlings, they might help you in your journey.

mission.name: An Ally's Distress
mission.desc: Fiona the dragontamer has sent your airship a distress message. You agree to meet her just outside one of the infamous goblin camps, Goblin Rise Stronghold...

line.text: I'm glad you could make it, adventurer.
After I separated from you in Beetleton Bunker, I've been trying to locate the Insects' missing Spellstone Hammer.

mission.name: Team Assembled
mission.desc: Another approaches from the distance. You realize that it is Orgoth, one of the orc tribe leaders. Fiona gestures for him to join your little circle.

line.text: Howdy, Fiona and adventurer. It's been a while, eh.
Good, we've all assembled. Now I can explain...

mission.name: The Goblins' Plot
mission.desc: Fiona huddles closely to you and Orgoth, furtively looking behind her shoulder, as if expecting the goblins to be listening. The distance is great enough that you doubt even the scouts could see you.

line.text: I saw Decim with the Spellstone Hammer. The goblins escorted him into the fortress.

mission.name: The Wildcard
mission.desc: Fiona and Decim are both inhabitants of the same region, Tarragon Peak. Fiona expresses her distress upon learning of Decim's involvement with the Spellstone Hammer.

line.text: Decim's a bit of a wildcard, but he's actually a good person. It seems odd that he'd willingly help the goblins.

mission.name: Mediator's Reminder
mission.desc: The orc tribe has worked closely in the past with the goblins. Fiona has called Orgoth the orc to act as a mediator, and handle the situation as delicately as possible.

line.text: Well it ain't like the goblins are inherently evil, missie. He might have a reason.
I'm guessing ya want us to find out what he's doing, and 'save' him, eh.

mission.name: Off the Books
mission.desc: With the situation assessed, Orgoth gives his best advice. Knowing that Fiona has had bad relationships with the goblins in the past, he suggests the wisest approach to entering the Goblin Fortress...

line.text: I don't want to strain our relationship with the goblins anymore than where it's at.
Aye, aye. I know a way to get ya both in the fort, and we'll keep it on the down-low, off the goblins' radar.

mission.name: Underground Entrance
mission.desc: Orgoth takes you farther away from Goblin Rise Stronghold. Fiona starts to protest, before Orgoth reveals a secret passage that leads underground.

mission.name: Abandoned Entrance
mission.desc: The passage seems to be an abandoned mining tunnel. There are rail cart tracks bent out of place. Orgoth uses the light from his fist to illuminate the way.

mission.name: Abandoned Entrance
mission.desc: A few goblin patrols roam the tunnels. However, you're able to take them out quickly, before they can return to the fortress and warn the rest of their tribe.

line.text: Take out the small patrols of goblins. We'll be outta Goblin Rise before they know somethin's up.

mission.name: Goblin Rise Infiltration
mission.desc: Orgoth leads you through the winding abandoned mine, motioning for you to stop as he comes to one particular sector. Slowly he pushes open the hatch, peering cautiously on the surface, before announcing the coast is clear for the two of you to follow.

line.text: Try not to let 'em spot ya. We'll never leave Goblin Rise if they catch us in the middle of infiltratin'.

mission.name: Clear Coast
mission.desc: You find yourself in an unused storage room, with rocks and debris piled in the corner. The three of you sneak out of the empty room, onto the ramparts of Goblin Rise.

mission.name: Nefarious Plot
mission.desc: As you move across the ramparts, Fiona points down below to the main courtyard. A group of goblins have gathered, one of them holding a hammer with a crystallized rock on it. But not just any rock...

line.text: Would you look at that... It's the Spellstone Hammer!

mission.name: Spellstone Hammer
mission.desc: The goblin wielding the hammer gives it a mighty swing. It cracks the ground, an object growing from its source. In its place is a mecha, shaped like a dragon.

line.text: Wowee, Boldur! That's one heck of a toy!
Heh, the sky's the limit, boys. We can make ANYTHING.

mission.name: New Tribal Leader
mission.desc: Even without Reks or his sister Xerkahn, it seems the goblins have continued their original plans. The strength of their arms has increased since you last saw them.

line.text: The strongest or the craftiest... a goblin needs one of those traits to become a leader.

mission.name: A Spellstone's Power
mission.desc: You spy on the small group of goblins in the courtyard. The one with the Spellstone Hammer gives it a mighty swing, creating another mechanical creature.

line.text: One good whack with this hammer and we can improve our defenses.
I'd like to see the fool who thinks he can take on an army of Goblins and Mechas!

mission.name: Stolen Property
mission.desc: Fiona's fist clenches at the sight of the goblins playing with such a powerful artifact, especially one that they have stolen. She inches closer...

line.text: We need to get that Spellstone Hammer. Its rightful owners are the Insects of Beetleton.

mission.name: The Mission's Meaning
mission.desc: Orgoth places a hand on Fiona's shoulder, gently pulling her back. He reminds her of her original purpose...

line.text: Whoa there, little lady. Are you here for the Spellstone Hammer... or for Decim?

mission.name: The Search for Decim
mission.desc: Fiona grudgingly agrees with Orgoth's logic. Her worry outstrips the need to retrieve the Spellstone Hammer.

line.text: Grr, you're right. If we cause a commotion now, we'll never find Decim.
Yep. Let's keep movin' then.

mission.name: Creatures Locked, Forgotten
mission.desc: The three of you continue your infiltration. Since Decim isn't in any of the visible areas of the Stronghold, Orgoth takes you down to the cells. Some of them are filled with the same mechas created by the Spellstone Hammer...

mission.name: Following the Singer
mission.desc: The path has poor lighting, torches flickering eerily as you continue your descent. The mechas snap their jaws angrily as you pass, straining against the bars. Then you can hear a voice singing...

line.text: Nobody knows the trouble I've seen...
That voice... Decim is here!

mission.name: Ungrateful Detainee
mission.desc: You find Decim sitting inside one of the cells. It appears the goblins have locked him away. Fiona runs to the bars, but Decim remains seated and scowls.

line.text: Fiona? Ugh.
Ugh? Excuse me? And here I was going to let you out of that cell!

mission.name: All According to Plan
mission.desc: Decim shakes his head. Despite his predicament, he seems unconcerned with his current situation. A small creature moves in the darkest corners of Decim's cell, frightened blue orbs fixated on you.

line.text: It's not like I needed your help or anything! Everything's going according to plan.

mission.name: Fiona's Suspicion
mission.desc: The creature dashes behind Decim's back before you can get a good look at it. Fiona questions Decim's 'plan' about getting captured in Goblin Rise Stronghold...

line.text: And what exactly, is your plan? What were you doing with the Spellstone Hammer?

mission.name: Dragonling Friend
mission.desc: Decim reaches behind him, gently pulling a cat-sized scaled creature. A young wind drake is in the cell with him, cowering before your gaze, and snuggling closer to Decim.

line.text: I traded the Spellstone Hammer for this little guy's freedom.
Awoo....

mission.name: Knights Unite!
mission.desc: STRIKE! After years of physical and mental abuse, The Knights of Arcantica have decided to band together with one goal in mind: survival... and perhaps a pension plan.

line.text: What do we want? Safe working conditions and resonable compenstation! When do want it? NOW!

mission.name: Knightmare Story
mission.desc: NOW HIRING: Seeking young, able-bodied heroes with a thirst for adventure. Tasks may include heavy manual and skilled work including hacking, slashing, and beast slaying. No experience required.

line.text: Replace us? REPLACE US?! Why don't you replace my missing limbs, you bunch of dragon licking gold sticklers!

mission.name: Knight Life
mission.desc: HELP WANTED: Love exotic animals? Want to travel Arcantica? Have an itch to save the world? Apply within! Must maintain immune response to exposure to infectious and parasitic diseases. Health benefits not included.

line.text: It's turning green. I don't... I don't think it should be turning green. You think I should get it checked?

mission.name: Friday Knight Lights
mission.desc: SUMMER INTERNSHIP: Gain exposure, real world experience, and a life-time of bragging rights. Must be available to work all necessary hours, including weekends, holidays, special events and all shifts. Unpaid.

line.text: THIS WAS SUPPOSED TO BE FOR COLLEGE CREDIT!

mission.name: Toknight We Fight!
mission.desc: There once was a knight named Toknight. Who had dreams of daring, and might. With his parents to blame, for his prophetic name, he sought out to claim his birthright.

line.text: TAP TAP- Is this thing on? Can ev'body hear me? Yo! WHAT'S UP SKYHAAAAAVEN?!
Yo! I got a special tale for ya' tonight- it's a tale so tall it will fill you with fright!
Prepare yourself, for the story of Toknight the knight... tonight.

mission.name: Toknight We Dine in Heck!
mission.desc: He traveled the land far and wide, seeking adventure to assuage his pride. He sought to slay beasts and to perform many feats, but only found himself terrified.

line.text: (Listen. Feats and Beasts is close enough, okay? Limericking ain't easy.)

mission.name: Hot Date, Toknight
mission.desc: So many fangs! So many scales! So many claws! Beasts with talons, tenticles, and paws! Some had eight eyes, and horrifying cries, to expose Toknight's fears and his flaws.

line.text: (Before you ask, no, there are no translations for this. You are welcome to try.)

mission.name: No Sleep Toknight!
mission.desc: No true knight, not even a squire, would quake in fear as I pose and spit fire. With pure rhythm and rhyme, and sick beats in set time. I'm Arcantica's Greatest, Fury Mecha Scyer!

line.text: You can catch my latest single on my website!

mission.name: A Good Knight to Die
mission.desc: RAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAWR. Rwar raw rawr raaaaaaa ra rwar! RAWR RAWR!

line.text: Haven't had enough, eh? COME ON THEN!
Ye don't have any Dragons over there, do ye? I hate Dragons...

mission.name: All Knighter
mission.desc: Raw raaaaar rawr ra? Rawr. Ra ra rawr. Rarawr, rawr raaaaawr raa rwar rawr.

line.text: Take this! And this! And... this! YEAH! AND THE LITTLE ONE TOO!

mission.name: A Knight to Remember
mission.desc: RAWR! RA RAW RAAAAAWR!

line.text: KICK IT! KICK IT AGAIN!

mission.name: Good Knight and Good Luck
mission.desc: Raaaaaaawr. :'(

line.text: ... Wait... are we the bad guys?

mission.name: Bravest Goblin
mission.desc: The goblins have formed a tight ring around your band, making escape impossible. At Boldur's decree, the goblins move quickly. The wind drake is scooped up and dropped in a sack pouch, the goblins deftly tying it with rope.

mission.name: Without Alternative
mission.desc: The goblins catch Decim's swing before it completes, forcing him to the ground. They usher Orgoth to the side, while you stand side by side with Fiona, facing Boldur. The goblins begin to bounce, voices rising as they cheer Boldur's courage.

mission.name: Fearless
mission.desc: Boldur spits in his hands, rubbing them together vigorously. He takes a firm grip on the hammer's handle, pausing just for a second to wink at Fiona. She starts to sputter in disgust, but before she can give a proper insult, Boldur slams the hammer against the ground!

mission.name: A Simple Contest
mission.desc: The earth rumbles, structures springing from the ground beneath the hammer's might. Boldur swings again and again, all the while the goblins' shrieks rise to a deafening clamor, an unsteady chorus of 'fight, fight, fight'!

mission.name: The Timid Wind Drake
mission.desc: Decim holds the limp dragonling proudly, as if awaiting your appraisal. It continues to make small whimpering noises, barely meeting your gaze for more than a second.

line.text: Is that... a dragonling?
It's pretty cool, isn't it? I'm a dragon tamer now!
Decim... no. That's not how that works.

mission.name: Need for Speed
mission.desc: Decim drops the dragonling in his lap. It crawls out immediately, scrambling behind him and attaching itself to his back. Orgoth clears his throat, interrupting the fight between Fiona and Decim.

line.text: You're just jealous that I've got a dragon of my own!
Aight kids. We don't really got time for this. Let's get a move on.

mission.name: Lone Wolf
mission.desc: Orgoth uses a lockpick against Decim's door. However, as soon as Orgoth opens it, Decim pushes past Fiona and runs down the path! The dragonling clutches Decim's scarf, bobbing up and down as he runs.

line.text: Decim, where are you going?! Ooh, he is just impossible!

mission.name: The Right Thing to Do
mission.desc: The group tries to decide if they want to put up with Decim's strange behavior. He hasn't exactly been a team player...

line.text: You sure you want to save him?
I'm having second thoughts. But we can't let that poor dragonling get involved with Decim's terrible decisions!

mission.name: The Wrong Thing to Do
mission.desc: You pursue Decim's path. However, you hear strange scraping and mechanical noises. You catch up, only to see Decim using a key to unlock every single cell that contains a mecha creature...

mission.name: Mecha Freedom
mission.desc: Decim slams more of the cell's doors open. The creatures create a barrier and stop you from reaching Decim, as he continues to open more and more doors. Some wander above ground...

line.text: No creature deserves to be caged! Run free!
*SNAP SNAP*

mission.name: An Attempt at Sanity
mission.desc: Decim continues freeing the creatures, while Fiona and Orgoth try to get him to listen to reason. The mechas chomp at anything in their path, Decim avoiding them narrowly on more than one occasion.

line.text: Are ya crazy?! These things are gonna run rampant!
Decim, for once in your life, listen to me and stop freeing those things!
FREEDOM!

mission.name: Fighting Through the Stronghold
mission.desc: Decim bursts through the door that separates the dungeon from the rest of the stronghold. You fight off the mechas, doing your best to catch up with him.

mission.name: Prisoner Escape
mission.desc: The goblins you saw earlier are still in the courtyard. They look up in surprise as the door opens, Decim with the freed mechas. Chaos ensues as goblins fight off the mechas.

line.text: What the-
Prisoner escape?! Stop them!

mission.name: Goblin Guards
mission.desc: The goblins try to gather to fight against the enraged mechas and also re-capture Decim. You are swept up in the confusion, fighting both forces of goblins and mechas alike.

mission.name: Out of Control
mission.desc: One mecha's footsteps clomp closer, the earth vibrating beneath its pressure. The entrance to the prison cell explodes in falling debris. The machination's arms sweep indiscriminately, hitting goblins, mechas, and everything in its path.

line.text: Whoa, whoa whoa whoa whoa! Calm down!
Grr!

mission.name: Turned Against Their Savior
mission.desc: The gigantic mecha backhands Decim, sending his form flying through the air. The wind drake scrambles to avoid being squashed, Decim laying in a collapsed heap on the ground. The giant mecha clomps closer...

mission.name: For a Dragon and His Boy
mission.desc: The drake runs away a few steps, before looking back and returning to Decim. The drake positions itself between Decim and the mecha, snarling even as its body quivers. Your group runs to their aid, positioning yourself between the dragonling and mecha.

line.text: Hold on, we're here to help!
Just try to take us, ya tin can!

mission.name: Alerted Enemies
mission.desc: You deal the final blow against the gigantic mecha, cleaning up the rest of the forces. However, the goblins have assembled as more of the chaos dies down...

line.text: Just what in the world is going on here! Who ARE you people?!

mission.name: Out of the Frying Pan
mission.desc: Decim manages to finally pull himself together. He rises, swaying unsteadily on his feet, the wind drake prancing happily at his recovery.

line.text: Whoa... look at all these angry people...
I recognize some of you... Yer enemies of our tribe!

mission.name: An Attempted Recovery
mission.desc: Orgoth pushes his way past you, Fiona, and Decim. Fiona originally recruited him because of his skills, and he intends to make use of it even in the poorest of situations. He attempts to negotiate with the goblins...

line.text: 'Alo there, mister goblin sir! Pardon our abrupt entry, but we were lookin' for our friend here.
Surely you recognize me? We played cards in that little outpost of the Salt Wastes.

mission.name: The Goblins' Heart
mission.desc: The goblins are on the verge of assaulting you with their full force. Orgoth does his best to keep them at bay, while the goblins continue to pick off the remaining rampaging mechas.

line.text: Think you can find it in yer hearts to let us go?

mission.name: A Weighty Decision
mission.desc: Boldur strokes his chin, contemplating Orgoth's words. There is a familiar glint to his eye as he sizes Orgoth up, perhaps recognizing him from a more friendly encounter.

mission.name: More Trouble Than Worth
mission.desc: Boldur weighs the decision carefully. The Spellstone Hammer remains firmly in his grasp.

line.text: Hmm.... well that fiery human has caused us a load a' trouble. Letting him go might benefit us...

mission.name: Chance Revenge
mission.desc: Boldur considers the other benefits the goblins could receive by defeating you. He gets a little closer with the Spellstone Hammer.

line.text: But you're traveling with two of our greatest enemies, the ones who beat our old bosses....
My mates won't accept you gettin' out for free.

mission.name: Goblins' Bloodlust
mission.desc: The stronghold is locked in a tense standstill. Goblins surround you, eager to take revenge. They wait only for Boldur to make a final decision...

mission.name: A Unique Solution
mission.desc: Boldur decides to compromise. Rather than take what the goblins want, or what Orgoth has proposed, Boldur has come up with his own decision...

line.text: Aight, here's what we're gonna do. We're going to have a friendly fight, not to the death, see. A test of might!

mission.name: Goblin Arena Ring
mission.desc: The goblins cheer at Boldur's decision. They form a tight circle around you, preventing any chance of escape.

line.text: I need to know how I stack up against such strong heroes!
Ya can leave after. But if we win, we're takin' that dragon as a prize.

mission.name: For a Prize
mission.desc: Fiona adds her own ultimatum. If you and your group are going to go along with Boldur's suggestion, then she wants something in return...

line.text: Then it's only fair that we get a prize if we win, too! If we win, we'll take the Spellstone Hammer!

mission.name: The Goblins' Wager
mission.desc: Boldur agrees, deciding that Fiona's terms are only fair. Then he prepares for the final showdown...

line.text: Yer askin' a lot girlie... but fine. If we win, we keep the dragon.
If you win, ya get the Spellstone Hammer!

mission.name: Coconut Frenzy
mission.desc: The beach seems to have mystical properties in the air. The coconuts have been imbued with the same aura. Perhaps if you bring them to the seers, they can grant you greater powers.

mission.name: Coconut Elixir
mission.desc: Grown on soil entrenched with the island's strange properties, the coconuts have become more than just simple fruit. The seers are able to extract their properties, combine with other island elements, and create a sweet elixir.

mission.name: Arrival at Forgotten Island
mission.desc: Malchior has successfully decoded the book he acquired from Skyhaven. In it, it described an ancient civilization, hidden away on a Forgotten Island. With King Proteus's help, you were able to find the island. Ursurio has decided to accompany you.

line.text: Here we are, as promised. The Forgotten Island.
It was once a hotbed of Scylla worshippers, so be careful of any zealots you encounter.

mission.name: Beach Beauty
mission.desc: King Proteus sends you off, before diving below the waves. The beach's sand is pleasantly warm, seagulls cawing overhead. A dark jungle grows untamed at the beach's border, deeper into the island.

line.text: What a beautiful beach! I'd love to stretch out and do a little sunbathing...
But my nose smells trouble, so we can't relax yet.

mission.name: The Island's Wildlife
mission.desc: Ursurio teaches you how to most efficiently navigate the terrain. You follow the beach rather than immediately heading off to the jungle, searching for the source of the river that flows into the ocean.

mission.name: Zealot Raiders
mission.desc: You see some Seafolk Raiders grouped at the far end of the beach. They're standing in a circle, seemingly oblivious to your presence. You can hear raucous laughter, and spy movement of something in the circle...

line.text: What are those raiders doing? If they're hurting someone, we have to help!

mission.name: For an Unknown Cause
mission.desc: You pound across the sand, ready to come to the stranger's aid. The raiders notice your presence, their attention shifting towards you.

mission.name: Recognition
mission.desc: The Seafolk raiders snarl at your approach. They abandon whatever it was they were doing in their circle, coming towards you with their weapons drawn!

line.text: It's the ones who attacked Lady Scylla. Get them!

mission.name: Crabby Victim
mission.desc: You and Ursurio easily defeat the waves of Seafolk raiders. Ursurio takes a closer look at where the raiders had originally formed their circle. A crab scuttles back and forth in the sand. Ursurio grabs it by its pincer, lifting it up.

line.text: Huh, there's no one else here. Just this tasty-looking crab.
What- Unhand me, you fiend! I am not for eating!

mission.name: The Crab Seer
mission.desc: Ursurio drops the crab in surprise. The crab falls upside-down into the sand, struggling to right itself. Gently, you nudge it back on its feet.

line.text: Thank you, my friend. Without you, I would have ended up as crab meat!
Mm, but yes. I see you have come to this island for a purpose. To discover the truth...

mission.name: Forgotten Knowledge
mission.desc: The Crab Seer shuffles back and forth sideways, unable to sit still. She scratches her head with a pincer claw, trying to remember.... something....

line.text: Wow, how can you tell? That's exactly why we're here!
I can tell because, I... well... This is embarrassing. I don't remember why.

mission.name: A Message for a Champion
mission.desc: The Crab Seer seems to know who you are without any introductions. However, she seems less sure about her own story...

line.text: But you are the Champion of The Void, and I know I have been waiting for you. I must deliver a message!
...Now what was the message...

mission.name: Recollection
mission.desc: The Crab Seer desperately wants to remember the message. She scuttles around in a circle, waving her claws. Ursurio follows behind her, hoping to help.

line.text: I don't know whether to be impressed or disappointed!
Quiet, loud one! I cannot think! I cannot remember to tell you to find the other seers!
Oh...

mission.name: The Three Seers
mission.desc: Finally, the crab remembers part of the message she wants to tell you. However, it seems like you have only found one piece of a much larger puzzle...

line.text: It looks like you remembered after all.
I wish I recalled more details. But yes... one in the jungle, and one in the ruins. You must find them.

mission.name: Jungle Exploration
mission.desc: Following the waterway that leads deeper into the island, you heed the crab seer's words and search for one of her companions. The tropical air becomes oppressively humid in the jungle...

line.text: The seers could lead us to the lost civilization. It's worth checking out, at least.

mission.name: Deeper in the Jungle
mission.desc: There is no path for you to follow. The wilderness is violent and untamed, the foliage scraping against your legs. Even this far into the island, you sometimes encounter Seafolk raider patrols...

line.text: It's weird that we're still seeing raiders this far in.
Do you think they're looking for something? Maybe... pirate treasure?!

mission.name: Just Asking
mission.desc: Ursurio politely asks one of the Seafolk raiders if they're searching for pirate treasure. The raider attempts to stab him with a trident in response.

mission.name: Abandoned Civilization
mission.desc: You give up attempting to reason with Scylla's followers, and instead focus on finding the crab seer's friend. Peculiar ruined structures, remnants of a civilization, can be found half-buried in the earth...

line.text: These ruins are ancient. They must have belonged to the natives of Arcantica.
But why did they leave them? And where did they go?

mission.name: Living Foliage
mission.desc: Eventually Ursurio tires and requests that the two of you take a break. He leans heavily against a tree... only for it to move back suddenly, causing Ursurio to fall on the ground.

line.text: Excuse me! Please do not touch!
Who is this? Are you a friend of the Crab Seer?

mission.name: The Spriggan Seer
mission.desc: The spriggan poses elegantly, bowing and shaking his fronds in your direction. His speech is very formal, the opposite of what you've come to expect on this wilderness island.

line.text: I am a very important person.
Oh?
Yes, very important. You should feel very proud to meet me.

mission.name: Raider Interruption
mission.desc: Interrupting your chance to continue further, the Seafolk raiders have gathered again. They seem intent on getting to the Spriggan Seer, but you block their path and protect your new friend.

line.text: I don't remember WHY, but I must be. Otherwise, those silly Seafolk would leave me alone!
Speaking of those raiders... Here they come!

mission.name: In Search of Treasure
mission.desc: You continue to fend off the Seafolk. Relentlessly they attack, undaunted by the amount that fall beneath your might.

line.text: Ah! I know now! They want my treasure.
Pirate treasure? Food?

mission.name: The Residual Nectar
mission.desc: The Spriggan hands you a small flask, filled with a golden liquid. You carefully stow it away in a safe place.

line.text: Take this Residual Nectar. I created it to restore memories, but I forgot how I made it.
Shouldn't you drink it then? Or perhaps our Crab Seer friend...

mission.name: The Final Search
mission.desc: The Spriggan gives you some more advice before you depart. He points you in a different direction, where you can see tall remnants of ruins rising from the jungle's trees.

line.text: No... if you're after the island's secrets, there is one who can help better than I.
There is still one more seer, from the Insect tribe. You will find her in the ruins, and give her this.

mission.name: Edible Treasure
mission.desc: Ursurio offers to hold on to the nectar for you. After considering it briefly, you decide to keep it for now, to fulfill the seer's request.

line.text: Don't eat it! You must give it to the right seer.
Oh! Okay, okay... Not even a little bite?

mission.name: Ursurio's Fear
mission.desc: You and Ursurio continue your journey through the jungle. More moss-covered bricks frequent the ground, as you begin to traverse towards the ruin structure.

line.text: I hope amnesia isn't contagious. I don't want to forget all my stashed snacks.

mission.name: Monsoon Summoner
mission.desc: The ship's deck is slick with rainwater, the storm drenching you in a matter of seconds. A monster's roar cracks like thunder, lightning dancing at the creature's call.

mission.name: Father of Storms
mission.desc: Typhoeus snakes in the sky towards your ship, its monstrous form coiling lazily the deck. Ursurio bellows fiercely, stabbing the nearest coil with his spear. The creature hisses and the monster's grip loosens.

mission.name: Monster Spawn
mission.desc: The airship creaks uncertainly beneath the weight of the creature. Typhoeus opens its maw, saliva thick like a pool around its teeth. Monsters swim inside, falling to your bridge as Typhoeus drools.

mission.name: Barely Holding On
mission.desc: You and Ursurio fight the creatures that have spawned from Typhoeus. The sky sea monster shrieks, lightning descending from the heavens and striking the ship. It rocks uncertainly, a black plume of smoke emitting from the impact...

mission.name: Abandoned Ruins
mission.desc: You arrive at a ruined structure, the river flowing through its remnants. However, despite the Spriggan's instructions, there doesn't appear to be anyone except the raiders...

line.text: It doesn't look like anyone has lived here in a long time.
Let's find that entrance to the ruins that the Spriggan Seer told us about.

mission.name: The Search for the Seer
mission.desc: You search the area carefully. Shifting back some branches that covered a portion of the ruins, you find an entrance leading deeper inside. Ursurio picks up and lights a nearby torch.

mission.name: Nearby Footsteps
mission.desc: Writings in a strange language cover the wall, illuminated by Ursurio's torch. Ursurio motions for you to stop. As the two of you sit still in absolute silence, you hear the steady drip of water... and the pitter-patter of footsteps.

line.text: Listen! That scurrying... it's too light to be the raiders, and too heavy to be a rat.

mission.name: Battle Chatter
mission.desc: The sound of steps get closer. Strange shadows of creatures with many legs dance on the wall. You hear a high-pitched chatter... and then the feral bugs appear.

line.text: Feral bugs! This must be their home.
Get out of the way, bugs! We need to find the Insect Seer!

mission.name: Feral Attack
mission.desc: Waves of the bugs fall upon you, indignant that you've disturbed their home. You and Ursurio fight the viscious creatures, but more crawl out from every corner.

mission.name: Insect Ally
mission.desc: An elegant Insect of black and red wings arrives, wielding a magical flame. She joins you in fighting against the feral bugs.

line.text: Take this, you mindless monsters!
Are you the Insect Seer? We've been looking for you.

mission.name: Trust Us
mission.desc: Taking out the flask of residual nectar, you offer it to the Seer. She takes it from you hesitantly, before downing it all in one gulp.

line.text: Here, take this nectar. It's from the Spriggan Seer.
From the who? This better not be poison.

mission.name: Temporary Effects
mission.desc: The Insect Seer coughs and sputters after drinking the nectar. She collapses on her legs, breathing heavily. The empty flask shatters on the ground.

line.text: Oh no! Was it actually poison?
*cough* No... No, it's fine. The elixir's effect is only temporary. We must hurry before I forget everything again.

mission.name: Remembering the Truth
mission.desc: The Insect Seer holds her head. A minute passes. Slowly she rises, collecting herself. Even without your explanation, she understands your purpose.

line.text: You came here because the Crimsonwings are becoming a problem.
They attacked us in The Celestial Vault and in Skyhaven. They are growing very bold.

mission.name: The Island's Inhabitants
mission.desc: With her memories returned, the Insect Seer offers you insight on events in the past. This island was the start of a series of events, long ago...

line.text: They seek to revive our leader, who fell against The Void. This island was her home.
It was my tribe, the Rhynio Insects, who adopted the Champion who would later unite the scattered tribes.

mission.name: Fallen Rhynio Tribe
mission.desc: She explains to you the sad truth that has befallen her former comrades. The Insect Seer reveals the truth about all the feral Insects you have been fighting.

line.text: The Crimsonwings' memories have become tangled. Like pieces of a puzzle forced into the wrong places.
And the Rhynio tribe, cursed to lose their minds. Without their memories, they became the feral bugs you now see.

mission.name: Cursed Insects
mission.desc: Ursurio is distressed after hearing the Insect Seer's story. However, she insists there are more important matters at hand...

line.text: Can we help them? Can we help you?
Aha... you are kind to offer. But no. To avoid The Void's curse, the Spriggan Seer developed a concoction to empty our minds.
Do not fret for us. It's more important that you stop the Crimsonwings.

mission.name: No Price Too Great
mission.desc: The Insect Seer reveals the Crimsonwings' true plan. To achieve their goals, the Crimsonwings would inevitably unleash a great evil upon the world...

line.text: To free their leader, they will need to open The Void.
No! We sealed The Void. We can't let them open it again. Can they even do that?

mission.name: Place of Destiny
mission.desc: The Insect Seer reveals the location of the Crimsonwings' plan. With such specific conditions required to be met, you suspect you might be able to stop the Crimsonwings before they can finish their plot...

line.text: The Champion's companions are lost in the spirit world, but their power could free her.
If you stop the Crimsonwings from freeing the Champion's companions, the seal on The Void cannot be undone.
If all else fails, intercept them at a place where neither grass nor tree can grow. That is the entrance to The Abyss, the Champion's prison.

mission.name: The Stone Tablet
mission.desc: The Nameless Hero's home was originally on this island. The Insect Seer points to a few clues that she left behind, which might provide more insight into her activities.

line.text: The Forgotten Hero visited this place before she left to fight Bluefire. Look carefully to the stone tablets if you seek the truth.

mission.name: The Second Tablet
mission.desc: You take a moment to look over the cavern's writings. However, they're coded in the same fashion as the book Malchior found in Skyhaven. Or is there some other kind of secret beneath their words?

mission.name: The Third Tablet
mission.desc: You find one more tablet, which seems to be connected to the other two. However, Ursurio is growing impatient. With the knowledge that the Crimsonwings plan to unseal an entrance to The Void, you will have to race them to defeat their plan.

mission.name: Powerful Foe
mission.desc: The earth rumbles, dust and rocks falling dangerously from the ruins's partially collapsed ceiling. You look around for the source of the earthquake...

line.text: What was THAT?
The seafolk you fought earlier worship Typhoeus, Scylla's brother.

mission.name: Typhoeus's Awakening
mission.desc: The Insect Seer suspects that the seafolk raiders have awakened a terrible beast. With Ursurio's urging, you leave behind the cave writings.

line.text: They must have gotten their hands on residual nectar to revive Typhoeus from the sea's depths...
You should have warned us sooner! Come on, let's get out of here!

mission.name: Backtracking
mission.desc: You and Ursurio run through the ruin, back towards the entrance. After fighting waves of the seafolk, you realize that the Insect Seer has not come with you. She has stayed behind with the ancient writings.

mission.name: Monsoons and Raiders
mission.desc: The island's weather has transformed to a terrifying storm. Wind shrieks through the palm trees, which sway so violently they threaten to snap in half. Thick rain pounds down so hard that it hurts, the sky's clouds twisted and dark.

line.text: The heretics appear! Kill them in the name of Lord Typhoeus! Avenge Lady Scylla's soul!

mission.name: Storm Ruler
mission.desc: A ferocious roar rumbles like thunder as lightning streaks through the sky. From the dark clouds swims a beast with a thousand teeth, descending from the heavens.

line.text: Is that thing the cause of this storm?

mission.name: Escape from Monsoon
mission.desc: Your airship circles around, battered fiercely from the storm. Elyse appears at the airship's entrance. She tosses a rope down to you and Ursurio.

line.text: Hurry up and get in! This ship can't withstand this weather for very long!

mission.name: Typhoeus's Pursuit
mission.desc: You manage to get inside the ship, still dripping wet. Lightning flashes dangerously nearby, the airship traveling between twin bolts. Ursurio points to the window, where you see a streak of scales...

line.text: Uhh, that thing is still chasing us!

mission.name: To the Bridge!
mission.desc: Elyse and the others are doing their best to keep the airship flying. She points you and Ursurio to a hatch that leads to the ship's bridge.

line.text: Get up to the bridge and stop it! If that thing coils around the whole ship, we're going to crash!

mission.name: Golden Leaf Power
mission.desc: Golden Crown Village is best known for its iconic golden leaves. The trees were enchanted by the Elementals in the past, giving them similar energy found in the Arcane Ores, like empty Spellstones.

mission.name: Airship Energy
mission.desc: When ground into fine powder, the golden leaves can be used as an energy catalyst for your airship. Collecting the golden leaves should get more of your airship's defenses up and running.

mission.name: Impact Remains
mission.desc: When you awake, you find yourself on a pile of golden leaves. The air smells like sulfur, and you can see your airship nearby, billowing black smoke. Malchior rises from your side, fretting over the ship.

line.text: Alright, who's the one who decided to make the punch the party version, it has given me a killer headache.
Oh wait, I remember now. We crashed! The landing was a bit rough. But we managed to avoid the sea.

mission.name: Damaged Airship
mission.desc: The airship has sustained visible damage. Multiple windows, including the gigantic windshield have broken, leaving fragmented glass shards on the ground.

line.text: That last impact knocked us out of the ship. Roll call! Everyone here?

mission.name: Scattered Companions
mission.desc: Your companions have been scattered. You help Elyse to her feet, while checking on the others. Ursurio lays on the grass, while Scyer hangs from a nearby treetop, golden leaves sticking out of his head.

line.text: I'm okay. What about everyone else?
Urgh... let me sleep just five more minutes...
That was one bumpy ride. Hopefully nobody died!

mission.name: Scattered Friends
mission.desc: In front of the broken windshield, Oda rises to his feet, dusting off fragments of glass. Aria shakes her head, grumbling loudly.

line.text: I avoided most of the glass shards... I'm mainly unharmed.
Ugh, remind me why we allow the crazy man to fly the airship.

mission.name: Cedric's Memory
mission.desc: Cedric looks at the golden leaves and the gigantic trees. They tower far into the sky, patches of light filtering through their holes.

line.text: I recognize the unique color of the leaves. We must be near Golden Crown Village.

mission.name: Golden Crown Request
mission.desc: The airship is bathed in sunlight, having broken the branches high overhead. Dangerous-looking sparks emit at regular intervals from the ship's engine.

line.text: We'll need to do some repairs before this airship can fly again.
Adventurer, can you find the Golden Crown Mayor and ask for her help? We'll need supplies, and more hands, to properly get the ship up and running.
I'll come with you. I know this area well.

mission.name: Dawnglow Trainees
mission.desc: You leave your broken airship behind, traveling with Cedric. You have only taken a few steps, when a frog with a colorful headpiece stops your progress...

line.text: Rribit! The former First Sword of the Dawnglow Emperor!
It is an honor to meet you in person. Please, grant us some training!

mission.name: Dawnglow Love
mission.desc: A battalion of colorful frogs do battle with you and Cedric. Cedric tells them to stop, yet the overzealous frogs demand to test their skills.

mission.name: Cedric's Past Connections
mission.desc: A new frog steps forward. In her hand, she wields a dream catcher like a wand. Her choice of clothes and colors shows that she is part of the Dawnglow frogs.

line.text: Enough, please. Contain your excitement.
Kachina? What are you doing here?

mission.name: Kachina, the Dreamer
mission.desc: Cedric recognizes the frog. He tells you that Kachina is the Frog Emperor's Dreamer, and that she often provides advice and runs the Emperor's errands.

line.text: We Dawnglow Frogs have come to ask the Golden Crown Mayor for assistance.
That is also our purpose. Let's go to the village together.

mission.name: Dawnglow Recruits
mission.desc: Kachina and the overeager Dawnglow frogs join you. Although you have recently had poor experiences with the Dawnglow Frogs, it seems Cedric's presence prevents them striking out... too harshly.

mission.name: Golden Crown Heart
mission.desc: Your group arrives at the heart of Golden Crown Village. The Frogs here have made homes out of leaves, expertly crafting the great trees to wind up like stairs that lead across the village.

line.text: Ahh, so good to see you again, young adventurer, cute Kachina, and little Ol' Cedric!
Your timing is impeccable. The fly pies have just come out of the oven. Come, sit a while and eat.

mission.name: Home Sweet Fly Pie
mission.desc: The Mayor of Golden Crown is busy taking her pies out of the oven. She sets it on the window to cool, motioning for everyone to sit at the table.

line.text: Unfortunately we have little time for pleasantries, Mayor. And please don't call me that.

mission.name: The Mayor's Concern
mission.desc: You and Cedric tell the Mayor about your daring escape from Forgotten Island. The monster Typhoeus did enough damage to your ship to cause it to crash.

line.text: Oh dear, were any of you harmed in the crash? That explains the smoke and loud noise we heard.
We're alright, Mayor, but we could use some help with the ship.

mission.name: News of Crimsonwings
mission.desc: After you explain your plight, Kachina requests the Mayor for aid of a different cause. Kachina has also traveled for a different reason...

line.text: Mayor, are you aware of the Crimsonwings near the edge of your border?

mission.name: Remnants of the Past
mission.desc: The Golden Crown Mayor frowns at Kachina's declaration. The village once shared borders with the Redfeather Avians, but most had moved out after The Void's attack.

line.text: A small congregation of former Redfeathers have taken up residence in an old temple...
I did not realize they were also part of the Crimsonwings.

mission.name: Request of Golden Crown Aid
mission.desc: Kachina reveals her purpose of traveling from Dawnglow to Golden Crown. She requests her own assistance of the Mayor.

line.text: They have stolen an artifact that belongs to Dawnglow. We were hoping our sister tribe of Golden Crown would aid us against these thieves.

mission.name: A Request for a Request
mission.desc: The Golden Crown Mayor looks deeply concerned at Kachina's report. She explains her own issues, before turning to you...

line.text: We Golden Crown frogs aren't fighters. However... perhaps you could help them in our stead, adventurer?
It sounds fair. A favor for a favor, after all.

mission.name: Time to Strike
mission.desc: The Dawnglow Frogs have come to fight a war against the Crimsonwings. Perhaps this is an opportunity to strike first, instead of waiting for their inevitable attack.

mission.name: Travel Through Golden Crown
mission.desc: Cedric, you, Kachina, and a host of Dawnglow frogs leave the village. Kachina apologizes to you on behalf of Dawnglow for the earlier hostilities the tribe has shown you.

line.text: Dawnglow has always been divided. The divisions prioritize tasks autonomously.

mission.name: Reminiscing
mission.desc: Cedric seems sympathetic to Kachina's apology. Once a servant of the Emperor, he relates to Kachina's own position.

line.text: The Emperor's political games grated on my nerves. That's what eventually lead me to live in Golden Crown.

mission.name: The Path Forward
mission.desc: You continue your journey through Golden Crown, fighting off monsters and the overly eager frogs.

mission.name: The Old Dawnglow Days
mission.desc: Kachina laments Cedric's decision. The old Frog's service to the Emperor was legendary, and news of his war prowess is still whispered among the Dawnglow ranks.

line.text: I don't deny that he is a certain type of personality. But your presence is missed, Cedric. I've heard many great stories of your deeds.

mission.name: An Offer to Return
mission.desc: Kachina seems to be trying to get Cedric to return. The old Frog's expertise has certainly been valuable to your team...

line.text: Perhaps one day you would consider coming back.

mission.name: Light Extinguished
mission.desc: An unending army of Frogs attacks. When one falls, another takes its place. Kachina raises her dream catcher slowly, until its net covers the brightest star. The night sky's color drains, the blue bleeding into darkness, blackness seeping around you. The bell tolls three.

mission.name: Discarded Dreams
mission.desc: You shove off one Frog, and another, trying desperately to reach Kachina. One by one, the stars blink and fade out, falling from the sky and into the dark void beneath your feet. The bell tolls six.

mission.name: The Time Draws Near
mission.desc: The sound of the bell rings in steady intervals, the echo muted and off-tone. You shove and push the Frogs out of your way, as a voice sings quietly, the words too whispered for you to make out. The bell tolls nine.

mission.name: A Dream's Demise
mission.desc: Kachina's dream catcher drains the last rays of light, dousing the night sky in darkness. Her dream catcher brightens like a torch, light playing eerily off her features, wings steeped in black and red. The frogs gathering around her for one final fight. The bell tolls twelve.

mission.name: The Void's Cost
mission.desc: Your journey takes you to the border of Golden Crown. In the distance, you can see a barren landscape, of dirt and charred tree stumps.

line.text: We're close to Redfeather Valley... or what remains of it, at least.
It looks worse than I expected. No wonder Magistrate Agni sought refuge in The Celestial Vault.

mission.name: Missing Scouts
mission.desc: The Dawnglow Frogs are known for their fighting power, but even Kachina didn't dare enter this area unprepared. She tells you about one of the Dawnglow scouting teams...

line.text: Be careful. Our Lilypad division was originally sent to investigate this area, but they have gone missing.
That's why I asked the Mayor for additional aid.

mission.name: Avian Priests
mission.desc: Your party is getting close to the temple. Avians in dark colored robes roam the area. You recognize some from the Crimsonwing attack at The Celestial Vault...

line.text: Ka-kraw! More intruders? Teach these flightless ones some manners!

mission.name: Fighting on the Fringe
mission.desc: The Avians descend upon you. They fight with a fierce fury, targeting you before Kachina or Cedric. They clearly remember your fight against them...

mission.name: Kachina's Fury
mission.desc: You fend off the encroaching Crimsonwings Avians. Kachina demands answers for her missing Frog brethren.

line.text: Tell us what you have done with the other Dawnglow frogs!

mission.name: Of Frogs and Feathers
mission.desc: The Crimsonwing Avians show little mercy. They continue to fight against you and your friends, relentlessly trying to take you down.

mission.name: Hope for Dawnglow...?
mission.desc: As if on cue, the division of frogs emerges with part of the Crimsonwings' forces. However, something is wrong... the frogs are armed, but raise their weapons to aid the Crimsonwings!

line.text: They had a little chat with High Priestess Tanit, that's all.
Now, they've realized the error of their past ways.

mission.name: In the Face of Evil
mission.desc: Kachina remains surprisingly calm despite the Crimsonwing's declaration and the Lilypad Division's betrayal. The Crimsonwing takes note of the brave Frog.

line.text: Free them. They are of little use to you.
Hm, if you desire a favor from us, then you must first prove your worth...

mission.name: To the Crimsonwings' Lair
mission.desc: The Crimsonwings pause. They lead you to the temple, a small stone structure at the edge of golden trees.

line.text: The High Priestess was the first to dream. If you are worthy, you will step out of her realm unchanged.

mission.name: The Redfeather Temple
mission.desc: You ascend great stone stairs that lead to the temple's entrance. The interior is dark, but the Crimsonwing lights a torch and leads you deeper. Despite its age, the temple is clean, without visible dust or cobwebs.

mission.name: Dream Elixir
mission.desc: You stop before an altar. A statue has been carved into the stone on the wall; an Avian bowed in prayer, as if looking down to the altar. A conspicuous vial of blue liquid sits at the center.

line.text: This is... the stolen artifact, the dream elixir!
After drinking the elixir, you will fall into slumber. There, you will meet High Priestess Tanit. When you return, we will give whatever you desire.
Er, are you telling us to enter a dream?

mission.name: Kachina's Resolve
mission.desc: Kachina eyes the vial, before looking to you and the Crimsonwing. She picks up the vial.

line.text: I'll do it. I must.
Meeting this Tanit may be dangerous. Isn't that what changed our Dawnglow friends?

mission.name: A Safety Precaution
mission.desc: Cedric casts a wary look around the temple. You are completely surrounded by the Crimsonwing Avians, yet the trial would leave you defenseless.

line.text: I don't entirely trust these Avians, for us to simply fall asleep in front of them.
I'll remain watch, while you attempt this trial, adventurer. We can't let Kachina do it alone.

mission.name: Into the Dream
mission.desc: After Kachina finishes taking a swig of the vial, she hands it to you. A large portion of the elixir still remains, but you take a very small sip.

mission.name: Sinking Sensation
mission.desc: Your lips and face grow numb. The sensation spreads across your whole body, and your vision begins to blur. You lay down before the medicine knocks you off your feet, and close your eyes.

mission.name: The Dream World
mission.desc: When you open your eyes, you are surrounded by the deep blue night sky. Stars twinkle just out of your reach. Nothing is below your feet, yet still you can step forward.

mission.name: True Identity
mission.desc: In the midst of this vast night ocean, you see angelic wings. A figure, a Frog, is bowed in prayer, mimicking the same position as the Avian statue you saw earlier.

line.text: Although the Emperor desired the dream elixir, I had my own motives for finding it.

mission.name: Kachina's Dreams
mission.desc: The angelic Frog rises, turning to face you. Despite the wings, you recognize her as Kachina, who entered the dream world with you.

line.text: The Dawnglow Frogs know me as a dreamer. I have heard the whispers of another world.

mission.name: The First Seal
mission.desc: Kachina speaks of a purpose greater than her position as a simple Dawnglow advisor. She seems different than when you were with her earlier in Golden Crown...

line.text: Upon entering this realm, I met High Priestess Tanit, and I understand now. I must free her.

mission.name: To Protect the World
mission.desc: You remember the Rhynio Insect Seer's warning: the Crimsonwings seek to free their lost companions. You take a threatening step towards Kachina...

line.text: Aha... so someone warned you, did they.

mission.name: The Hero's Avian Companion
mission.desc: Kachina tells you more about High Priestess Tanit. If there was any doubt about what to do next, it has been cleared. For the world to be safe, to preserve the seal on The Void, Kachina must be stopped.
