line.text: Yes, High Priestess Tanit was one of the forgotten Hero's companions.
She brought the might of the Redfeathers to the Crimsonwings.

mission.name: Flightless
mission.desc: The world rotates. The stars glimmer and the world flickers. Frogs bearing the same tribal marks of Dawnglow fade into existence.

line.text: The concerns of the flightless have been petty.

mission.name: In Body
mission.desc: The Frogs charge at you. You fight off the army, as Kachina clasps her hands in prayer again.

line.text: In body, I may appear as a simple Frog.

mission.name: In Spirit
mission.desc: Each time you strike a Frog, a star becomes an Avian. Each time an Avian falls, a star becomes a Frog. You are stuck fighting in an endless loop, the enemies as infinite as the stars.

line.text: In spirit, I am a Crimsonwing.

mission.name: Time Limit
mission.desc: Kachina holds the dream catcher tightly. As the ranks of the Frogs and Avians fall upon you, she raises the dream catcher, preparing for a fight.

line.text: If you wish to stop me, you will need to hurry. When the bell tolls twelve, High Priestess Tanit will be free.

mission.name: Signal of Light
mission.desc: With the aid of the Golden Crown frogs, you were able to get your airship back up and running. However, you had barely started flying when your group noticed a gigantic ray of light in the night sky, emitting from the destroyed Redfeather Village...

line.text: Then we are at an impasse. You're not allowed to continue alone, General.
I can do it if you'd just give me a chance, sir.

mission.name: Reunion from Karthos
mission.desc: A half-transparent gray bubble covers the desecrated village. The light ascends from its center, passing through the barrier and reaching to the heavens. You spot two familiar faces next to the barrier, and descend to meet them.

line.text: Ah, adventurer. Your timing is impeccable. I assume you're also here to investigate that strange light.

mission.name: The Undead Barrier
mission.desc: The land past the barrier has been ravaged. Only the blackened stumps of trees remain of a once great forest. Straw and wood remnants of houses are scattered at irregular intervals in the earth.

line.text: This barrier seems to be crafted to ward the Undead, so I cannot pass.
But that's strange, isn't it? Why would such a thing be here?

mission.name: Trouble Seeker
mission.desc: General Garrick has always been a magnet for trouble. He was originally infected by The Void, and had served under its influence for months. After being freed, Samael hunted him in fear that Garrick would return to its influence.

line.text: I wasn't about to let General Garrick do this alone. You know he has a talent for finding trouble.
Concerned for me, sir?
Karthos would be weaker for losing a valuable general, is all...

mission.name: Deserted Village
mission.desc: You and General Garrick step through the barrier. The gray film passes through your skin harmlessly, leaving an odd tingling sensation. Tarian watches you helplessly, as you depart deeper into the desolate village.

mission.name: Restless Creatures
mission.desc: Elementals drift aimlessly in the night. Feral avians, displaced and without their senses after being exposed to vast amounts of The Void, wander with mindless aggression.

line.text: Redfeather Valley was one of the first places The Void targetted.
The entire world would be like this if you had failed to seal The Void.

mission.name: Inside the Barrier
mission.desc: You travel with Garrick quickly, towards the light source. It seems to be originating from the center of the destroyed village.

line.text: What would cause such a light, especially since no one lives here?

mission.name: Home of the Departed
mission.desc: As you travel further into the village's remains, you see a few trees have managed to avoid the destruction. However, only the restless Elementals and feral birds have their homes here now, and there is no sign of its previous inhabitants.

line.text: Perhaps it's a distress signal from one of the living.

mission.name: The Path Forward
mission.desc: The two of you are making good progress, despite the enemies you face. The light source is hidden behind a patch of tall trees, but you should arrive in just a few minutes...

mission.name: Disappearing Answers
mission.desc: The beam wavers. The intense light flickers and fades to a thin line, before vanishing completely. You and Garrick quicken your pace.

line.text: Look! The light is disappearing...

mission.name: The Barrier Machine
mission.desc: You reach the area that you think is where the light originated from. Although there are no sentient creatures nearby, you see a strange machine...

line.text: The only thing here is this machine. It seems to be generating the barrier against Undead.

mission.name: Plan to Reunite
mission.desc: The machine is rusted and noisy, chugging the gray film which filters above to form the barrier. The controls are so stiff that they threaten to snap with rust when you try to move them.

line.text: Let's turn the barrier off and rendezvous with Lord Tarian.

mission.name: Dream Advent
mission.desc: You are having a dream. Beneath the endless rolling sand, shielded from mortal eyes, lies a temple dedicated to world harmony. It was here that a forgotten memory surfaced in the High Priestess's mind.

mission.name: Idealist
mission.desc: A means of stopping the war without further bloodshed had presented itself. If the love of the factions was what drove neighbors to turn against each other, then a new power was needed: a power derived from another plane, one not connected to the world's Aether, Chaos, or Wyld.

mission.name: Empty Words
mission.desc: The dragon's promise drove Tanit further into the earth's depths, searching to free The Void. Yet this mission drove her and the Crimsonwings into the heart of enemy territory, and the enemies set a carefully laid trap. The entrance to the temple collapsed in a violent explosion.

mission.name: Miracle
mission.desc: Creatures designed for flight were consigned to an earthen pit. And while her companions panicked, Tanit bowed her head in prayer. A single bolt of lightning thundered from the heavens, crashing through the rock, the Crimsonwings ascending to the skies once more.

mission.name: Reality Breaker
mission.desc: A claw rips through the fabric of reality, trembling as it digs desperately into the ground. A wolf-like creature pulls itself forward, emerging from the air. Crystals containing The Void's essence grow from the wolf's matted fur.

mission.name: The Will to Live
mission.desc: The beast's form quakes from the immense physical exertion. Its breaths are labored and uneven, wide eyes focused on the horizon. Its hind leg slips, disappearing from sight, but its other claws clench again as it pushes forward into existence.

mission.name: Cornered Beast
mission.desc: The wolf's eyes finally recognize your presence. The beast recoils, the hair on the back of its neck bristling. Its form flickers; its eyes flash with a ferocity that only cornered beasts know.

mission.name: Mercy
mission.desc: The wolf arches its back and howls. A long, agonizing song of a painful journey across dimensions. The creatures mimic its scream, creating an uneven cacophony that crescendos and shatters the tranquil night air.

mission.name: Barrier Down
mission.desc: The machine wheezes as it turns off. The particles it emits cease, the sky becoming lighter until the gray barrier eventually dissipates. And the earth begins to shake...

line.text: Er, do you hear that rumbling? What is it?

mission.name: Army of Undead
mission.desc: Footsteps pound, and an Undead army emerges from the forest! They move with surprising speed, heading towards you.

line.text: An entire army of Undead warriors... look out!

mission.name: Trapped Souls of the Barrier
mission.desc: You and Garrick fight off the Undead horde. To make matters worse, the Elementals are encouraged further by the Undead attack, stirring restlessly...

mission.name: A Skeleton Behind You
mission.desc: A skeleton has snuck up behind you! As you whirl around to prepare for an incoming attack, you stop yourself upon seeing a familiar face.

line.text: You fools! This was supposed to just be an information gathering mission...

mission.name: Redfeather's Barrier
mission.desc: Tarian joins you and Garrick in fighting against the Undead and Elementals. His gigantic ax is making quick work of the lesser Undead.

line.text: I suspect a previous Redfeather inhabitant crafted that machine. Not to keep Undead OUT...

mission.name: The Valley's Corruption
mission.desc: The desecrated village once housed the Redfeather Valley inhabitants. When a rift to The Void opened, the Avians were too weak to vanquish their enemies.

line.text: But to keep the corruption IN. The Void's power must have caused an Undead infestation.

mission.name: Uncontrollable Corruption
mission.desc: Although the Undead ranks are thinning, there are still a great amount of enemies. Garrick appeals to the Chaos leader for help.

line.text: Can't you use your influence to control them, sir?

mission.name: Valley of Undead
mission.desc: Tarian continues to aid you as best as he can. The valley has created a chokehold where the Undead cannot pass through without first passing your group, allowing you to protect the border.

line.text: They are not natives to Karthos, so I cannot. No, there is only one solution.

mission.name: Shall Not Pass
mission.desc: Undead continue to filter through the valley. They can sense the barrier's absence, now seeking to make it to the open world.

line.text: We must defeat them all so that they cannot harm the rest of the world.

mission.name: Missing Answers
mission.desc: Garrick pauses his assault to look up at the sky. Without the barrier, it is a deep blue, with sparse clouds and stars. There is no trace of the previous ray of light.

line.text: We still never figured out what was causing that light.

mission.name: The Light's Source
mission.desc: As if it had heard Garrick's musing, the ray of light abruptly blasts into the night sky again. It is accompanied by a bestial wolf howl, the source extremely close. Your eyes take a moment to adjust...

line.text: And there is our answer...
That creature has some unusual power to travel through dimensions...

mission.name: Plane Pain
mission.desc: The creature resembles that of a wolf, but crystals are going from its body. When the beast's howl ends, so too does the light. Its eyes land on you, a snarl twisting across its maw.

line.text: But the path to The Void Plane is closed, and it's caught between realities.
Its pain is stirring up the Undead and Elementals. If we beat it, it should let the others rest.

mission.name: The Tale of Pumpking
mission.desc: While traveling far to find the source of the light, Tarian tells Garick about the tragic tale of Pumpking, a king who only wanted to spread goodwill by giving children candy. And also his curse...

line.text: No one knows whether the tale of Pumpking is fiction or fairy tale.
It gives me the chills, sir.

mission.name: Pumpking's Appearance
mission.desc: Whoever says Pumpking's name is rumored to see the ghost of Pumpking. Possessed by morbid curiousity, Garrick can't help but test his luck when they make camp for the night.

line.text: Pumpking, Pumpking... three times and the myth is said to appear. But it can't be real, can it?
Pumpking?!

mission.name: More Treat Than Trick
mission.desc: The strange apparition lays a hollowed pumpkin by Garrick's feet, filled with bright wrappers inside it. The ghost turns, fading into the night...

line.text: Ahhh! Wait, who are you really?!
He's gone... but he left this pumpkin filled with candy. Thanks I guess?

mission.name: Oldest Landmark
mission.desc: At Malchior's request, you, Oda, and Elyse travel to search for more clues on where to find the Forgotten Hero's sealed companions. Tarragon Peak might be a good location to start.

line.text: The volcano at Tarragon Peak is one of the oldest known landmarks of Arcantica.
Be careful of the lurking dragons. Minus the danger, we might be able to find another one of the Forgotten Hero's sealed companions.

mission.name: Dragon Territory
mission.desc: The temperature is so intense that you were forced to park the airship away from the volcano's top. The landscape is barren rock with small pools of bubbling lava. Territorial dragons roam, looking for easy prey.

mission.name: Volcano Path
mission.desc: Lava lazily trickles down the volcano. Navigating up is becoming increasingly more difficult. Oda points to a cave near the side, away from the lava.

line.text: Fiona once told me that there was a cave path that lead directly to the volcano's top.
Let's try to find it.

mission.name: Cave's Secret
mission.desc: Cracks line the volcano's side, some large and others awkwardly small. The cave that Oda pointed out is claustrophobically tight, but you can feel a faint breeze traveling in the passage.

line.text: Wait, did you see that glimmer? There's something up ahead.

mission.name: Dragon Secrets
mission.desc: The narrow passageway opens and becomes wider. At Elyse's gesture, Oda lights a torch and holds it up, illuminating the area. Fossilized dragons are embedded in the rock, an unfamiliar language carved into the wall.

line.text: Are these the bones of dragons, or just depictions?
I recognize the writing. It's the monk script of my Order.

mission.name: Dragons and Monks
mission.desc: Oda brings the light closer to the inscriptions. He wipes away some of the dust, staring intently at the writing.

line.text: It says my Order and some other humans, dragon tamers, were once friends with the Dragons of Tarragon Peak. But... something happened.

mission.name: Tarragon Peak's History
mission.desc: Oda translates the writings, telling the story that has been left behind on the wall. It happened a long time ago...

line.text: Goblins attacked Tarragon Peak. They wanted the dragons to work for them. My people tried to help the dragons, but...
Oda... I'm sorry.

mission.name: To the Task at Hand
mission.desc: Oda shakes his head, turning away from the ancient writings. It seems there is little else you can learn from the wall.

line.text: Don't be. Now, let's go back to finding the seal.
Right. Let's keep searching for a way to the top of the volcano.

mission.name: Air Vent
mission.desc: You continue to traverse the cave. There are fewer dragons at the base, where the stone is cooler. Hot air pushes onto you, just a thin cool breeze coming from somewhere ahead.

mission.name: Volcano's Top
mission.desc: The path eventually leads you back outside. The air here is so hot that it is thick and heavy to breathe, with a excessive smell of sulfur.

line.text: It feels like I'm melting up here... let's search quickly.

mission.name: Ancient Dragon
mission.desc: A rock shifts uncertainly as the volcano rumbles. You look again and realize that it's not a rock, but a gigantic dragon's shoulder! The dragon is half the size of the volcano crater, its scales a mix of green and earthen hues.

line.text: Everyone, look out! I've never seen a dragon like that before!

mission.name: Dragon Tongue
mission.desc: There's a different look in this dragon's eyes compared to the wild dragons. Some spark of intelligence, a moment of recognition as it looks at you. Its mouth opens, a raspy sound coming forth.

line.text: Huh?

mission.name: Ambassadors
mission.desc: The images in the volcano play out before your eyes. The green dragon, proud, a leader of his kind. Grudgingly accepting of the humans who watched them with jealous eyes. The only trustworthy one came with the Insects from a faraway island.

mission.name: Alliance Formation
mission.desc: A gloved hand is placed on the dragon's snout. The trustworthy human makes a promise. With the dragons, she will stand. A mutual alliance of Rhynio and dragonkin. When she leaves, the dragon does not trust the others.

mission.name: Distress Fire
mission.desc: An army appears on the horizon. Goblins with greed in their eyes and chains in their hands. The dragons rally and fight, but Teroxis remembers the trustworthy's promise. He ascends to Tarragon's Peak, he lights the beacon, he waits for the trusted one to return.

mission.name: Onesided Loyalty
mission.desc: When did he realize he was watching the changing of seasons, the green on faraway lands turn to autumn leaves, the shift to lightly frosted mist? Tarragon is scarred, dragons subjugated, the goblins have left. Teroxis remembers the promise but has forgotten the face.

mission.name: The Long Wait
mission.desc: The dragon's words are slow and uncertain. Although the words are familiar to you, they are so broken that it is difficult to understand the dragon's meaning.

line.text: You... waiting for you?
You were waiting for us?

mission.name: Familiar Face
mission.desc: The dragon tries desperately to talk to you. Its words are halting and oddly pronounced, yet it refuses to give up. It squints at Elyse, bringing its snout fearfully close. Elyse stands her ground resolutely.

line.text: Mm... waiting. But... was for you? Familiar. I wait ... long time.
I think you have me confused for someone else...

mission.name: From the Past
mission.desc: Eventually the dragon pulls away from Elyse, instead pointing its nose to the volcano crater. You, Oda, and Elyse peer inside. From the lava's depths, you see images taking form and colors. Events from another time play out before your eyes like a film.

mission.name: Lost in Memories
mission.desc: The dragon is becoming increasingly disturbed at the images shown in the pool of lava. Its twitches become spasms, low growl turning into a fierce roar. It lunges at Elyse, but you push her out of harm's way just in time.

line.text: Rrrr...... ROAR!
Calm down! We're not trying to hurt you!

mission.name: Return to Present
mission.desc: After a brief scuffle, the wildness fades from the dragon's eyes. Its shoulders slump and it falls to the ground, no longer attacking or even defending.

line.text: Sorry... me miss friends...
The goblins no longer control the dragons. Your friends are free.

mission.name: Freed Friends
mission.desc: The dragon nods slowly at Oda's explanation. It seems to have accepted the group as friends instead of enemies.

line.text: Free... thank you.
This friend of yours that never came back... the one I remind you of. Do you know where she is?

mission.name: Chasing the Unknown
mission.desc: The dragon speaks again with painful slowness. Although it understands Elyse's question, the dragon has difficulty explaining the answer.

line.text: Mm... she go help the attacked land. She go help angels, Fallen Crest.

mission.name: The Fallen Crest
mission.desc: The dragon has named a group of angels called Fallen Crest. However, angels are known to be residents of a different land.

line.text: Fallen Crest Angels? I've only heard about Skyhaven Angels.

mission.name: Fallen Crest Mystery
mission.desc: Elyse has studied the power of many different artifacts and the lore of the land. It was her knowledge that lead Oda to finding the Seastone Citadel, and eventually the Seastone Staff.

line.text: I don't know them either. And I've read a lot of books on Arcantica's history.

mission.name: Sleepy Dragon
mission.desc: The volcano rocks shake lightly as the dragon opens its maw, giving a deep yawn. Given the language barrier, pressing the dragon for more answers would likely not yield results.

line.text: Mm. Me tired again. Sleep now.

mission.name: Clues from Tarragon
mission.desc: The dragon has calmed, leaving you to talk with your friends. Although the original purpose to Tarragon Peak wasn't successful, it seems you have acquired additional information.

line.text: We didn't find another seal, but we have a clue towards finding it.

mission.name: First Order Remnants
mission.desc: As you prepare to depart, Oda pauses before the dragon fossils and the inscriptions one more time. Another mystery has emerged, but there are pressing matters to attend to.

line.text: Hm... what was the First Order doing in Tarragon Peak? We'll have to solve that mystery some other time.

mission.name: Star's Sign
mission.desc: Yuriel was studying in his library when he felt a tremor of magical energy. Looking up in the sky, he saw a strange star, the source of the tremor. He followed its light to Tarragon Peak.

line.text: Ho hoo! Right on the eve of the holiday, a great disturbance did I feel!
But whooo, or what, is responsible? I must find out!

mission.name: Celebration
mission.desc: When Yuriel arrives at Tarragon Peak, he finds a strange sight. Decim holds a small device that emits a flame. He sets it down momentarily to help his dragon friend open a present, taking out a wooden glider for his dragonling's wings.

line.text: Oh boy, my very own flame lighter! What did you get, little buddy?
Awoo...!
Nice, a wing glider! Now you can fly even farther!

mission.name: Monster Love
mission.desc: Decim and the dragonling aren't the only ones with presents. Other dragons, the residents of Tarragon Peak, are clawing open presents.

line.text: Growhooo! -An open spitfire, to make roasting even easier!-
An invitation to a party! Nice, I've always wanted to be popular!

mission.name: Present Giver
mission.desc: Yuriel leaves the natives alone, continuing his search for the tremor's source. Eventually he reaches a pool of lava, emitting a strange blue light. A familiar Mecha stands near the pool...

line.text: Mechanical construct! What's that pool of magic behind you?

mission.name: The Giftbringer Scyer
mission.desc: Scyer reaches into the magical lava. Instead of burning him, his mechanical hand passes through harmlessly. He takes out a wrapped present, and hands it to Yuriel!

line.text: Yo, this pool appeared outta nowhere. I hand out presents because I care!

mission.name: Two Crests
mission.desc: After your adventure at Tarragon Peak, you consulted your friend and expert on the world's history, Yuriel of Skyhaven. Yuriel had never heard of the Fallen Crest, but he did know about a group of ancient angels called the Divine Crest.

line.text: Through the Mystic Library, we learned that the Divine Crest created Skyhaven.
Yet the Angels disappeared. Our last records detail them heading to Gladius.

mission.name: Beneath Skyhaven
mission.desc: Yuriel shows you the way to Gladius, which is directly beneath Skyhaven. Before you reach the structure that leads underground, you see a familiar face...

line.text: Samael? What are you doing here?
I have been looking into the history of our angel forefathers. I shall join you, for the time being.

mission.name: Ancient Learnings
mission.desc: The stone stairs wind deeper into the earth. The air becomes humid, a magical glow illuminating the path down. Eventually the path opens up to a scriptorium, with an arched ceiling and forgotten podiums of decaying paper.

line.text: The Divine Crest recorded everything they learned. Angels maintained their history here, and eventually they moved the books to the Mystic Library.

mission.name: Divine Secrets
mission.desc: A great door looms at the end of the room. Yuriel tries to push it open, but it refuses to budge. You and Samael push with all your strength, the door shifting forward with an ominious rumble.

line.text: What secrets were the Divine Crest keeping? I must know...

mission.name: Fire Arena
mission.desc: A gust of heat blows against your face, the world spinning slowly. When your vision clears, you see an arena suspended in the air, lava bubbling far beneath it.

line.text: What a strange sensation. Was that magic?
No time for that now. Look up there!

mission.name: Ethereal Welcome
mission.desc: Before the arena is a beautiful angel statue. It glows with an ethereal force, the energy conglomerating to the arena's center, forming a creature.

line.text: Greetings, warriors. I am Batara. We have waited for your arrival.

mission.name: The Warrior Batara
mission.desc: An Angel has appeared before you, unlike any of those you have seen from Skyhaven. He has traditional angelic wings and noble clothes, yet demonic horns and a wicked blade.

line.text: Ah! You are a surviving member of the Divine Crest?
No, I am a warrior, like you. The Divine Crest do not believe in fighting, even for the sake of survival.

mission.name: Divided Crests
mission.desc: Batara makes a distinction between himself and the Divine Crest. More angels appear from the arena's stands, rising as Batara speaks.

line.text: And so I became Fallen, to defend those who would not.

mission.name: The Strong Survive
mission.desc: Your task to find the Fallen Crest has been completed. However, Batara has his own conditions to be met before he is willing to help you...

line.text: Then if you are Fallen Crest-
No more questions! Step into the ring and prove your strength. If you win, I will answer.

mission.name: Round One
mission.desc: You step into the arena with Samael and Yuriel at your side, prepared to fight. The host of angels descend, all wearing similar garb to Batara. They attack!

line.text: First round .... Fight!!

mission.name: Angel Grunts
mission.desc: You cut through the first wave of enemies easily. The Fallen Angels fight with fiery swords and bows and arrows, but your group is familiar with their tactics.

line.text: Your underlings appear to lack training.

mission.name: Round Two
mission.desc: Batara declares you the winner of the first round. However, he still desires to see more of your abilities before divulging any secrets.

line.text: That was merely a warm-up. Now you will face shades of powerful enemies of your past. Second round... Fight!!

mission.name: Cast Below
mission.desc: The Divine Crest that cast aside their principles were cast into the pit. These Fallen savages who loved their violence were fit to fight each other, in an eternal quest to rise and become champion of the arena, winning their freedom.

mission.name: Willing Pawns
mission.desc: But war marched closer, and no amount of sweet words would dissuade those truly after blood. A secret bargain was struck, to rely on their Fallen warriors as a defense. A champion was chosen from the strongest, one who fought to protect his home, even if his home had abandoned him.

mission.name: Fallen Principles
mission.desc: The Fallen grew stronger. Some began to step into the pit willingly. Not to fight each other, but to hone their skills for the upcoming war. The common thread which binded them: their home, and the commander who lead them.

mission.name: Blind Loyalty
mission.desc: The Divine feared that their pawns had developed a mind of their own. Lured by false promises of unity, it was their deal with the dragon which whisked away all inhabitants of Skyhaven.

mission.name: Ghostly Opponents
mission.desc: Familiar enemies rise from the arena's ground. You see the faces of foes you've fought in the past. Some would be impossible to fight again, yet here they stand.

line.text: Fake visions of enemies we already defeated? Poor choice.

mission.name: Memory Specters
mission.desc: Your former foes are as tough as they were the first time. With Yuriel's spells and Samael's sword, you are able to push back the wave of enemies.

line.text: Even so, the magic to create specters from our memories is a fearsome ability.

mission.name: The Fallen's Revenge
mission.desc: A vision of a goblin appears to fight you. You recall fighting her long ago, under the sea. This time she has different underlings fighting against you...

mission.name: Past Folly
mission.desc: Another specter from the past appears. Darkness erupts from the ground, taking a monsterous form. The Void's manifestation fights against you again.

line.text: Be careful... this is the thing that was released from the Heart of Blue fire!
Although I have made mistakes in the past, I will not waver before my past folly.

mission.name: Past Pride
mission.desc: You and Samael guard your backs as you fight against the onslaught of enemies. Goblins seem to be the most common among your old foes, as you see another face emerge from your time in Goblin Rise Stronghold...

line.text: Time passes but the goblins remain the same. Bloodthirsty malcontents whose reach towards the sun leaves them burned.
Yet strike down one leader, and another takes their place.

mission.name: Warrior Victory
mission.desc: Batara is impressed with your fighting ability. You have successfully defeated scores of enemies in a row, without taking a break.

line.text: We have much in common.
You are a strong warrior. Then, I will give you the answers you seek...

mission.name: Batara's Truth
mission.desc: The Fallen Crest Angel admits that he is more than what his appearance suggests. He begins to tell you pieces of the answer...

line.text: Although it is true that I am Fallen Crest, to call myself a survivor would be an ill-fit term.

mission.name: Forgotten Clue
mission.desc: Yuriel recalls an important clue that had been forgotten during all the fighting. He presses Batara for more answers.

line.text: I felt it when we first entered. This isn't the real world, is it?

mission.name: The Dream's Return
mission.desc: Batara confirms Yuriel's theory. An entire legion of Fallen Crest Angels would have been difficult to hide from the world, especially being located beneath Skyhaven.

line.text: No, this is a shared dream. You passed through to the dream realm when you opened the doors in the scriptorium.

mission.name: Samael's Suspicion
mission.desc: Even if Batara is giving out answers freely, Samael has not been fooled. This person cannot be an ally. There are clues to suggest otherwise...

line.text: You're one of the Forgotten Heroes' companions, aren't you?

mission.name: Crimsonwing Formation
mission.desc: Batara is indignant at being called a 'companion.' He reveals the formation and the members of the Crimsonwings.

line.text: It's regrettable how history chooses to remember.
I unified the Avian Redfeathers, the Insect Rhynio, my Angel brothers of Crest, into one banner: the Crimsonwings.

mission.name: Round Three
mission.desc: Samael is holding his sword fiercely, while Yuriel prepares a spell. A new Angel enters the ring to fight...

line.text: We will stop you here, either way.
My freedom can only be stopped by those clean from The Void's touch. Can you make such a claim?
Now resolve yourself and fight one last match against the arena champion!

mission.name: Devious Activities
mission.desc: Fiona has noticed unusual goblin activity in Duskwillow. You agreed to meet up with her and get to the bottom of this mystery.

line.text: Thanks for coming, adventurer. The goblins can't be up to any good here.

mission.name: Duskwillow Rebuilt
mission.desc: When you last visited Duskwillow, the town had been ravaged by followers of The Void and Scylla. However, many of the once tattered buildings have been repaired. Yet the former inhabitants are nowhere to be seen, giving Duskwillow a serene, but ghostly vibe to it.

line.text: The Avian Redfeathers and Golden Crown Frogs lived here, until it was destroyed by The Void.
But they live elsewhere now. So who is repairing all these houses? Doesn't look like anyone is home...

mission.name: Remaining Raiders
mission.desc: Remnants of Scylla's army still patrol the coast, although they seem to be giving the town a wide berth - until they spot you. Recognizing you immediately, they launch an attack!

mission.name: Crafting Supplies
mission.desc: As you get farther into Duskwillow, you and Fiona spy goblins moving between the houses. You hide behind one of the empty yet repaired buildings, observing the goblins' movement in secret.

line.text: Look at that pile of supplies! Wood, nails, hammers... They have to be building some kind of war machine.

mission.name: New Goblin Boss
mission.desc: You recognize one of the goblins as Boldur, the new goblin leader that you ran into during your infiltration at Goblin Rise Stronghold. He seems to be directing the other goblins to build something.

line.text: I've seen enough. Let's see what Boldur has to say about this little operation of his.

mission.name: Goblin Panic
mission.desc: You and Fiona leave your hiding spot, approaching the goblins directly. It takes a moment for the goblins to see you coming. When they do, many of them drop the materials they're transporting, running around in panic.

line.text: Oy! Stop yer wailing! No one said it's break time yet.
Boldur. What's a bunch of goblins doing in Duskwillow?

mission.name: Boldur's Stand
mission.desc: The goblin forces are disorganized. Boldur stands his ground as you approach. A few of the goblins take heart at his response, readying their weapons as you get nearer.

line.text: Oho. It's the champion an' the blond girlie. If ya got a thing for me, you could always ask, instead'a following me all silent-like.
I'm still waiting for an answer.

mission.name: Construction Work
mission.desc: Boldur doesn't stutter as he matches Fiona's challenge head on. However, the answer was not one Fiona predicted...

line.text: We're fixin' up these houses.
Why?

mission.name: Missing Homes
mission.desc: The rebuilt houses are a testament to the goblins' work. They have been patched together with surprising care, only missing the inhabitants.

line.text: The Avians are still borrowin' the Elementals' Celestial Vault, ain't they? They need a home.
That's surprisingly nice for someone who tried to kill us.

mission.name: Goblin Truth
mission.desc: Boldur is indignant at Fiona's accusation. He explains his perspective on what happened in Goblin Rise Stronghold.

line.text: I never tried to kill ya! You realize my intervention saved yer life, right? That fight was faked.
Us goblins been fightin' and fightin'. But we can't do that forever.

mission.name: Bridges to Be Built
mission.desc: Boldur's desire to build is more than just the physical houses for the frogs and avians. He reveals his vision for the rest of his people.

line.text: Aye, it's time to build a bridge between our people. But words ain't enough for others to trust us.
Wait, so the reason why you wanted the Spellstone Hammer was to rebuild Duskwillow?

mission.name: Work Ahead
mission.desc: Boldur gestures to the array of wood and construction tools around the camp. There is an abundance of hammers and nails, further showcasing the goblins' intentions in Duskwillow.

line.text: Don't worry about it. We just gotta build things the ole fashioned way.
And I won't deny we had some personal use for it as well, heh.

mission.name: Forbidden Power
mission.desc: A power you thought once dead courses through the Seafolk's arms. Tainted crystals rise from the Merman's body, a wicked grin crossing his face.

mission.name: Power Clash
mission.desc: You hear the distant clash of hammer versus sword. The two goblins vie for power over their tribe, the others too hesitant to interfere in a battle between two potential leaders.

mission.name: Forgotten Foe
mission.desc: The Seafolk faces are vaguely familiar. You recall that many of them followed Xerkahn vigilantly, following her orders to betray King Proteus. The mercenaries' base lies not far below Duskwillow.

mission.name: Loyal Heretics
mission.desc: The Merman spews nonsense about continuing the will of Scylla and The Void. Fiona and her dragonlings fight fiercely, helping you keep the Seafolk forces at bay.

mission.name: Aftermath
mission.desc: You are having a dream. Angels and goblins lay still, the ground a canvas of the fallen. In the sky floats a city of marble, untouched by the fierce battle.

mission.name: Unending Fight
mission.desc: Metal upon metal rings out shrilly, a solitary blade continuing its onslought. Commander Batara refuses to rest, searching and fighting all foes he finds in the city's shadow.

mission.name: The Godless
mission.desc: He had shaken even the staunchest of believers. No miracle was coming to save them. If they wanted to live, then they had to create the miracle themselves.

mission.name: Eternal War
mission.desc: But this desperate search for unending foes to defeat only highlighted the death of justice, which had decayed into nothing more than petty vengeance. The dream of peace had faded, his troops holding onto the only reality they had come to know: war.

mission.name: From the Sea
mission.desc: A Seafolk with strange crystals growing from his skin approaches your group. With him are the thugs from the shore, wielding axes and cutlasses.

line.text: Boldur, I presume?
And you are?

mission.name: Inherited Debt
mission.desc: The Seafolk launch an attack! Fiona commands her dragons to protect the goblins. The two groups start fighting...

line.text: Xerkahn owes us a debt. If she cannot pay it, then you will in her stead.
There's too many of them for the goblins to fight. Let's send these raiders packing!

mission.name: Goblin Outcast
mission.desc: A goblin emerges from amidst the Seafolk ranks. He is surprisingly tall for a goblin, nearly twice the size of Boldur. A sword radiating dark energy is slung casually across his back.

line.text: Havin' a spot of trouble, Boldur? You need humans to fight for you?
Daknak! Yer banned from this camp for good reason. Get outta here.

mission.name: Power Struggle
mission.desc: Daknak shouts, his voice loud and confident. His gaze is directed at the goblins helping Boldur, words trying to take them over to a different side.

line.text: Goblins! Listen. Boldur bows to his enemies. Boldur is weak!
I take old alliance with Seafolk. I take back land! Boldur loses, but Daknak wins!

mission.name: Goblin Leaders
mission.desc: The goblins with Boldur have stopped fighting completely, hesitant to take a side between Boldur versus Daknak. Fiona is visibly upset at the turn of events, insisting for once, that they help a particular goblin.

line.text: This isn't even close to a fair fight. We have to help. If Daknak becomes the new leader, the goblins will go back to fighting everyone.

mission.name: Path Clearance
mission.desc: You start to move towards Daknak, but Boldur pulls you back. This is a greater fight than simply winning or losing. Boldur has a request...

line.text: I gotta beat Daknak alone to earn my kinsmen's respect. Keep those Seafolk off me in the meantime.

mission.name: Daknak's Departure
mission.desc: In Boldur's hand is a great hammer, which he previously had been using to repair the houses. His hammer meets Daknak's sword, sending it flying into the grass.

line.text: Grr... You ain't seen the last of us, chumps! Watch yer backs!

mission.name: Future Visions
mission.desc: The rest of the Seafolk flee the moment Daknak turns his back to Boldur. The other goblins whoop loudly and pat Boldur on his back.

line.text: World peace did sound like an ambitious goal for the goblins. You've got a lot of work ahead of you, Boldur.
Aye. That's why you folks gotta win against the Crimsonwings.

mission.name: Bigger Threat
mission.desc: Boldur laughs at the goblins' reaction, pushing them off playfully. After a few encouraging words to them, he turns his attention back to you, his face grim.

line.text: I know the Crimsonwings are gonna come after us next, if they beat you up.

mission.name: Latent Threat
mission.desc: Boldur gives you advice for your quest, in the hope of a brighter future. It seems that working together with the goblins could benefit both sides, and Boldur is keen to pick up on it.

line.text: Some of the goblins noticed a weird concentration of energy in Beetleton Bunker.
Might be one of those seals you're lookin' to undo, eh?

mission.name: Departure
mission.desc: You prepare to leave Duskwillow. Boldur's advice has given you a direction to search. The other goblins give you a hearty goodbye before diligently returning to their own work.

mission.name: Repaired Relationship
mission.desc: When you are about to leave, you realize Fiona has stayed in her same position. She offers a familiar looking hammer to Boldur.

line.text: Speaking of Beetleton, the Insects let me hold onto the Spellstone Hammer, but I think you can make better use of it, Boldur.
I'm going to stay here a while to help with construction.

mission.name: Revenge of the Storm
mission.desc: The commons are rising up! Their power is overwhelming! Stop them before they destroy the world! Or join them. I'm a mission description, not a cop.

line.text: *Whoosh* We come! *Whoosh* Revenge of the Commons! *Woosh*

mission.name: Revenge of the Dead, Part XXIV
mission.desc: I feel like we've been here before...

line.text: NYAAAA! We come for your bones! You know, to like... replace the ones you broke...
HAND EM' OVER!!!

mission.name: Revenge of the Snip Snip
mission.desc: I don't know what they are saying, but these crabs seem really upset.

line.text: *Snip*

mission.name: Revenge of the Woods
mission.desc: The common cards of the woods have gathered to defeat you!

line.text: We come, the denizens of the forest, to take our vengeance...
WOOF! :D

mission.name: Revenge of the Souls
mission.desc: The soul wisps have gathered, looking for vengeance for all their brothers who you've put into lanterns, and torches, or whatever ya'll do with little light spirits.

line.text: WooooOOOooooOOOOO... jerk!

mission.name: Revenge of the Revengest!
mission.desc: Some weirdo with a bunch of bombs has showed up. They seem like they know you but you can't place their face.

line.text: I HAVE RETURNED, PREPARE FOR OUR FATEFUL DUEL!

mission.name: Common Crusher Crew
mission.desc: The Legendary cards have arrived to put things back in their rightful place! Can they defeat the Common menace?!

line.text: Never fear! The Legend League has arrived!
Let's put these Commons back in their place!

mission.name: Common Squashing Squad
mission.desc: The Legendary cards have arrived to put things back in their rightful place! Can they defeat the common menace?!

line.text: YEEEEEEE HAWWWWWWW!

mission.name: Common Terror Team
mission.desc: The Legendary cards have arrived to put things back in their rightful place! Can they defeat the common menace?!

line.text: I don't feel so good. Can I go home? I miss Cindertooth.

mission.name: Common Conquering Club
mission.desc: The Legendary cards have arrived to put things back in their rightful place! Can they defeat the common menace?!

mission.name: Common Bashing Bunch
mission.desc: The Legendary cards have arrived to put things back in their rightful place! Can they defeat the common menace?!

line.text: What do we have here? This looks fun!

mission.name: Common Trashing Troupe
mission.desc: The Legendary cards have arrived to put things back in their rightful place! Can they defeat the common menace?!

line.text: Hello there.

mission.name: Beetleton Distortion
mission.desc: At Boldur's recommendation, you head to Beetleton Bunker to find the next seal. However, everything has changed since your last visit. Bright, aurora-like colors paint the walls, and strange mushrooms grow everywhere.

mission.name: Missing Town
mission.desc: The Insect town is conspicuously missing. A black hole which plunges even further into the earth's depths has replaced it. While on the hole's outskirts, you find Rayne...

line.text: Terrible... This is worse than I expected.
The elemental disturbance we investigated earlier has grown worse, creating this rift between realities. Although it looks like Beetleton, this place is an alternate reality.

mission.name: The Rift's Grasp
mission.desc: Rayne guides you through the mushroom-infested Beetleton Bunker. She curses her earlier carelessness of ignoring the Elementals' activity here.

line.text: A great energy emanates from that black hole.
Let us investigate. If we take care of it, perhaps the world will be able to heal itself.

mission.name: Nightmare Insects
mission.desc: The fighting only grows more intense as you travel deeper. You recognize some of the Insects' faces from your other visit in Beetleton. They had praised your deeds in closing The Void...

line.text: *Shrieeeek*
The Insects have gone mad due to the close proximity of The Void.

mission.name: Rift Monsters
mission.desc: Strange creatures roam Beetleton. They are drawn to your presence, fighting as if their very life depended upon it.

line.text: Awooo!

mission.name: Sign of Civilization
mission.desc: The strange-colored lights extend into the depths of the earth. Before you get close enough to observe where it leads, you see an Insect peering into the hole...

line.text: Could there be another sane person down here? Who is that?

mission.name: Unhappy Reunion
mission.desc: You see familiar grey and pink wings, an Insect with a red mane. She turns to meet you as you approach, a sorrowful expression upon her face.

line.text: You are...
We meet again, Champion. You did not ask for my name last time, but I am Agatha, the former leader of the Rhynio.

mission.name: Formerly Forgotten
mission.desc: It is the Insect Seer from the Forgotten Island. You had helped her regain her memories, and she had warned you of the Crimsonwings' plan.

line.text: So you took my advice and are looking to stop the Heroes' companions from freeing their leader.
This is the location of her last friend. It's only natural that we would meet again.

mission.name: The Lights' Source
mission.desc: Agatha is standing in front of the path towards the strange colored light source. When Rayne moves towards her, the Insect Seer remains blocking the path.

line.text: The source of the disturbance is up ahead. Please excuse us, but we are in a hurry.

mission.name: Betrayal
mission.desc: Agatha motions for Rayne to stop. There is a dangerous light in the Insect's eyes, causing Rayne to hesitate.

line.text: I am the one who opened the portal to the spirit world here.
Why? Are you not the one who provided us with the knowledge on how to stop the Crimsonwings?

mission.name: Family Ties
mission.desc: Elementals and the Feral Insects are drawn to the light. They coalesce towards Agatha, following her directive.

line.text: The Forgotten Hero is my daughter. Even though her purpose has been corrupted, I cannot abandon her so easily.

mission.name: Proxy Rebellion
mission.desc: The former Rhynio leader has revealed her connection to the Forgotten Hero. However, Rayne has little sympathy for Agatha's motives.

line.text: So you want us to stop them, but are too scared to do it yourself.

mission.name: To Guard a Guardian
mission.desc: Agatha is blocking your path forward. Behind her looms an enomorous black egg, which pulses with energy. From the ceiling descends multi-colored lights, but a closer look reveals that they are actually creatures.

mission.name: Wavering Resolve
mission.desc: A haunted expression has frozen on Agatha's face. Feral Insects shriek loudly, poison dripping from their mandibles. From the air, the spirits float down towards the battle, the temperature noticeably dropping a few degrees at their presence.

mission.name: Race Against Time
mission.desc: A sharp crack shatters through the sounds of combat. The black egg shudders, lines crawling up its shell. You redouble your efforts and slash through the Insect and monster hoard, but your path takes you straight to Agatha.

mission.name: Prisoner of Fate
mission.desc: Agatha has recovered from her momentary reverie. Her claws clench resolutely, beady eyes turning to you. Energy swirls around her as she prepares an attack, the Insects' shrieks and spirits' forming an ear-shattering cacophony.

mission.name: Designated Guardian
mission.desc: You are having a dream. Away from the thick jungle and amidst the sunny beach, Formos finds a human unconscious who has washed upon the sands. Although the Rhynio are divided on how to treat her, the Rhynio Elder adopts her, tasking Formos to guard her like her own child.

mission.name: War on the Horizon
mission.desc: Time skips. The human has grown older, and Formos has stayed close to her side. Ominous smoke floats above the ocean waves in the distance, the Hero and Formos setting sail towards the disturbance.

mission.name: Malcontents
mission.desc: Assassins and dissentients come hidden and in the open, drawing their blades against the appointed Hero. Before they even reach the same room, Formos cuts each down.

mission.name: Eternal Trust
mission.desc: She is the first to treat him more than just a tool. At night, she talks to him as if he could answer, revealing her ideals of a unified world - one without war. Formos knows the secret of peace: not the promises of a dragon, and not the trust of his compatriots - it lies in the future of this human.

mission.name: A Weak Heart
mission.desc: The Insect Seer shrugs, unmoved by Rayne's reprimand. She has her own reason for staying, even if Rayne disapproves.

line.text: What would you have me do? She has strayed from her path, but I cannot bring myself to harm her.

mission.name: Lessons to be Learned
mission.desc: Rayne only has disdain for Agatha's actions. Unlike other opponents who believe they are fighting for a cause, Agatha does not even agree with those whom she supports.

line.text: I would not be frightened to discipline my own daughter.

mission.name: Rise of Abyss Creatures
mission.desc: Strange, zombie-like creatures climb out of the rift. Their aura is familiar to the ones you fought in The Void Plane.

mission.name: Parting Advice
mission.desc: The Undead and Insects follow Agatha's commands. They seek to overwhelm you with numbers, throwing themselves at you with reckless abandon.

line.text: You had best beat me quickly.

mission.name: A Goal to be Stopped
mission.desc: The strange lights from above are slowly moving towards the center of Beetleton Bunker, towards a gigantic black egg. Agatha gestures, pointing your attention towards the anomaly.

line.text: When he breaks through the last barrier of that shell, then the guardian Formos will be free.

mission.name: Time Limit
mission.desc: The monsters continue to come in endless waves. All you can do is to press forward towards Agatha. There is no time to think of a plan...

mission.name: The Shell of a Warrior
mission.desc: It's difficult to gauge how much time you have left before the lights finish converging. Following the path, you find that they shine down on a black egg with a translucent shell.

line.text: This is as far as we can go. The Elementals were restless due to the close proximity of the spirit world in this location.
Wait, what's that up ahead?

mission.name: Egg of Life
mission.desc: Behind the egg's shell you can see a darkened silhouette. A creature - or a person - something is alive and moving inside the egg.

mission.name: Rebirth
mission.desc: The sound of sword slices rip through the air. The egg shell cracks, the silhouetted creature tearing through the wall. Foul smelling liquid explodes from the egg, the darkened creature stepping out...

mission.name: The Last Companion
mission.desc: The lights have stopped moving. Chunks of the shell crack and flake to the ground. Before you stands a cloaked Insect: Formos Ebonclaw.

line.text: A quiet one, are you... Judging from his aura, this must be the companion that Agatha wanted to release.

mission.name: World's Rebellion
mission.desc: The earth rumbles. The ceiling shakes uncertainly, earth particles dusting the ground. The world's instability is coming to a head with the seal unlocked, the Distorted Beetleton world threatening to vanish.

line.text: This place is just a glimpse of an alternate reality. With the egg hatched, its tether to our world has been severed.

mission.name: Cracking Under Pressure
mission.desc: The earth rumbles. The ceiling shakes uncertainly, earth particles dusting the ground. The world's instability is coming to a head with the seal unlocked, the Distorted Beetleton world threatening to vanish.

line.text: If the egg cracks completely, we'll run out of time. This is the last companion. We cannot afford to fail here!

mission.name: Deserted
mission.desc: You wake up to the beating sun shining down upon your back. The earth is dry and cracked, a wasteland of rock and sand greeting your vision. You sense a hostile presence draw near...

line.text: An intruder has been spotted. Eliminate tresspassers!

mission.name: Frog Attack!
mission.desc: A squadron of frogs in tribal attire attacks you! While you fend them off, a blast of dark energy tosses asside one of the frogs. Aria runs in to help you.

line.text: Looks like you could use my help, just like always, Adventurer.

mission.name: Missing Time
mission.desc: With Aria's help, you are able to make short work of the frog squadron. The two of you catch up on the current state of affairs...

line.text: It was quite a blow that you decided to go missing for the last two weeks after your excursion to Beetleton.
What in the world were you doing? Well, whatever... what's important is that you're here now.

mission.name: Frogs of a Feather
mission.desc: Aria begins moving through the wasteland, and you follow her closely. Roaming Undead and the Frogs from earlier continue to hound you, attacking anything foreign within the Salt Wastes.

line.text: Those Dawnglow frogs got corrupted by the Forgotten Hero's friends.
They all think they're angels in spirit! What a bunch of lunatics.

mission.name: History Unearthed
mission.desc: The two of you are traveling through the Salt Wastes. Aria has a particular direction in mind, leading you forward.

line.text: Still, now's a good time to be back. This is where The Void first infected my mind.
I'm certain it's where the Crimsonwings plan to release their leader.

mission.name: Stone Temple
mission.desc: Eventually the two of you reach a temple, hidden away in the crags of the rock. Stone pillars have been chiseled from the rock, a staircase leading inside.

line.text: We'll stop the Hero from leaving the spirit world. Let's go, adventurer.

mission.name: Channelers
mission.desc: Frogs and Undead have taken over the temple. The frogs are scattered about, groups channeling some kind of energy...

line.text: Rribbit! You are too late. We will open the portal to The Abyss and free our leader!
But you'll also unleash The Void! We won't let you do that.

mission.name: Runic Defenses
mission.desc: Inside the temple are four pillars with runes attached to them. One of the frogs is channeling some kind of energy that dances between the four pillars, creating an electric square.

mission.name: Runic Meltdown
mission.desc: You and Aria push your way through the Temple's forces. The channeling in the square is growing more intense, lightning crackling between the runes.

line.text: This is escalating quickly. There isn't much time left.

mission.name: Temporary Solution
mission.desc: Eventually you and Aria manage to clear out the rest of the forces, preventing them from continuing their dark magics. The magical energy between the pillars fades. Aria inspects the area.

line.text: We've managed to stop them this time... but unless we do something about the Temple, more Crimsonwings will try again later.

mission.name: Aria's Sin
mission.desc: The runes have cracked from the abrupt flux of energy. With the right power source, they might be returned to a functional state, perhaps even benefitting your cause.

line.text: No one knows this area better than me. After all, this is where The Void first touched me.

mission.name: The Void's Birthplace
mission.desc: Aria reminisces about her first time in the Salt Wastes. When she first met you, she had fought under the corruption of The Void in Elaria.

line.text: I thought it coincidence at first, but now it makes sense. The Void is particularly strong here. It might even be its origin point into our world.

mission.name: Stealing Technology
mission.desc: Aria attempts to hook up a new power source to the runes. With the Frogs still nearby, any form of defense could prove to be useful.

mission.name: Counter Surge
mission.desc: While Aria is fiddling with the magical runes, the energy around them abruptly jumps back to life! They crackle with electric power...

line.text: Ugh! What... what is this energy?!

mission.name: Dark Strike
mission.desc: Shades from the past flicker at each one of the runes. Former nemeses appear at each one of the runes, their form faint and corporeal.

line.text: The path towards Harmony stands before us.

mission.name: Enemy Forces
mission.desc: A dark vortex appears in Aria's hand, as she prepares a magical attack. The temple's energy continues to run haywire, bolting the floor randomly with power.

line.text: Stand back, adventurer, I'm going to unleash a dark attack!

mission.name: Crimson Frogs
mission.desc: Aria's dark bolt harmlessly phases through the apparition of Batara. One of the frogs motions for the group to attack. The Crimsonwings start a new wave of attack, trying desperately to keep you busy while the Heroes' Companions continue their magic.

line.text: Strength is not the sole condition of victory. You fought well, but this is the end.

mission.name: Energy Reaction
mission.desc: The energy that the three companions are generating is incredible. The entire Temple glows with magic, radiating from them. Something appears at the Temple's center...

line.text: Now come forth!
Leave the prison which trapped you!

mission.name: One Way
mission.desc: One final blast of energy, and the three companions have vanished. Before you lies a magical door, shining and wavering with energy. You could reach out and touch it...

line.text: This is- some kind of portal. We're going to have to close it from the inside.

mission.name: Stubborn Resolve
mission.desc: Aria stops you before you can touch the door. She looks you fiercely in the eye as she explains her plan.

line.text: Adventurer. Let me do this. If it wasn't for me, then The Void wouldn't have grown so strong.

mission.name: Aria's Redemption
mission.desc: Aria has something she wants to prove to you and the others. However, her stubborness could create only further danger...

line.text: That's why I... Don't you dare try to stop me. I'm going to do it!

mission.name: To Purify the Past
mission.desc: Aria pushes you back roughly, causing you to stumble on the ground. Before you can stop her, she runs up to the door that has manifested, opening it...

mission.name: Do Unto Others
mission.desc: Aria stops before the door, turning to you. An unusually soft smile has replaced her normal scowl. The door's light behind her makes her seem to radiate...

line.text: You keep risking your life to save others.
Now it's about time that I do the same for you.

mission.name: Gate to Another Realm
mission.desc: Aria opens the door. You leap to your feet, dashing towards her before you can properly think. If Aria enters alone, you feel you might never see her again...

mission.name: First Light
mission.desc: A Frog with a rotund belly blocks your path. The others congregate around him, forming a wall between you and the Companions. Tanit raises her wing towards the center, a brilliant line of light forming.

mission.name: Second Light
mission.desc: You crash through the frog troops with all of your might. The rotund Frog laughs deeply, slapping his belly, even as his forces fall like flies. Batara raises his hand, another light connecting him to the room's center.

mission.name: Third Light
mission.desc: Aria shrieks as her magic does nothing to the light. It must be stopped with physical force. You're almost at the center, when another Frog tackles you to the ground. Formos raises his claw, a third light joining with the others.

mission.name: Final Fight
mission.desc: You push the Frog off you. The light has combined, before shutting off all at once. A brilliant door stands in its place, the Companions snapping out of existence, as the last of the Frogs fall to your might.

mission.name: True Darkness
mission.desc: The brilliant light of the door disappears as it closes behind you. In stark contrast darkness lies before you, so thick that you cannot tell the difference between having your eyes shut or open.

mission.name: Hint of Familiarity
mission.desc: There is no scent or discernment of your surroundings, the featurelessness reminding you of a dream. Then, a faint light glows some distance away. It grows closer, the shape and voice of someone familiar...

line.text: Who's there?! Show yourself!

mission.name: Faithful Friend
mission.desc: Aria is trying her best to sound annoyed, but her face belies her true relief. Energy radiates from her hand, providing the small amount of illumination, at least enough to light up your surrounding area.

line.text: Since you're here now, we'll have to make the best of it.

mission.name: Condemned
mission.desc: Taking a look around, you realize... you know this place. Although a few features are different, you are certain that this is the same Abyss where Bluefire condemned you before the final fight with him. You rely the info to Aria...

line.text: This is the place where Bluefire trapped you, Oda, and Elyse? That can only mean one thing...
This must be The Abyss. The resting place of anything taken by The Void, and home of darkness and monsters.

mission.name: Lingering Void
mission.desc: You and Aria attempt to traverse the foreign land. Strange monster creatures, and dragons that faintly resemble Bluefire, are drawn by Aria's light and attack you.

line.text: We might have closed the door by using it, but now we're trapped inside.
We'll have to defeat the Crimsonwing Champion before we even think about leaving.

mission.name: Enemy Soul
mission.desc: A powerful dark energy radiates further within. Aria leads you closer to it. You find another person.

line.text: Is that... her? Prepare well, and we'll approach...

mission.name: Crimson Hero
mission.desc: A human stands before you. Her eyes are closed, hands resting upon a golden spear. As you and Aria approach, she opens her eyes.

line.text: You! Are you the leader of the Crimsonwings? You've caused a lot of trouble!

mission.name: Mistrust
mission.desc: Dark energy emanates from the human before you. The strange monsters rise in the shadows behind her, coming towards you with great vengeance.

line.text: People... cannot be trusted.

mission.name: Source of Conflict
mission.desc: The monsters are responding to the human's aura. Her eyes are half glazed, seeming to look through you without properly registering your presence.

line.text: When given great power, they misuse what they have to take selfishly. Their differences divide them; the source of all our conflict.
Is she possessed by The Void's power? Just like what happened to Oda and Elyse... Let's give her a chance to explain once we beat her.

mission.name: Remembered Hero
mission.desc: After clearing out the monsters surrounding the human, her eyes clear. She looks around as if seeing her surroundings for the first time.

line.text: I... what happened? There were strange thoughts in my head, but now...
Right, I remember now. My name is Vel. And the reason why people are so beautiful is because of their differences.

mission.name: Hero's Truth
mission.desc: Aria harbors doubts over the human's sudden change in personality. However, the monsters seem to have calmed.

line.text: What nonsense are you saying?
I've caused you all a great amount of trouble, and I'm sorry for that.

mission.name: Cursed Memories
mission.desc: Vel explains her past and how she ended up in The Abyss. Although you've heard the story in fragmented pieces before, she is able to fill in the gaps for her disappearance.

line.text: When I fought against Bluefire, he cursed me, and sent me to the Abyss.
I knew I would lose my mind here, but I had to go. It's the only way to truly defeat The Void.

mission.name: Wyld
mission.desc: Atlas's form stands twisted before you, when a memory comes unbidden into your mind: A mighty tree rises from the earth, green plants and vibrant flowers blossoming around it. The earth heaves a sigh, the land cracking as Atlas's might claims the path against fire and the sky.

mission.name: Aether
mission.desc: Solaron's form stands twisted before you, when a memory comes unbidden into your mind: Fierce winds wearing down the tallest mountains, grinding it down through the passage of time until nothing but dust remains. Clouds swell until they burst with rain, claiming earth and fire.

mission.name: Chaos
mission.desc: Vulcanos's form stands twisted before you, when a memory comes unbidden into your mind: Raging fire consumes the forests, dark smoke overtaking the white clouds. The flames claim all that they touch, scorching the earth and smoke claiming the sky.

mission.name: Void
mission.desc: An unclear shadow stands before you, when a memory comes unbidden into your mind: the people caught in this maelstrom of elements cry for peace. The dream grows in their hearts, larger and larger, until the dream realizes itself. It will take away the elements. It will bring harmony...

mission.name: The Void's Entity
mission.desc: Aria is not about to let a stranger claim victory over Bluefire when you've already received that honor. However if Vel is to be believed, then The Void is something greater than one figurehead...

line.text: Sorry to break it to you, but we've already defeated Bluefire. The Void has been sealed.
Bluefire might be defeated, but The Void is much greater than a single dragon.

mission.name: Greatest Foe
mission.desc: Vel explains the source of The Void. Although The Void hadn't always existed in the world, it had come from somewhere... it had leaked in to the normal plane of reality.

line.text: What do you mean?
This place's existence is proof enough. The Void isn't an entity, but a concept. It still exists here... its source is our dreams.

mission.name: Another Void Prisoner
mission.desc: A proper full explanation would take too much time. Vel tries to explain it in a way that you and Aria would be able to grasp quickly.

line.text: You are making my head hurt.
Haha... In short, there is still a remnant left to free from The Void.

mission.name: Abyss Cursed
mission.desc: The Void has touched more than just individuals. Vel explains her reason for coming into The Abyss...

line.text: Anything touched by The Abyss is cursed. Not just me, but the founding pillars of our world.

mission.name: World's Foundation
mission.desc: When it comes to magic, Aria can at least follow along. The three of you begin traveling through The Abyss, fending off stray monsters.

line.text: The founding pillars of our world would be the three factions: Aether, Chaos, and Wyld.

mission.name: Titan Embodiment
mission.desc: The Void has claimed more than you feared. Even since before you arrived in Arcantica, The Void had claimed that which founded the world itself - the three factions.

line.text: Yes. The spirits of Solaron, Vulcanos, and Atlas reside here...
The embodiments of the three factions.

mission.name: Unleashing the Elements' Aftermath
mission.desc: After finding and defeating the three Faction leaders, they all seem to have come to their senses. The three of them surround you, Aria and Vel, casting some kind of power.

line.text: It's done. The Factions are finally, truly free.

mission.name: Titans' Parting Gift
mission.desc: Each of the three titans radiate their own aura - Vulcanos's fire, Atlas's earth, and Solaron's wind. The three magical energies combine, surrounding the three of you.

line.text: Look at that power. What are they doing?
They're sending us home.

mission.name: Another Void Prisoner
mission.desc: When the energy finally goes away, you find yourself back in the Salt Wastes. Alongside you are Aria and Vel.

line.text: It seems we've succeeded but failed. The Void has been resealed, but we've come back with the Hero we were trying to stop!

mission.name: Vel's Promise
mission.desc: Thankfully Vel seems to have kept her mind after the travel. No longer cursed by The Abyss, it seems like change is on the horizon for Arcantica.

line.text: Have no fear. My mind has been cleared, and my followers will have forgotten everything they did while under The Void's influence.

mission.name: Adventure's End
mission.desc: Vel is no longer the leader of the Crimsonwings. With The Void and The Abyss fully being sealed, she has become just another adventurer, like you.

line.text: I doubt they'd even remember who I am. But that's fine.

mission.name: A Promise Redelivered
mission.desc: With her newfound freedom, Vel has plans to travel the world. She bids you and Aria farewell, wishing the best for the world.

line.text: The world will no doubt change after today, but I believe you're more than capable of handling it.
As for me, I have a promise I still need to fulfill. I'm sure we'll meet again in the future.

mission.name: Adventure's Dawn
mission.desc: Peace has returned to the world. The troublesome Crimsonwings have disbanded, all the tribes returning to their respective homes. Soon after, Oda approached you for a favor...

line.text: Adventurer, will you return with me to Seastone Citadel? I received a missive from my fellow First Order monks, requesting aid.

mission.name: First Order Request
mission.desc: The missive Oda mentioned contains little details. The previous Keeper of the Order, the monk Kensho, had mentioned a threat that could harm their continent.

mission.name: Water Guardians
mission.desc: You travel with Oda to the Seastone Citadel. As you approach the bridge in the midst of the waves, water elementals surround you!

line.text: The elementals here are restless. Could this be the threat that my Master warned us about?
Let's take care of them.

mission.name: Elemental Infestation
mission.desc: After clearing out the Elementals near the stone bridge, you procceed into the Seastone Citadel. However, you find that the interior has been overrun by even more Elementals!

line.text: The elementals are everywhere!

mission.name: Elemental Citadel
mission.desc: Seastone Citadel is crawling with wind and water elements. They violently attack you on sight, although they seem oddly at peace with Oda... until he helps repel them back.

line.text: I only pray that my fellow Keeper is safe.

mission.name: Keeper Kensho
mission.desc: The fight continues, the Elementals having dominion over the entire Seastone Citadel. Eventually you hear the solid patter of footsteps, and the slow clank of a staff. An old wizened monk descends the stairs.

line.text: Master Kensho! Are you unharmed?
Of course, Keeper Oda. No need for that 'Master' title anymore. We're equal rank, after all.

mission.name: Old Ally
mission.desc: The wizened monk waves a hand, the Elementals retreating from your presence. Kensho has a big smile across his face, now that Oda has finally returned.

line.text: It's been too long, Keeper Oda. Thank you for heeding my message. Tell me, was the Seastone Staff useful in your endeavors?

mission.name: The Staff's Power
mission.desc: Oda's initial excitement fades away. Although it pains him to do so, he must inform Keeper Kensho the fate of the Seastone Staff.

line.text: Yes, Keeper Kensho. We used the Seastone Staff to seal away The Void.

mission.name: Missing Seastone Staff
mission.desc: The Seastone Staff had passed hands multiple times after its initial theft in Beetleton Bunker. However, the Staff had been stolen from the thieves too, and from there Oda lost the staff in the next scuffle.

line.text: However, I have failed in my duty. The Staff was stolen away by the goblins and Dawnglow frogs. Even now, I am still looking for it.

mission.name: First Order Trust
mission.desc: Kensho takes the news surprisingly well. Although he had been loathe to part with the artifact initially, he trusts that Oda will be able to retrieve the stolen artifact.

line.text: Regrettable, but I trust you'll find it again. What's important is that you're here now.

mission.name: Kensho's Concern
mission.desc: The conversation turns to the current dilemma that Kensho had written about. Something big is brewing in the world... a new threat...

line.text: Why did you call us out here?
Oda... steel yourself. There is something you must see.

mission.name: Unbelievable Sight
mission.desc: Kensho waves his hand. The forms of the lurking elementals shimmer, before transforming into humans! They are garbed in similar attire to Oda and Kensho, each having the signature beads of the First Order around their necks.

line.text: The other monks of the First Order... you're alive!

mission.name: Brewing Storm
mission.desc: Dark clouds gather in the sky, a chilled wind sweeping through the stone walls. Rain begin to fall, lightly pattering against the citadel. The monks' forms waver between human and Elemental.

mission.name: Forbidden Pact
mission.desc: Kensho reaches out his hand, meeting the wispy tendril of a wind Elemental. Its energy seeps further, soaking into Kensho's body. The air becomes more and more frigid with each passing second.

mission.name: Nirvana
mission.desc: The rain falls faster, the wind's whisper beginning to crescendo. The Elemental has completely fused with Kensho. His form is barely human, the shape vaguely familiar, but comprised of air and swirling water.

mission.name: Battle of Keepers
mission.desc: You and Oda flee. Desperately you run through the halls, the Elementals right on your heels. When at last you reach the entrance, you are too late. Kensho blocks the gate, the hoard of Elementals promising a fierce fight.

mission.name: Ghostly Legend
mission.desc: While researching myths, Yuriel finds Rayne at Seastone Citadel. Rayne tells him the story of Pumpking, the ghostly spirit of a king who wanted to spread goodwill by giving children candy.

line.text: ...And that is why, to this day, no one dares take the Pumpking's name in vain.
A fascinating story, but just a story, nonetheless. There appears to be no basis for this so-called curse.

mission.name: Pumpking's Curse
mission.desc: It is said that whoever says Pumpking's name three times will summon him back into the world of the living. A scholar and scientist, Yuriel scoffs at the prospect of a curse and conducts an experiment of his own...

line.text: Hm, Rayne was adamant about the curse being true, but I'd like to see with my own eyes...
Pumpking, Pumpking, Pumpking!
Hoo hoo hoo, just as expected, nothing.

mission.name: Pumpking's Appearance
mission.desc: Yuriel waits for an hour, but nothing seems to happen. He turns his back to Seastone Citadel and, to his shock, finds a dark figure waiting behind him! It leaves a pumpkin in front of Yuriel's talons, and disappears...

line.text: Ack! Have mercy!
He left a pumpkin full of candy and disappeared. What a strange fellow!

mission.name: Phantom Monks
mission.desc: A choked sob escapes Oda. His friends and family, previously thought dead, now stand alive before him. As he reaches out to touch one, his hand dispells the illusion, revealing an Elemental.

line.text: What... is this? They're not real?

mission.name: Aether's Will
mission.desc: The Elementals have disguised their forms to look like the monks from the First Order. However, getting close to them dispells it quickly. Oda's joy quickly breaks into sorrow.

line.text: It's a vision of what could come to pass if we were successful, Oda. Lord Solaron has been freed, and we must resume his will to conquer the Wyld and Chaos.

mission.name: New Aether Leader
mission.desc: Kensho is working together with the Elementals. Somehow he is able to control them, not only to act as guardians for Seastone Citadel, but also to have them masquerade as other monks.

line.text: Samael has fallen, corrupted by The Void. He is impure. We need a new leader of Aether.

mission.name: Oda, Void Vanquisher
mission.desc: Kensho heaps praise upon Oda. However, Kensho's own dreams do not align with Oda's desires...

line.text: Oda, you have stood against the might of The Void, and triumphed. None could be better suited to lead the Aether and revive our order!

mission.name: Oda's Vision
mission.desc: Oda is heartbroken to hear of Kensho's plan. Everything Oda has done has been to restore balance to the world wrecked by The Void. Yet Kensho wants to conquor the Chaos and Wyld...

line.text: What are you saying? I've been working for everyone to live together peacefully. We don't need to divide ourselves as Aether anymore.

mission.name: Kensho's Ambitions
mission.desc: The Elementals move in closer as Oda and Kensho disagree on the next course of action. Kensho has built up a small elemental army in the Seastone Citadel.

line.text: And besides, that, I... I am not as pure as you think. If it wasn't for the adventurer, I would have lost myself while confronting The Void.
Lord Solaron has spoken, Oda. It is not a choice.

mission.name: Elemental Fusion
mission.desc: Kensho holds up his staff. A strange blue energy concentrates around him, the Elemental spirits being drawn to him... drawn INTO him. Kensho is absorbing all of their powers!

line.text: The Elementals will correct your mind.
No! Joining your life force with the Elementals has warped your reason! That technique is forbidden.

mission.name: Pursuit
mission.desc: Kensho has fused with the Elementals. More than just commanding them, his energy belongs to them as well. His form has gained great power from this transformation, but Oda would rather not fight him at all.

line.text: Adventurer, run! We have to get out of here.

mission.name: Citadel Escape
mission.desc: The gathering of Elementals is fearsome. You agree to Oda's quest and join him, running through the stone halls of Seastone Citadel, searching for the exit.

mission.name: Solaron's Will Aftermath
mission.desc: Your fight against Kensho was fierce. In the end, he vanished in a flash of light. The elements disappear with him. Oda looks back at Seastone Citadel.

line.text: Master Kensho... I can't believe he's fallen so far.

mission.name: Missive's End
mission.desc: You give Oda time to mourn what happened. He takes a few seconds to collect himself, before approaching you. He motions to the airship.

line.text: I'm sorry. I'll be okay, I'm just... surprised. We should tell the others what happened here.

mission.name: Unknown Titan Forces
mission.desc: Kensho's missive was eerily accurate. The events at Seastone Citadel were just one part of the coming storm....

line.text: Solaron is just one of the three titans. If he was orchestrating Keeper Kensho's movements, we should assume the worst for Atlas and Vulcanos, too.
Hopefully we can stop them before this grows out of control.

mission.name: Colorful Companions
mission.desc: After journeying to Karthos, the residents there informed you that the Chaos leader, Tarian, had traveled back to the origin point of The Void. Aria goes with you to explain the potential dangers of Vulcanos.

line.text: I don't mind you sticking around, but did you really need to bring this guy with us?
Yo! It's been a long time! Now it's my time to shine!

mission.name: Chaos Mission
mission.desc: You and Aria travel the lonely path up the hill, crows cawing in the distance. Scyer runs up the hill, then back down, then back up again.

line.text: A search for a skeleton, on a spooky ol' hill, really gets me goin' on adrenaline.
Any mood that might have been set here is already gone thanks to you, Scyer.

mission.name: Undead Assault
mission.desc: Spirits and Undead rise from the ground. With a snarl, they pounce upon you and your group! Scyer opens the hatch to his fire reserves, while Aria casts a spell.

mission.name: Void's Center
