mission.desc: Power without focus is weak. Although a bundle of sticks may be impossible to break, each individual one is simple to snap in half. Without proper use, even the strongest power bends beneath order.

mission.name: Aether Flaw
mission.desc: Order without purpose is meaningless. Its stifling presence limits creativity to simpler solutions and resolutions. Men who exist to serve rules forget he foundation on why such rules were created.

mission.name: Wyld Flaw
mission.desc: Untamed growth simply becomes that which is uncontrollable. Untamed growth lacks both discipline and direction; a shadow of what it could be with proper nourishment.

mission.name: Void Flaw
mission.desc: Filled with nothing removes desire for more. Without desire for more, nothing grows or has the potential to become greater than what it is. This apathy can control the other elements, but by itself would mean the end of everything.

mission.name: Return to Conflux
mission.desc: You return to the real world. The Power Coils emit their energy beams again, giving Viracocha the new data you received about the Factions.

mission.name: Renewed Viracocha
mission.desc: Viracocha lets out a ferocious roar. New energy is flowing to him, now from the different sectors of the land. The ground and sky light up, sending their energy to him.

line.text: I feel it!
This power; this energy... I can control it!

mission.name: Warning Signs
mission.desc: Finally the strange display stops. The earth's rumbling stops. Viracocha looks at his arms, flexing his strength. He appears quite pleased.

line.text: And not a moment too soon. Look!

mission.name: Titans' Challenge
mission.desc: In the horizon, from different corners - you see that the power convergence has attracted the other titans' attention. Vulcanos, Solaron, and Atlas are flying your location!

mission.name: Defending the Land
mission.desc: Elemental creatures rise from the earth! Each has spawned from the different sections of the Conflux land. You, Elyse, Oda, and Cedric split up to tackle the enemies.

line.text: We'll handle the ground level.
If we can keep the monsters at bay, then Viracocha can focus on the Titans.

mission.name: One Under Viracocha
mission.desc: The titans hurl themselves against Viracocha. Yet the Mecha Titan is able to repell them easily, flipping them over like a wrestler. He roars again, the three faction titans returning to spiritual essence.

line.text: It... is... done.

mission.name: Mission Accomplished
mission.desc: Finally, the threat of the titans has been extinguished. They will no longer be able to control the hearts of Wyld, Chaos, and Aether. Viracocha has become an arbitrator of Titans.

line.text: Wow! You really are amazing, Viracocha.
But what will you do now with all this power?

mission.name: Power to Rule
mission.desc: With his task now complete, and the Titans judged and safely out of the way, Viracocha is now a being of immeasurable power. He sinks down to the ground, sitting gently.

line.text: This power is greater than what the world needs.

mission.name: Power to Serve
mission.desc: Viracocha's eyes close. Steam hisses as it escapes the cogs near his joints, his body growing more and more rigid.

mission.name: Sleeping Giant
mission.desc: He speaks slowly. With the world now saved, his purpose is now complete. His dream is now complete; he has become a Titan among Titans.

line.text: Have no fear, little ones...
I shall sleep.

mission.name: True Peace
mission.desc: The adventure has come to an end. With The Void defeated, the three factions had gone out of control. Now, with Aether, Chaos, and Wyld bound to Viracocha, the rest of the continent can remain free.

mission.name: Adventure's End
mission.desc: Across the charred lands, you see familiar faces approaching you. They all look tired, covered in dust and wounds, but you see joy in their faces. Your friends have come for you!

line.text: Finally... we'll have peace on our continent. Now I can really become a Keeper.
You've been it for a long time, Oda.
A state of being is not necessarily a state of mind, my friend.
Now you're speaking nonsense... Right there! That's the proof that you're a Keeper!
Interesting.
Anyway... You did a great job, adventurer. Viracocha was our trump card against the titans, but I think you're the real hero in this story.
We... I... I couldn't have done it without you!
Don't look at me like that, I can be nice. Sometimes.
I see Viracocha was victorious! Knowledge, as always, was the key to our victory!
What are you gonna do now, Yuriel?
I will spend a season surrounded by books, and rubble!
The Mystic Library was destroyed by Razi, but I'll make sure to recover the books and rebuild it!
Hey, adventurer. Even if I couldn't wield it, I'm glad Dyrnwyn was helpful to our cause.
I should keep it and return to Queen Leyla's side. There's much to do in Skyhaven and maybe, some day, I will finally atone for my sins.
I think you're on the right path, Samael!
A fine victory, indeed.
I think I'm getting too old for this, though. Maybe this time I can actually retire and live a peaceful life.
You're fine, Cedric. Retire tomorrow! Today you celebrate with us!
Well, I guess my 'ol bones can handle a little bit of dancing!
Whoa... look at all these destruction... Oh, man! Did I miss the final battle?
I was hoping to burn some titan butt!
Instead, why don't you stay and party with us, Decim?
Yeah! I'll start a fire! There's no good party without a fire, right?
Is that...?
Hi... I came as quickly as I could.
I felt Atlas' influence break and suddenly my mind was free! I'm sorry for what happened in Elaria...
It's fine, Ursurio. It was that rock-brain titan's fault!
And, for the record, you're not the only one who was mind-controlled. Many of us had been brainwashed in the past... Don't worry, everyone knows you're a good bear!
I guess you're right. Thanks, Aria.
Did anyone happen to bring honey? I feel like celebrating!
I see. Things... have changed. That's good.
I can get used to the titans not messing with our kingdom. But only time will tell what will happen next.
Well said. And time is always on my side.
Oh! It looks like I'm late to the action. How sad!
What?!
Don't get me wrong, I like world peace. But I must admit that I was curious about the world ending.
One can only hope, righ? HAHAHA!
I, too, will join the celebration! A toast for Viracocha, who was our salvation!
And for the adventurer! Hurray! Your valiant deeds saved...
... the day?
Yes. That's what I was going to say. How bad are these times? That anyone can mess with my rhymes!
Ughhh!
Thank you, adventurer. I couldn't pick a better friend to travel with.
You want to know what I am going to do from now on?
I... also don't know. I haven't thought much about my future lately. You know... with the world ending and all that.
I think... or maybe I feel... that I like adventuring. Like you and Vel! Arcantica is big and there are many places I'd love to visit!
Whatever I do, I'm sure our paths will cross again!
Is this a party or what? Stop talking about the future, feelings and stuff! Live in the moment for once!
The pyromaniac is right! Let's shake the ground with our celebration!
Here comes the fiiireee!
Stop, Decim! That's dangerous! Do something, adventurer!
Don't worry, I'm also here. He won't get out of control. By the way... Does anyone want refreshments?
HAHAHAHA! Try to smother my flames, water-lady! If you can!
I guess you will have to stop him, Rayne. Please don't hurt him...
... Too much.
Fight! Fight! Fight!
Let's get the party started! Wooohhh!
Hey, adventurer! Were you hoping for a last fight?
Well, if that's the case. How about a sparring session with me instead?
Show me what you've learned since you came to Arcantica!
Oh! I want to witness this! Go, adventurer!
Mind if I join? This looks way more interesting than watching Decim get drowned.
Don't worry! We will cheer for you! Always!
Are you ready, adventurer?

mission.name: Test BGE Elemental Mecha
mission.desc: Test mission. If you see this, the devs screwed up!

mission.name: BGE wants to fight?!
mission.desc: Just when you were enjoying a well deserved rest from the expedition grinding, a new weirdo appears to challenge you into a Spellstone game!

line.text: Welcome to this year's April Fool's Campaign!
We were going to develop a hilarious new campaign, with new enemies and rewards!
But then... we watched the latest superhero movie. And that inspired us to something even better!
Also... we may have spent too much time watching superhero movies instead of working on this campaign.
So now our plan is to just redo what we did last year, but adding some questionable "new" content!
And by that, we mean that we added some never before seen footage of your favourite character...
The crab!
*Snip snip*
Prepare yourself for a -very familiar- Spellstone experience. But more pretentious and with a lot more crabs in it!
Prepare for...
The April Fools Campaign Director's Cut Ultimate Edition... Of Justice!
So... I just... start the thing now?
Yes! Go ahead.
Do as if this introduction wasn't here and the lazy devs just copied and pasted your lines from last year.
Got it!
*Ahem*
I'm finally here! Nothing can contain my untested power!
Oh no! Some evil developer (probably a new guy) merged too many BGEs into one!
Well... I'm sure the players can handle this.
Bye!
I'll merge every tribe into a new, balanced tribe! Muahahaha!
... Unless you stop me, of course.

mission.name: Mission: Impossible
mission.desc: The BGE Conflux wrote this: "Don't play this mission! It is impossible to beat! Just retreat and play a normal node. Don't you need to beat Atlas or something?"

line.text: I recognize you're powerful, player. And good looking. But you won't stop my minions!
I gathered the most powerful enemies an April's Fools monster can afford (and turns out that's not much). Anyway... Behold...
THE CRAB!
*Snip snip*
*Snip snip snip*
See? We DID add new content to this campaign! That "snip snip snip" wasn't in the original cut.
This crab's deck has many, many common cards. But they are enhanced with the Common Revenge BGE! Muahahahaha!
*Snip snip snip*
Hmmm... I see. It says the Devs didn't add Common Revenge to my powers.
Well... sucks to be you, little buddy.
*very afraid snip*

mission.name: The Cannon
mission.desc: Not all BGE Conflux's allies are crabs. Some are actually powerful enemies with stacked decks full of unfair cards. BGE Conflux hopes the next enemy is actually one of those.

line.text: You beat the crab (no surprise there)... But you won't defeat your next enemy!
Piercing Cannon, I choose you!
Hey Mr. BGE! What's up?
Piercing Cannon, it's your turn! Finish this foolish player so I can achieve my dream of merging all tribes!
Ok, boss.
Hey, player! I guess... prepare to fight or something?

mission.name: The Cress
mission.desc: As this is the fourth mission, I thought it will be good for the players to be reminded of what your current situation is: the BGE Conflux was let free and it's trying to merge all tribes into one, for some reason. Defeat it and you will become Emperor of Spellstone!

line.text: Don't get so full of yourself! You just defeated one of my... my... let me check..
one, two... three.
One of my THREE ALLIES!
Cress! It's your turn! Destroy this fool!
Hey, just a small suggestion. Why don't we just... attack the player all at once?
Because, Just Cress, multiplayer is not allowed in Spellstone.
I see. Well... at least I have an overpowered deck, right?
I assure you. Your's is certainly more powerful than the crab's.
That's not reassuring at all!
Fine! Let's get this over with!
The first time we did this April Fool's campaign, we cut something crucial from this scene.
In this completely new experience, we decided to include it.
We think it will completely change the meaning of the entire story.
Here it comes!
*Snip*
Beautiful!

mission.name: The Frog
mission.desc: It seems I skimmed over the description of this event and there is no such thing as an Emperor of Spellstone. Maybe I dreamt about it? Too bad! It sounded awesome! Well... just defeat the bad guys and claim your rewards! For... reasons!

line.text: You defeated Just Cress?! Now I really wish there was a multiplayer Spellstone mode...
Not gonna happen.
So, player! You defeated almost all my minions, but as a boss just a couple days old... I'm sure that's no indication that you will defeat the next one.
Hi! I'm your next opponent.
People think I'm the worst. But actually, I'm a really nice frog!
So, have fun and good luck! *wink wink*
Less talking and more spellstoning!

mission.name: A BGE for All
mission.desc: This is it! The final battle against the evil BGE Conflux that threatens to balance Spellstone! How dares it?!

line.text: I see you obliterated the frog. And the cannon. And everyone else. Did you know you were this strong? Anyway...
I'm done. It was fun, though! Byeee!
*tries to run away but you catch it*
Nooo! Please! Don't hurt me!
Crab! Help me! Attack the player!
*snip snip*
Fine! I'll fight!
... Stupid crab...
*New, original snip snip*
As I know how this goes, I'll use this last chance to say something interesting.
To give this event a conclusion of some sort, if you will.
I was wrong to try to merge all the tribes into one. I suck. But I sincerely hope this was fun for you...
Wait. That can't be right. Who wrote this dialogue?
No! Wait! I'm not ready! Don't attack me!

mission.name: Revenge of the Storm
mission.desc: The commons are rising up! Their power is overwhelming! Stop them before they destroy the world! Or join them. I'm a mission description, not a cop.

line.text: *Whoosh* We come! *Whoosh* Revenge of the Commons! *Woosh*

mission.name: Revenge of the Dead, Part XXIV
mission.desc: I feel like we've been here before...

line.text: NYAAAA! We come for your bones! You know, to like... replace the ones you broke...
HAND EM' OVER!!!

mission.name: Revenge of the Snip Snip
mission.desc: I don't know what they are saying, but these crabs seem really upset.

line.text: *Snip*

mission.name: Revenge of the Woods
mission.desc: The common cards of the woods have gathered to defeat you!

line.text: We come, the denizens of the forest, to take our vengeance...
WOOF! :D

mission.name: Revenge of the Souls
mission.desc: The soul wisps have gathered, looking for vengeance for all their brothers who you've put into lanterns, and torches, or whatever ya'll do with little light spirits.

line.text: WooooOOOooooOOOOO... jerk!

mission.name: Revenge of the Revengest!
mission.desc: Some weirdo with a bunch of bombs has showed up. They seem like they know you but you can't place their face.

line.text: I HAVE RETURNED, PREPARE FOR OUR FATEFUL DUEL!

mission.name: Common Crusher Crew
mission.desc: The Legendary cards have arrived to put things back in their rightful place! Can they defeat the Common menace?!

line.text: Never fear! The Legend League has arrived!
Let's put these Commons back in their place!

mission.name: Common Squashing Squad
mission.desc: The Legendary cards have arrived to put things back in their rightful place! Can they defeat the common menace?!

line.text: YEEEEEEE HAWWWWWWW!

mission.name: Common Terror Team
mission.desc: The Legendary cards have arrived to put things back in their rightful place! Can they defeat the common menace?!

line.text: I don't feel so good. Can I go home? I miss Cindertooth.

mission.name: Common Conquering Club
mission.desc: The Legendary cards have arrived to put things back in their rightful place! Can they defeat the common menace?!

mission.name: Common Bashing Bunch
mission.desc: The Legendary cards have arrived to put things back in their rightful place! Can they defeat the common menace?!

line.text: What do we have here? This looks fun!

mission.name: Common Trashing Troupe
mission.desc: The Legendary cards have arrived to put things back in their rightful place! Can they defeat the common menace?!

line.text: Hello there.

mission.name: Hot Spring Episode
mission.desc: After so much world-saving, you find yourself in need of some rest. You decided the best place to take a break would be Tarragon Peak. Yes, the region is infamous for its tremors, and lava... and dragons. But Decim pointed out: you can relax in its hot springs! If the dragons allow it, of course.

mission.name: Stay Hydrated
mission.desc: Before going to the hot springs, you decide a healthy stroll through the hellscape that is Tarragon Peak will be an excellent exercise. But you're interrupted by a sudden heat stroke. That's what the locals call "dragon breath". Anyway, hope you brought enough water!

mission.name: Lava Fact
mission.desc: "When lava is inside the earth, it is actually called magma." You remember the weirdest facts when your life is in danger of being charred by lava and devoured by dragons.

mission.name: Sinister Puns
mission.desc: Danger! Danger everywhere! Heat rises from the ground and you can see the magma about to be released. And in the sky, dragons look pissed off for some reason. What a drag! Or should you say... What a drag-on! Get it?

mission.name: Something Learned
mission.desc: Released from its rocky prison, the magma is setting everything on fire! Just kidding! It's called lava now. The LAVA is setting everything on fire!

mission.name: In hindsight. . .
mission.desc: You know what? Maybe you should have listened to everyone but Decim when deciding your vacation destination. Well. . . At least after dealing with all these third degree burns, you will be able to relax in the hot springs.

mission.name: Dragons Can't Chill
mission.desc: The hot springs were incredible. You know what? It was totally worth risking your life -and risking permanently being disfigured by dragonfire burns- just to relax in those waters. Now, back to the fighting.

mission.name: The Ball is Lava
mission.desc: After bathing in hot springs people usually play games. So you find yourself playing ping pong against dragons. They play by the local rules. It's the same game, but the ball is on fire. Also, it involves dragons.

mission.name: Smartass
mission.desc: Oh no! The ping pong table was utterly incinerated! Just when you were about to win! The dragons are angry and blame you. Calmly, you point out that's how every ping pong game involving dragon breath will probably end. Anyway, you won. But the dragons are sore losers.

mission.name: Hot-el Tarragonia
mission.desc: You spend the night in a "hot-el" tended by an old dragon couple. It's just a dark cave filled with hot lava and smelly sulfur, but the old dragon couple made it look very cosy. You even find melted chocolate mints over your rocky pillows!

mission.name: Draconic Breakfast
mission.desc: Next morning you are greeted with an amazing breakfast. Over a stone table you find a 3-foot pile of bacon. Just bacon. And burning hot coffee that could hurt even Vulcanos' tongue. The vegetarian option is a pile of charcoal that used to be croissants.

mission.name: Trip Advising
mission.desc: The rest of your vacation is nice and quiet. After two days of you beating up every Tarragon citizen you encounter, they get accustomed to your presence and leave you alone. You are free to visit tour sites, collect souvenirs, and learn more about the local culture.

mission.name: A Different Landscape
mission.desc: After your last visit to Tarragon peak, you feel in need of some counterweight, and decide that maybe some fresh moisture is better than dragons and lava. Nothing's gonna ruin this trip. Unless...

mission.name: Buzzing Annoyance
mission.desc: Wasn't this place supposed to be cleaned of the insect infestation like a really long time ago? This is what happens when you subcontract work. Apparently the insects found something interesting because they seem to be quite disturbed by your presence.

mission.name: Missing Information
mission.desc: Well, that didn't go as smoothly as planned. You cannot shake off the feeling that you're forgetting something. Last time here Elyse gave you information about insects that was really important. Where is a good ranger when you need one?

mission.name: Matter of fact
mission.desc: After all the trouble you went through to put the three factions at ease, it seems unfair to be swarmed by dozens of ridiculously large insects. You now remember that this was a natural breeding pod and that it's conditions make them bigger, faster and stronger. Get on your guard!

mission.name: Who wants to explore?
mission.desc: This was a bad idea. A vacation is what you really needed, getting into a place which was supposed to be free of danger, safely collect some honeycombs and maybe take a bath in the healing waters of this place. Looks like you're gonna have to fight for it.

mission.name: Way over the top
mission.desc: Draconic Insects? The one with the scorpion tail was just too much, and the weirdness just went off the end of your meter. You're finishing this and getting away from this place, at least for a good while.

mission.name: Not creepy or anything
mission.desc: Between the moisture and the constant creepy sensation of being watched, you're not at all certain of your safety. The thing about insects is that they seem to operate outside the boundaries of conventional logic, and their movements are starting to seriously freak you out.

mission.name: Kill them with fire?
mission.desc: You start to miss the beautiful and hot tarragon peak where you just had to beat some dragons in a fancy ping pong game. what you would give to have some of those tarragon flasks with you right now to teach those bugs a lesson.

mission.name: Hive mind
mission.desc: They won't stop coming at your face, no matter how nice you ask. The honeycombs you're stealing from them might have something to do. You were trying a different kind of diet, but they just won't understand.

mission.name: Don't let the chasm bugs bite
mission.desc: The honeycomb magic was a lure! After failing to explain that you're not a threat to their colony, you run and take cover in a hidden chasm. Being the expert adventurer you are though, of course you were prepared for the vermin that came swarming out of the earth splitting acid into your face.

mission.name: Surrounded and maybe outnumbered
mission.desc: Elyse never thought that you could use a horrible smelling and absolutely lethal fluid to create a distraction, but now a whole lot of badass insect madness is distracted by your top-tier survival skills. Time to fight them one by one!

mission.name: New insecta?
mission.desc: The distraction worked perfectly, except for the fact that you messed the proportions on a key element and now the insects are growing in size to an even more ridiculous level. You walk out with the feeling that you spinned the wheel of evolution maybe a little more than was strictly right.

mission.name: Little Big Detours
mission.desc: Maybe the warm and humid insectile landscape was not as bad as Tarragon, but it sure gave you some surprises and you've been itching for some sightseeing payback.

mission.name: Bad Reception
mission.desc: Goblins have the distaste of sending mechanical dragons and insects to kick you out. After your failed vacation in Tarragon peak, this is going beyond the pale!

mission.name: Beast-Something Plot?
mission.desc: You really tried to smooth things over with the Goblins, but it seems they want nothing to do with it. You cannot escape the feeling that they want to hide something.

mission.name: Diplomatic Disaster
mission.desc: You try to dissuade their aggression by mentioning you are the hero who bound the three factions and they should not mess with you. Sadly that made them more convinced that you want to stop them from...Whatever it is they are actually doing here.

mission.name: Goblins in the Right, and the Stars are Left.
mission.desc: You've had enough of necro-insectoid mutant horrors made out of sinister rituals, so you try to talk your way out of them thinking you want to expose their plans, but they just won't listen!

mission.name: Stolen Property. Again.
mission.desc: These Goblin Creeps just won't learn. You tried to be civil but accidentally bumped into their plans to use the insect beetleton mutation for their own dark experiments!

mission.name: Roundabout Entry
mission.desc: You attempt to escape the fortress through the tunnels. Unfortunately, Goblins are either too stupid or too smart and the paths are very confusing. You come out into the other side, surrounded by enemies again!

mission.name: Masterminds
mission.desc: How can they expect to keep their secret experiments a secret if they don't let you escape after you didn't actually see anything? You attempt a second run into the tunnels and find a nasty surprise.

mission.name: Deep into the Dungeon for the Rest
mission.desc: Needing a break, you go deeper into the caves, but you accidentally discover the birthing pods of super insects the goblins have been breeding here! The jailors and their superbugs attack you!

mission.name: Actions Speak Louder
mission.desc: After all the trouble they are making you go through, they told you more about their plans than if they just let you leave but well, you definitely had much more than you expected from your little sightseeing tour.

mission.name: No Secrets Left Behind
mission.desc: You manage to take your well deserved insect-free rest inside the tunnels, and now it's time to leave this weird place and maybe find some place not swarming with insane, unreasonable and bad mannered company.

mission.name: Accidental Spy
mission.desc: You end up leaving the fortress with way, way more information than you really wanted. Maybe next time it would be smart to just take a peek at the landscape from afar, to prevent some megalomaniac's plans being accidentally discovered.

mission.name: Tour of the Skies
mission.desc: After the weirdness you've experienced in some of the other locations you visited, the freshness of the Celestial Vault catches you and brings a load of fresh air into your lungs.

mission.name: Conflicting Dates
mission.desc: The attack of the avians was totally unexpected, and after a moment of hesitation you consult your calendar, since you're not supposed to be disturbing anybody here.

mission.name: Inconvenient Addition Error
mission.desc: Checking the calendar and the stars you realize that you may have miscounted, and that if you had, you're gonna have a rough way home after pissing off the avians who are at their summit of power.

mission.name: Challenge Refused
mission.desc: Avians don't even speak the same way as you and while you babble around trying to tell them you made a mistake in coming here, they seem to regard your speech and arm movements as some kind of bizarre challenge.

mission.name: No Avians Remain in the Water
mission.desc: They just keep coming at you, and in a flood of panic you jump into the vaults lake, reasoning that they shouldn't be able to follow you into that.

mission.name: This is not a Drill
mission.desc: The creativity of waterborne creatures is astounding. Using a powerful mecha arm which Decim said could be used as a drill, you break your way out of the waterfall and into the cave.

mission.name: Improvised Spelunking
mission.desc: Having to drill your way from a lake and into an underground cavern is not fun. At all. Hopefully the darkness will deter your winged pursuers.

mission.name: Dangerous Crowd in the Dark
mission.desc: With your feet firmly planted in solid ground you're determined to make the trip worthwhile and at least leave this place with some insightful and interesting views.

mission.name: How many feet under?
mission.desc: After wrongly assuming that no flying annoyance was gonna follow you into the darkness and being unpleasantly surprised, you engage in evasive maneuvers.

mission.name: Unintended Passive Aggression
mission.desc: After all that fighting and the amount of, let's face it, different creatures you're constantly forced to fight, not only are you now really hungry, but also have your pick of what to eat.

mission.name: Hi, I'm a Monster-Summoning Trap
mission.desc: With your energy on the rise and the way clear of baddies you decide it's time to move on. You find the strangest pictograms in a cavern wall, little did you think they would summon powerful guardians!

mission.name: More Wings, More Questions
mission.desc: The spellstones bound into the wall shatter as you defeat their pet guardians, and this is definitely the last time you trust these winged vile creatures, nothing like those also winged quite not vile angels.

mission.name: Out Onto Fresh Vanilla Outdoors
mission.desc: Enough with strange places of dark mayhem and powerful magics, after some consideration you decide to visit the sunny side of the red valley for a well-deserved picnic.

mission.name: Interruptions. Always the Interruptions...
mission.desc: It would seem that there are some individuals who are not taking kindly to you wanting to have a quiet meal in the outdoors, or maybe they are over enthusiastic about it?

mission.name: The Path Behind
mission.desc: Were those...zombie penguin legionnaires? No matter, in your days you have seen some weird things, and now is not the time to be distracted by a hypothetical undead animal stampede.

mission.name: Nightfall
mission.desc: Night falls on the camp, which is starting to resemble a horror story more than a casual picnic. You start wondering if all those avians are still annoyed because of the intrusion in the Celestial Vault.

mission.name: Troll in the Dark
mission.desc: You shatter bones and splatter yourself with disgusting ichor which is gonna cost a fortune at the laundry's. Mist veils surround you as some sick weirdo does moaning sounds in some kind of distasteful prank.

mission.name: No Bullying Accepted
mission.desc: After fighting your way clear of the nocturne trap, you drop a hard challenge to the one responsible for this, demanding satisfaction. And new clothes.

mission.name: Into the Gloom
mission.desc: You managed to settle things with that joker, but unfortunately he ghosted his followers and made a hasty retreat. Be cool and don't leave your followers behind.

mission.name: It's a Trap!
mission.desc: Rushing after that bully so fast and without any backout maybe was not your best plan. You realize this as the undead rise and the ambush closes around you!

mission.name: The Jaws of a bad Trap
mission.desc: For a moment there you thought you were a goner, but despite your bluntness, the trap was actually so bad that you barely noticed it. What's next?

mission.name: Best of Three
mission.desc: Your rival decided to test his mettle against you once again, if only there were at least some clear rules about these kinds of things. How tiresome.

mission.name: Walking Marathon
mission.desc: After endlessly battling avians, undeads and strange creatures whose corpses mysteriously vanish for reasons unknown, you manage to defeat the bully and extract laundry service from him for the splatters.

mission.name: Best of Five?
mission.desc: The rules are not clear, but your opponent is challenging you to a final confrontation. The winner gets double laundry money plus all the fame and glory!

mission.name: Deeper Tourism
mission.desc: It has been a really long time since you took a deep bath, and they say some of these salines have serious and real health benefits.

mission.name: No Visa
mission.desc: Some Seafolk guys are questioning your right to be here, demanding you to show them some magical credentials that somehow work underwater. You feel bureaucratic bully vibes.

mission.name: Haunted Visit
mission.desc: After a brief misunderstanding with the local seafolk delegation you manage to understand that they are babbling something about you bringing undead pursuers into their domains, but that just seems silly.

mission.name: Underwater Unlife
mission.desc: Who would've thought that mess from the Red Valley would catch you here of all places? You feel definitively hexed and someone is having fun at your expense.

mission.name: Muddy Waters
mission.desc: It seems that some of the local Seafolk were in league with these undead outsiders, and some of them were even undead themselves! You find yourself quickly injected into an internal conflict!

mission.name: Unexpected Salt
mission.desc: Both Undead Seafolk and Seafolk Undead fans are annoyed about you walking over their plans for a Horror Underwater Con. You claim ignorance and are challenged to a Duel in the process.

mission.name: Slow Safety First
mission.desc: Underwater escapes are always less dramatic and slower than you'd think. Slowly but surely you left the undead-seafolk issue to visit the cute undersea monument.

mission.name: Mysterious Prohibition
mission.desc: Apparently the monument is off limits, but they won't tell you exactly why. Annoyed, you're gonna schedule a serious talk with Proteus, or someone with executive decision capabilities.

mission.name: Not the Quetees!
mission.desc: Apparently there was a nest of Quetees which no one had the heart to take out of there. I mean come on, they are just too cute, and you realize that they even have an automated defense. How Nice!

mission.name: Divergent Tides
mission.desc: The Quetees attacked instinctively in defense of their home, but apparently all the fuss caused by the battle before you left them alone attracted some unwanted attention...

mission.name: The Underwater Treason
mission.desc: These savage seafolk, how dare they hand over those cute, harmless Quetees to the evil designs of the undead?! You valiantly decide to stand in defense of their right to inhabit the Pharos Monument.

mission.name: The Temple Ranger
mission.desc: In defense of the endangered species, you stood your ground against the evil seafolk that wanted to sell out the Quetees, and now their true clients are annoyed at you.

mission.name: Year 2016
mission.desc: Spellstone's 6th Anniversary celebration has begun! Defeat this node's enemies and get amazing rewards!

line.text: Six Years? That seems so long ago I can't even remember what the game was like back then.
I think I used to say something like...
You gotta fight.
For your right.
To parrrrrty!

mission.name: Year 2017
mission.desc: Spellstone's 6th Anniversary celebration has begun! Defeat this node's party titans and get amazing rewards!

line.text: Hi! My name is Solaron.
And I like to party!
No. You don't.
You definitely don't.
Wait, who invited the void into this anniversary?
Let's party!

mission.name: Year 2018
mission.desc: Spellstone's 6th Anniversary celebration has begun! Defeat this node's party titans and uninvited guests and get amazing rewards!

line.text: C'mon! A little party never hurt anyone!
But then again... those parties didn't invite the void!
Indeed.
Oh come on, seriously?! Who told Bluefire about this? you know how he gets after a drink or two.

mission.name: Year 2019
mission.desc: Spellstone's 6th Anniversary celebration has begun! Defeat this node's... (not very sober and voidish) entity of evil and get amazing rewards!

line.text: I'm blue da ba dee da ba daa!
Da ba dee da ba daa, da ba dee da ba daa, da ba dee da ba daa!
Such a catchy song! Do you know I'm also kinda blue...ish?
I think Bluefire here is drunk...
We should do something before he starts spitting frozen alcoholic fire.
Solaron, that's no actually possible.
I'm the master of order, you're not telling me what's possible and what's not.
Watch out, here it comes!
Da ba dee da ba daa!

mission.name: Year 2020
mission.desc: Spellstone's 6th Anniversary celebration manages to continue despite the booze-drinking void! Defeat this node's party titan and get amazing rewards!

line.text: Hi! Are you having a good time aroud this year? 2021 already? now time flies...
Come on, Fire, let's go do some drunken sparring outside!
Da ba dee da ba daa!
Just try not to destroy the entire lawn!
... Don't mind them.
I just wanted to say something before this party gets wilder...
Yeah! WYLDER!
I mean, chaotic
Yeah! CHAOTIC!
Ahem!
Happy 6th Anniversary, Spellstone!
Now... Let's get this party start...continued! I mean there's one more round to go, ahem...these lazy devs.

mission.name: Year 2021
mission.desc: Spellstone's 6th Anniversary celebration continues with some minor landscape damage! Defeat this node's party titan and get amazing rewards!

line.text: Another year, another go. Am I getting old for this, Vulcky?
What's a year, anyway?
Da ba dee da ba daa!
yeah well, that's going to continue for a while. My insurance primes are definitely going up this time.
Ahem...everyone! Time for the toast.
What should we drink to?
More Bluefire Stones!
More runes!
I say to health runes buff, for increased vigor and wildness!
Just nerf Nuvis Already!
No, not the nerf!
Who said that?
No one. I'm the voice of Spellstone.
Well I'm not so sure about that, but we can always discuss it in the forums my mate. Let's get this party started!

mission.name: Aerial relief
mission.desc: After the deep high pressure environment you had to endure in Pharos Temple, going for the opposite feels almost like taking off weights in your legs and shoulders.

mission.name: Angelic Script
mission.desc: Despite the not so heavenly reception, clearing the opposition you wander around looking for the mysterious angelic writings, which is a fine name for unknown incantations that can get you killed.

mission.name: Menagerie of Opposition
mission.desc: The sheer number of guardians randomly deciding to interfere with your quest to take off the veil of the mystical writings in Skyhaven can only mean that you're about to uncover something that should stay hidden.

mission.name: The Mystery of the Wings
mission.desc: More often than not, you have wondered about the ancient mystery of Angel wings versus Avian wings. It has been a source of academic debate within realms for years and years, and now...

mission.name: Shocking Truths
mission.desc: You venture deeper into the floating fortress of Skyhaven, the tension over what you may be about to uncover reaches a critical point, as you stand in front of the ancient script, committed to decipher it.

mission.name: Dark Wings, Dark Words
mission.desc: The ancient prophets of old told of the common origin of the Avian and Angel tribes, and now that you're here with all your Spellstones ready to go, nothing is going to prevent you from learning the truth!

mission.name: Increasing Strain
mission.desc: The mystical texts gave you the hint to look for the secret vault of Skyhaven, and the battle is raging stronger and louder than ever before.

mission.name: Battle for irrelevant knowledge
mission.desc: What is this secret to them anyway? Why are they so hot and bothered to prevent you from discovering something that won't make any real difference?

mission.name: Speed Reading
mission.desc: You managed to get into the vault and start to uncover the jealously guarded secret of the Angel Wings, the alarm is all over Skyhaven and they are coming to stop your transgression!

mission.name: What is Known cannot be Unknown
mission.desc: You have uncovered a secret that is so terrible you realize your life is immediately in danger from two tribes instead of one.

mission.name: The Winged Hunt
mission.desc: You've heard stories about a terrible power that hunts helpless prey, but you definitely never expected it to happen at the hands of angels!

mission.name: Those who run further
mission.desc: You're definitely banned from Skyhaven after what happened here but despite your transgressor nature, you now have a secret in your possession that could potentially pour oil into troubled waters.

mission.name: Where am I?
mission.desc: You were heading on your vacation towards Celestial Vault but you take a wrong turn and end up at Fireshard mines. You decide to stroll around and ask for directions when you accidentally bump into a mean looking Mecha.

mission.name: Busted
mission.desc: After beating the mean looking robot, the Mecha police arrives and decides to CHARGE you with BATTERY and assault. You are later taken to prison.

mission.name: Prison fight
mission.desc: You arrive at the prison and decide to quickly gang up with the strongest pack of Mecha to ever exist, the vacuum robots. Unfortunately, these turn out to not be as strong as you thought they would.

mission.name: Food fight
mission.desc: After single handedly beating the robot gang you are called for lunch time. Unfortunately, a mean looking robot decides to steal your lunch before you can even take a byte.

mission.name: Prison Break
mission.desc: After the food fight you are taken to your cell where you encounter a goblin that tattooed the entire prison blueprint on himself, you decide to aid him in his escape. On the way out you encounter a prison guard.

mission.name: Rematch
mission.desc: Once you are leaving, you encounter the Mecha that accused you of assaulting him. Unfortunately, he recognizes you and decides to come at you for a second round.

mission.name: Trial by combat
mission.desc: After beating the Mecha again, the police catches you. But this time, since they saw you did not attack first, they decide to declare a trial by combat.

mission.name: Freedom!
mission.desc: After winning the trial by combat, you decide to finally relax and have some fun in with the local community. Unfortunately, in a society that is 20.000 feet underground, the most fun thing to do seems to be continuous not-stop battles.

mission.name: Win the crowd
mission.desc: Even though you won the fight, the crowd barely cheers you on. Unfortunately, a robot's love can't be BOT.

mission.name: Reboot
mission.desc: After winning the last fight the crowd now loves you! Your next opponent shows up and seems to be a bit slow, you suggest turning him off and on again.

mission.name: One last goodbye
mission.desc: After beating the last opponent the crowd now adores you! The love you so much that the try to chain you so that you can not escape. You are definitely not coming back to this place.

mission.name: See you never!
mission.desc: After escaping from their oily robot hands, you manage to slip away towards the mines exit when you stumble across an angry robot, time for a factory reset.

mission.name: The Tale of Pumpking
mission.desc: The goblins from Goblin Rise Stronghold retell to Daknak the tragic tale of Pumpking, a king who only wanted to spread goodwill by giving children candy. However, he met a tragic end when his rivals played an unfair trick upon him, cheating him of his rewards.

line.text: Bahaha! Daknak laugh at silly Pumpking story! Might be fooled the first time they promised me rewards, but not this one!
Ooh, Boss! Be careful how many times you say that name; something bad happens if you say it three times!

mission.name: Pumpking's Appearance?
mission.desc: Although the goblins warned Daknak about the power of Pumpking's name, Daknak tests his luck. He departs from the other goblins, laughing at their ghost story.

line.text: Daknak have no fear of Pumpking! Daknak say Pumpking name more times than Daknak!
Daknak say Pumpking, Pumpking, Pumpking!
D-Daknak sorry! Please give me candy and the rewards of the node this time!

mission.name: More Trick Than Treat
mission.desc: The strange apparition lays something by Daknak's feet, before turning and fading into the night. The goblins return in time to see Daknak holding the item.

line.text: Ghost left... a pumpkin full of candy?
Thanks for getting us some sweet candy, Boss! Is this time for real or the devs messed it up again?
Hey, no take! That's Daknak's candy!

mission.name: Back at it again
mission.desc: After escaping from those loud mines with their clunky robots you decide you want a change of scene and head towards Dawnglow to enjoy a peaceful and danger free vacation. Or will you?

mission.name: Stranger Danger
mission.desc: You start strolling across town when you happen to notice that the town is exclusively filled with frogs. They notice your presence and walk aggressively towards you.

mission.name: Say no to drugs
mission.desc: One frog dressed in loose clothing jumps out of the crowd and offers you a suspicious looking frog he wants you to lick as part of an initiation ritual. You decide to politely decline what looks like an illegal substance. The frog priest was not amused.

mission.name: Ribbit
mission.desc: There's definitely something strange in the air. You start to panic and rush towa... Ribbit.

mission.name: Ribbit?
mission.desc: Ribbit ribbit, Ribbit? RIBBIT!!!

mission.name: Hangover
mission.desc: You suddenly wake up with a huge headache and you are covered in mud. You realize that in their attempt to include you in their society you were magically turned you into a frog for a short time. You need to get out of here NOW.

mission.name: Frogging around
mission.desc: You decide to start investigating around town when you suddenly spot a different set of frogs. They are well dressed and seem to be the only lucid frogs in town. You head towards their direction when a bunch of possessed frogs spot you.

mission.name: Meet the Froggsters
mission.desc: After you get rid of the possessed frogs you continue following the frog mobsters, or for short "Froggsters". They go into a wooden warehouse and you spot from a window a glimpse of their operation. You decide to go in when a guard stops you.

mission.name: The Warehouse
mission.desc: Tons of experiments where they feed the genetically modified flowers to non-frog beings in order to create a frog army. The Froggsters within the warehouse see you're a non-frog and immediately attack you.

mission.name: Burn it to the ground
mission.desc: You decide to put an end to the whole frog conspiracy and burn the whole warehouse to the ground, together with all the remaining genetically modified frogs. Of course, they won't let you do it so easily.

mission.name: Hop away
mission.desc: The entire town is still under the influence of frog magic and won't come out of it until at least a day, so you decide to hide away until the next morning. You are looking for your hiding spot when suddenly a mob of angry frogs spots you.

mission.name: No Ragrets
mission.desc: Once it's morning you head to the town and you see all the villagers turned into humans again. You address them happily as their savior and you can see how their confused faces turn into rage. Now they have to worry about stuff like working and paying taxes! Guess it's time to run again.

mission.name: Two Old Men Reunited
mission.desc: Malchior has dragged Tarian out of the small shack. The two friends catch up on what they've missed over the last few months, as Malchior has been traveling on the airship.

line.text: Malchior, why did you call me out here?
It's simple, my friend... I require your skills!

mission.name: World's Center Dangers
mission.desc: Malchior takes Tarian past the rocky path, into the snowy forest. They pass many diseased, rotted trees; monsters and undead lurking in their shadows.

line.text: There is an enemy that only you can feel...
Then this must be serious, if you're asking me over your adventurer friend.

mission.name: The Biggest Tree
mission.desc: Malchior stops at a large tree, one of the few that hasn't been tainted by the disease. It grows strong and tall, evergreen pine needles sticking out from its branches.

line.text: Right here! This gigantic pine tree!-

mission.name: Ax of the Lich Lord
mission.desc: Tarian stops cold. He has humored many of Malchior's outlandish requests in the past, but he cannot figure out his motivation behind this one.

line.text: Malchior, my ax is meant for cleaving bone, not chopping firewood!

mission.name: Holiday Presents
mission.desc: Malchior begs Tarian to reconsider his earlier choice. The tree is meant for others who have never seen such things, not for one of Malchior's experiments.

line.text: But think of the Chaos children back in Karthos, and how they'd decorate this big tree!
Fine, I'll do it, but don't you dare tell anyone about this. I have a reputation to uphold.

mission.name: Long time no see
mission.desc: After leaving the old and dusty Fireshard mine you decide it is time to stop making enemies. You find out about a goblin-hosted basketball tournament at Worlds Center and you decide to head there and have one less enemy.

mission.name: Squash the beef
mission.desc: After apologizing to the goblins they decide to invite you to play their version of basketball called "Goblinball". Not very creative these devs, I mean goblins, yeah let's blame it on them.

mission.name: Slam Dunk
mission.desc: Goblinball is basically regular basketball but way more dangerous and with the hoops being humorously low. This is way easier than you thought, goblins are so short that playing ball was never so easy. You can notice how they start to get mad at you.

mission.name: Fouled out
mission.desc: Goblins realize that they won't be able to beat you fair and square, to no one's surprise, they start fouling you every time they can.

mission.name: It's only a game, why do you have to be mad?
mission.desc: Goblins drool while you only dribble, the game has ended and you have won. Unfortunately, this seems to only deteriorate your relationship with goblins since they start surrounding you menacingly.

mission.name: Sore losers
mission.desc: Goblins are furious about losing to you even though they cheated for half the game, before you realize it a couple of them are already about to attack you!

mission.name: Damage control
mission.desc: After fighting with the goblins you realize this is going the wrong way again and decide to do some damage control. You ask them to propose a different game where the chances are fair for both sides.

mission.name: And they chose...
mission.desc: Goblins being true to their nature go for limbo, yes, LIMBO.

mission.name: Back Pain
mission.desc: Goblins don't even have to try to pass under the bar, they literally just walk under it. They all laugh at your misery and start making fun of you.

mission.name: LimbNO
mission.desc: After suffering at their ridiculously unfair game you get so mad that when a goblin is passing under the bar you kick it down. The bar falls onto the goblin's leg and injures him.

mission.name: Pack a punch
mission.desc: Goblins start attacking you all at the same time, in another situation you would probably run, but you are so furious you decide to fight back.

mission.name: Frenemies
mission.desc: You have had enough and propose the goblins with a truce. You don't have to be friends but you don't have to be enemies either. As from now on the goblins are officially your "Frenemies".

mission.name: Down the rabbit hole
mission.desc: Shortly after leaving Worlds Center, you spot a rare fancy looking goblin with a suit and a pocket watch. Curious about it, you decide to follow it. You see it enter a hole on the ground and you decide to quickly go in after him when suddenly you appear in The Abyss.

mission.name: How did I even end up here?
mission.desc: Dazed and confused you realize you must have gone through a portal. Waiting for you on the other side of that portal are two Chaos Elemental guards who were alerted about your presence and decide to take action.

mission.name: A little help from a friend
mission.desc: When fighting with the guards, dazed because of the portal and in a lot of danger, you suddenly see that one of them is completely frozen and the other one has been turned into ashes.

mission.name: Running an errand
mission.desc: After being saved, you look directly at your saviour. It is the fancy goblin you were chasing after. It is a tiny looking elemental who seems sad and lonely. He explains to you that he can't get back home alone. Since he saved your life, you offer to cross the portal with him.

mission.name: Conga
mission.desc: You head towards a portal with the goblin and the first thing you see is a party full of elemental creatures of all factions. Weirdly enough, they seem to be Conga dancing.

mission.name: The Reveal
mission.desc: Before anybody can notice, the goblin heads straight towards the center of the party where a huge birthday cake is being displayed and immediately trashes it. "My name is Remi!" he shouts out loudly. "This is for not inviting me to the birthday party!".

mission.name: Party crashers
mission.desc: Remi starts trashing everything and before the guards can do anything he vanishes. Everybody starts charging towards you.

mission.name: New found enemies
mission.desc: You start running away when all of a sudden somebody pulls you into a dark corner. It is explained to you that Remi is an enemy of all elementals. He had been banned from the elemental world until you broke the spell by bringing him in.

mission.name: Begging for forgiveness
mission.desc: You decide to come out of your hiding place and ask for forgiveness, elemental guards immediately arrest you.

mission.name: The trial
mission.desc: The elementals make you stand trial. You can either choose to endure trial by combat or to find and capture Remi. If you fail, the elementals would ban you from their land. You decide to choose the easier task and endure trial by combat.

mission.name: The betrayal
mission.desc: You won the combat. Nevertheless, the elemental council decides it was too easy of a challenge so they decide to make a second combat, but with 10 times the number of combatants. Even though you yell that this isn't fair, the elementals start attacking you.

mission.name: Waking up
mission.desc: You can feel them hitting you from all sides when suddenly you awake. You see yourself next to the hole that you found, it seems like your tripped and passed out. Nothing of what happened seems to have been real, or was it?

mission.name: I'm on a boat
mission.desc: After waking up from such a crazy dream, you decide it is time for a real adventure. You set out on a voyage commanded by a group of goblin pirates to wherever the sea might take you.

mission.name: Man overboard!
mission.desc: After a couple of days at sea, all of a sudden on a stormy night, the ship gets attacked. Loud strikes can be heard coming from all directions. Before you know it the ship is going down!

mission.name: Cast away
mission.desc: You wake up from the shipwreck only to realize that you have arrived at Seastorm Citadel. A human approaches you with a ball that has a face carved into it. He insists that you call it Wilson for some reason.

mission.name: No way out
mission.desc: The human explains to you that his ship was wrecked nearby as well and he remained as the only survivor. He also proceeds to explain that nobody can ever leave or come to the rescue because of a sea colossus that guards the island.

mission.name: Buckle up
mission.desc: After hearing the castaways story you realize nobody is coming to rescue you. You decide to ask him to lead you towards the creature's lair.

mission.name: Enemies at bay
mission.desc: From far away you can already see seafolk enemies patrolling the area. Among some of the enemies you can see what looks like turtles. Really? How hard can it be to beat those?

mission.name: A champion rises
mission.desc: After defeating the horde of enemies you start seeing a Seafolk colossus rising from the ocean. Given its terrible size and power you start having second thoughts about what you have just done.

mission.name: Meeting Moklam
mission.desc: The colossus rises from the ocean and announces his name, Moklam. He asks why you have decided to disturb his peace. You proceed to explain what happened to your ship and how the castaway pointed at him as the culprit.

mission.name: Oops
mission.desc: Moklam proceeds to explain that he had nothing to do with your ship going down. As a matter of fact, he actually wants you to leave as quickly as possible since all you did was destroy his home. Who would have thought that trusting a random crazy guy was a bad idea?

mission.name: Seek the truth
mission.desc: You turn back from where you came from and head towards the human. In a menacing manner, you command him to tell you the truth or he will regret ever meeting you. That's when all of a sudden you start hearing hordes of creatures surrounding you. Oh god, it can't be true!

mission.name: Quetee Qued
mission.desc: You can spot Quetee Ques surrounding you as far as the eye can see. Why?!?! You yell at them, I helped you in the past and this is how you repay me? The creatures don't seem to care, it looks like you are about to get Qutee Qued.

mission.name: Sea you later
mission.desc: After defeating the Quetees you can finally leave the island. The pirates managed to fix their ship and you decide to continue with your journey.

mission.name: The commons return
mission.desc: After the commons got destroyed last year, they have now come back empowered. THE COMMONS RISE AGAIN TO RESTORE THEIR FORMER GLORY.

mission.name: Trolol
mission.desc: Ah, I see you defeated the first set of commons. Let's see how you do against an actually GOOD common set.

mission.name: Honest mistake
mission.desc: Oops lol, my bad. Those Seraphims just happened to slip in haha xd. You will actually face commons now.

mission.name: These puns will get me a promocean
mission.desc: Im shore you guys like the new Seafolk BGE as much as we do. But just in case you don't, we have made the next deck 15 seafolk copies lol.

mission.name: Revenge of the devs
mission.desc: More than revenge of the commons this seems like revenge of the devs am I right?

mission.name: Greedy devs
mission.desc: Congratulations, I see you have fought your way to the final mission and that you are almost ready to claim your reward. I hope you understand that in the end we are not evil, JUST GREEDY MUAHAHAHAHA.

mission.name: Small Detour
mission.desc: When sailing with your buddies you decide to take a break and re-supply at the hotel you once stayed at in Tarragon peak. You make a stop at the hotel and head towards the front desk.

mission.name: No Vacancy
mission.desc: Unfortunately, one of the hotels employees informs you that there is no vacancy. You try to have them make room for you but there is no way to convince them. You yell at the employee, FANGS FOR NOTHING! They do not take your joke kindly.

mission.name: In the Heat of the Moment
mission.desc: The employee calls security and they start ganging up on you. As a response to their aggression you continue to mock them and answer that they have no reason to get all fired up and that you are going to stay at the hotel wyvern they like it or not!

mission.name: Run Boy Run
mission.desc: Tired of your bad puns, the dragons start chasing you out of the hotel. You have no option but to run into the resort's wilderness and hide until it is all clear.

mission.name: Jump Scare
mission.desc: Weirdly enough the resort has some sort of swampy area, who would have thought? In Tarragon peak? You start looking around for a hiding spot when all of a sudden a huge green dragon jumps out and scares you while it yells asking what are you doing in his swamp.

mission.name: Nice to Meet You
mission.desc: You look at the huge dragon with its gigantic fangs and horns and can't help being slightly scared for your life. He asks you to stay for a bite, but you decide to politely decline by running away in the opposite direction.

mission.name: Marco Polo
mission.desc: You continue exploring through Tarragon peak when you suddenly hear a battle going on. You decide to move closer to see what is going on.

mission.name: Under Attack
mission.desc: You can see from your safe spot that a powerful but outnumbered dragon is defending her hatchling from a group of frog raiders. You decide to intervene and help out the dragon.

mission.name: Tipping the Scales
mission.desc: After a fierce fight where the dragon is losing, your intervention seems to have tipped the scales and you manage to defeat all of the raiders.

mission.name: Funny Business
mission.desc: You ask the dragon about the raiders and she answers that she overheard one of their conversations and that's why they wanted to silence her for good.

mission.name: Wrong Time Wrong Place
mission.desc: The Dragon tells you that she could take a glimpse at their leader, she describes him as a small and chaotic frog. You realize that the dragons lives could still be in danger and you decide to offer them a ride to someplace safer.

mission.name: Just Winging It
mission.desc: The dragon asks where you will be taking them and you answer that you are honestly just winging it as you go. She obviously does not find this amusing as their lives depend on you, but unfortunately for them you are still the best option they have.

mission.name: Vulcanos is Back
mission.desc: Vulcanos has emerged with thunders of dragons by its side, banish him from these lands in order to reap the rewards.

mission.name: First Thunder
mission.desc: You stand in front of the first thunder of dragons, they seem fast and deadly. Nothing you haven't handled in the past though.

mission.name: Bigger and Stronger
mission.desc: After defeating the first thunder, you can see a second set of dragons on the horizon. These seem like slower but much stronger dragons, you might have to change your strategy.

mission.name: Second Wave
mission.desc: The wave of dragons attacks you, these seem to be even stronger than the previous ones. You don't even want to imagine what Vulcanos could be preparing if you manage to survive.

mission.name: Red Skies
mission.desc: You have successfully defeated the second wave, but before you can even claim victory you start seeing how the sky turns red with dragon fire raining on top of you.

mission.name: Final Wave
mission.desc: You finally face the last wave of dragons, if you manage to defeat it Vulcanos will have been banished from these lands, at least for now.

mission.name: Ambushed at Sea
mission.desc: When traveling near the shores of Elaria, all of a sudden you can feel the ship being rammed. Screams are being heard all around. You have been ambushed!

mission.name: All-out War
mission.desc: You head towards the deck and you can see fights happening everywhere. They mostly seem like random mercenaries but one of the enemies stands out, an infuriated angel flying while striking down everything in its path.

mission.name: Things Just Got Worse
mission.desc: You and your crew manage to repel the attack. Unfortunately, when you turn around you see Terragon lying down on the ground wounded. The worst part about it, the hatchling has been abducted.

mission.name: I Will Find You
mission.desc: Due to Terragon being wounded, you make a promise to her. You will go to Elaria and rescue her hatchling all by yourself.

mission.name: Tracker
mission.desc: You disembark in Elaria and you can clearly see footsteps heading up a cliff, you decide to follow them until you find the abducters.

mission.name: Toe to Toe
mission.desc: After heading up the cliff you realize the angel is standing beneath you. There is no backing out now. You fearlessly jump right in front of her and whisper "Halo there".

mission.name: Capitulation
mission.desc: A battle breaks out between you and the angel. You look her in the eyes and yell at her about abducting an innocent hatchling. Your words seem to have calmed her down since she stops fighting to lay down her weapons.

mission.name: Alyel
mission.desc: The angel introduces herself as Alyel. She explains that she was deceived by the mercenaries, they said that you were raiders and they only had to steal something back.

mission.name: Together We Go
mission.desc: Alyel decides to join you in rescuing the hatchling. Fortunately she knows where the mercenaries stay and you head over there together.

mission.name: Payback Time
mission.desc: You find the mercenary base and you can see how they locked the hatchling in a cage. Alyel can barely hold her anger for a split second before she enters in a rage frenzy and starts taking out all of the mercenaries.

mission.name: Back in Loving Arms
mission.desc: After rescuing the hatchling, you head back towards the ship and reunite with Terragon.

mission.name: New Destination
mission.desc: Terragon notices Alyel is an angel and remembers that the frogs that tried to hurt her back in Tarragons peak mentioned Skyhaven. Realizing they could be headed there next, you decide not to go directly since you could be being followed. But where could you go?

mission.name: A Challenger Rises
mission.desc: Look who comes around, another filthy adventurer who believes they can defeat me. I would like to see you try.

mission.name: Stronger Than You Look
mission.desc: You survived huh? I see you are not as weak as you look. Although to be fair, I was only just getting started.

mission.name: Wall of Pain
mission.desc: I have had enough of you already. I have unchained a little surprise.

mission.name: One Day I Shall Return
mission.desc: Leave while you still can, adventurer, I have been expelled from my home once and I will not let it happen again.

mission.name: Birthright
mission.desc: It was my chaotic nature together with my sister's betrayal that made me lose my birthright. Yet it is also that same nature makes me stronger than her... and you.

mission.name: Rush of Fury
mission.desc: I know to acknowledge a good warrior when I see one. Although to prove yourself worthy, you must defeat the rush of fury.

mission.name: Freezing Frigore
mission.desc: After some time of meditation you decide that the perfect place to lose a tail would be Frigore. Anybody following you all the way there has no good intention.

mission.name: Fishy Frigore
mission.desc: Once you arrive at Frigore, you feel the cold penetrating into your bones. Something feels off, there is nobody around. This could be due to the cold, or else.

mission.name: Somebody's Watching Me
mission.desc: Everywhere you go you can always feel as if somebody is watching you. As if you were constantly in danger.

mission.name: Town Trouble
mission.desc: You are heading into town when suddenly a fast-moving avian strikes you while falling from a building. You don't even have a chance to react before you are laying on the ground.

mission.name: And his Name is
mission.desc: The avian pulls out a blade and is about to end you when a spell strikes him in the chest, knocking him down.

mission.name: Vanished into Thin Air
mission.desc: A group of penguin soldiers quickly arrive at the scene to aid you. Unfortunately, by the time you get up the assassin is nowhere to be found.

mission.name: Auron
mission.desc: A penguin mage greets you and introduces himself as Auron. He mentions that were he to arrive a second later it would have probably been too late for you.

mission.name: Spread Out
mission.desc: The mage says this is not over, he orders his soldiers to spread out and find the assassin. Even though you are still dazed, you decide to join the hunt.

mission.name: Odd One Out
mission.desc: You are searching for the assassin when you suddenly reach a crowd of people. You can feel him, blending in between the citizens. You start to carefully examine everybody in the crowd.

mission.name: Fool Me Once
mission.desc: You are taking a deep look into the crowds when you turn around just in time to block the assassins strike. Fortunately, the killer did not expect you to be ready.

mission.name: Down You Go
mission.desc: Auron's elites quickly take notice and between them and you, the injured assassin gets taken down. Auron proceeds to order his imprisonment.

mission.name: Insects in Distress
mission.desc: Auron has promised to keep the assassin restrained as long as necessary. You are about to head towards Skyhaven, when all of a sudden a distressed insect scout requests your aid.

mission.name: Go Time
mission.desc: Word reaches you that Ashanti is breaking out from prison. His avian allies have come from all around to aid him. Fortunately, Auron's forces are ready to assist you in a counter offensive.

mission.name: It's Getting Cold Out Here
mission.desc: You stand outside and you see mayhem all around. You decide to raid the prison before any more harm can be done. Unfortunately, the cold weather is slowing you down and Ashanti is taking advantage of this.

mission.name: Enemy at the Gates
mission.desc: Even though Ashanti's forces make their best efforts to stop you, it is not enough. You manage to arrive at the gate and gather enough strength to push through his outer defenses.

mission.name: Ashanti's Finest
mission.desc: After defeating most of his army, you rush inside and find him surrounded by his finest allies. All of them are fast and deadly assassins ready to take you down. You order Auron's Elites to take down the assassins while you chase after Ashanti himself.

mission.name: The Art of the Deal
mission.desc: After cornering Ashanti and realizing that there is now way out of this without a blood bath, you decide to offer him a deal. You offer to look the other way while he escapes in exchange for information on the frog who sent him.

mission.name: Interesting Information
mission.desc: Ashanti accepts your deal. He reveals that the contractor was no frog, even though the creature's height might have been similar to that of a frog. As he turns towards a window to conclude his escape, he warns you that this whole plot is probably bigger than it seems.

mission.name: Meet and Greet
mission.desc: The distressed insect leads you all the way to Forgotten Island. Apparently an unknown force has destroyed Beetleton, forcing most of the insects to flee. Once you arrive at the island you meet their leader, Yaritza.

mission.name: The Staff
mission.desc: Yaritza asks for your help to retrieve a magic staff that was stolen from her. Apparently, ever since they got there, a chaotic dragon has been constantly terrorizing them.

mission.name: Champion Cemetery
mission.desc: The staff was stolen when adventuring in the island's caves. In the depths of them, the type of insects you do not want to mess with dwell. One of them is known to be a weapon hoarder, an insect that by itself has defeated several champions.

mission.name: A Fair Trade
mission.desc: A bounty hunter guides you to the entrance, in exchange it only asks for some of the weapons you find in your way. This is because it has a troll to defeat and it can't do it with its current equipment. You agree and head into the caves.

mission.name: Heavy Breathing
mission.desc: You are exploring within the caves, every step you take deeper into them makes the smell become fouler and the air harder to breathe. You decide to keep pushing forward until you suddenly hear the crawling of an insect.

mission.name: The Scorpion King
mission.desc: You look in front of you and see a gigantic half undead scorpion starts rushing towards you. You run into a random direction hoping that the scorpion will get stuck in the caves behind you. After almost running out of breath, all of a sudden you trip... with a sword.

mission.name: Sword Saint
mission.desc: You lift your head just to see piles of weapons laying all around the cave. Fortunately, only a couple of them seem to stand out. Amongst them, a sword and what clearly looks like the staff you came in looking for.

mission.name: Sneaky Beaky-like
mission.desc: The staff seems just a couple of steps away. The sword seems very valuable as well, but you realize it's too much of a stretch to go for both weapons. You grab a couple of short swords for the bounty hunter and sneak towards the staff.

mission.name: Time to go
mission.desc: It is just within your reach, you manage to silently gather the staff and start heading back. While sneaking away, you hear an extremely loud screech coming from behind. You turn around and see a gigantic worm start to swing weapons in your direction.

mission.name: Run Adventurer Run
mission.desc: Running for your life, you start to dodge the weapons that the worm throws your way. Fortunately, you manage to get out of the caves alive.

mission.name: Endless Gratitude
mission.desc: Waiting for you outside is the bounty hunter. You deliver the swords you gathered and it thanks you. Noticing that you are exhausted, it helps walk you towards Yaritza. As soon as you see her, you notice a huge smile on her face.

mission.name: Duskwillow it is
mission.desc: She states that you have saved every insect on the island by recuperating the staff. Before you leave, the insect suggests you head towards Duskwillow and find a sleeping oracle that is thousands of years old. It will help you understand what is going on.

mission.name: Returning for Riches
mission.desc: You decide to go back into the dark caves of Forgotten Island in order to retrieve some of the expensive items you saw lying around the worm's cave.

mission.name: Wrong Neighborhood
mission.desc: While walking into the cave you start hearing crawling all around you. The fastest of the worm's minions have already caught your scent and they start to attack.

mission.name: Here Come the Big Ones
mission.desc: The smaller insects have been defeated, unfortunately, the insects that probably feed on the ones you just defeated have started to arrive.

mission.name: Nophora
mission.desc: After you defeat the insects, you reach the lair. There are weapons, gold and wealth as far as the eye can see. The worm's disembodied voice can be heard and it's telling you to leave before it's too late.

mission.name: Standing your Ground
mission.desc: The worm jumps out of a pile of weapons and heads straight towards you. Its attack seems very slow and you manage to quickly strike it. You think that it will be an easy fight only to realize it has healed itself in a matter of seconds.

mission.name: The Escape
mission.desc: Realizing that you won't be able to defeat it, you decide to grab as much loot as possible and head out while you still can. While heading out, you can still hear the worm chasing after you, which makes you run even faster!

mission.name: Boots on the Ground
mission.desc: You have arrived at Duskwillow in search of the Oracle that Yaritza told you about. Unsure about where to start, you head towards the nearest tavern.

mission.name: The Tavern
mission.desc: After asking around, you realize that the townspeople are trying their best to ignore your questions. Finally, somebody approaches you. The villager explains to you that the oracle you are looking for is called Veric and resides at the town's cemetery.

mission.name: Undead Ambush
mission.desc: After stepping outside, confused about the information that you have received, you head towards the cemetery. A few moments later, you realize that something is not right. You turn around, only to see an army of undead surrounding you.

mission.name: Maleficient Commander
mission.desc: A fire mage seems to be controlling the undead. You get ready to battle, but so do they. Commanded by the fire mage, the undead light themselves on fire. Realizing that they are too many, you decide to escape.

mission.name: Where are you Veric?
mission.desc: With the undead closing in on you, you rapidly head straight towards the cemetery yelling out the oracle's name. The entire place seems abandoned, until you realize that one of the tombstones has the name Veric on it.

mission.name: Nowhere to go
mission.desc: Unsure about if you were simply fooled, you realize that the undead are about to reach your position. Even though you implore for Verics help, nothing seems to happen. You decide to stand your ground and fight.

mission.name: Rising from the Dead
mission.desc: You hear the ground beneath you start moving. You stand aside and you see an undead frog rising from its grave. The frog claims to have heard your pleading and decided to rise once again.

mission.name: Unstoppable Menace
mission.desc: Veric heads straight towards the mage, even though he is struck with all kinds of spells and strikes, these do not seem to harm him.

mission.name: One-Frog Army
mission.desc: With nothing but a touch, Veric manages to take down the mage, which causes the army of undead to instantly collapse. He uses skills you have never seen before, his knowledge is clearly unmatched. You realize that you came to the right place.

mission.name: Beetleton
mission.desc: You explain to Veric what Yaritza told you that happened at Beetleton. This changes the look in his face to one of concern. You realize that he knows something.

mission.name: Could it be?
mission.desc: Veric starts explaining, it is the Void. He could feel it but was not sure. The Void is trying to claw its way back into this world again and somebody is plotting to achieve it.

mission.name: Skyhaven in Danger
mission.desc: You remember Terragon mentioning a possible attack on Skyhaven. This has to be it, they must be heading there.

mission.name: Ghost Hunters
mission.desc: Local residents of Duskwillow have asked for your assistance. They want you to get rid of a specter that has been haunting them.

mission.name: A Cry for Help
mission.desc: You decide to wait until midnight, when the specter is supposed to come out. You start to roam the town when you suddenly hear screaming.

mission.name: A Swing and a Miss
mission.desc: After rushing towards the screaming, you find the specter. It seems to be chasing after some goblin children. You take a swing at the specter but it seems to have done no damage at all.

mission.name: Slippery Specter
mission.desc: You are having a hard time dealing damage to the specter. She seems to anticipate all of your moves before you can even make them.

mission.name: Backup
mission.desc: You manage to take her down. Unfortunately, this seems to have only been the beginning. She rises again with a horde of undead creatures spawning all around her. It's time to put her down for good.

mission.name: My Job Here is Done
mission.desc: You have defeated her once again. She seems to fade away, taking all of the undead horde with her. The townsfolk of Duskwillow can finally rest assured that you got rid of the curse she had on them. Or have you?

mission.name: The Message
mission.desc: After realizing Skyhaven would be in danger you head there immediately. You manage to get there in time, only to realize that they already seem to be preparing for an attack.

mission.name: Anonymous
mission.desc: An angel commander informs you that they very recently received an anonymous warning with very detailed information on the attack. All allies were called to defend the city.

mission.name: The Assault
mission.desc: Before you can ask any questions, the city is being assaulted. You can see how docens of mercenary frogs are breaching the city's defenses.

mission.name: Treason
mission.desc: Amongst the crowd, you can notice two particular individuals. The first one, wielding a sword and displaying his sharp teeth is who seems to be their commander. And even though you can't believe your eyes, next to him is Alyel.

mission.name: Breach
mission.desc: You realize that the frog army is trying to breach into the throne room. You decide to take advantage of them being distracted to tackle Alyel and make her come to her senses.

mission.name: Confusion
mission.desc: You manage to take down Alyel, only to realize that she looks lost, maybe even confused. She explains that she lost control over herself for a while, as if she was being manipulated by somebody else.

mission.name: The Raid
mission.desc: You make Alyel come to her senses and tell her to leave immediately. Luckily, she seems to listen to reason and heads out. Unfortunately, by the time you get her to leave, the frogs have already raided the throne room.

mission.name: Chaos Room
