mission.desc: You enter the throne room and see the entire place set on fire. The commander, who is laughing hysterically, orders his troops to attack you.

mission.name: The Throne
mission.desc: Together with the angel troops, you manage to defeat the frog army. The commander is still laughing hysterically, when all of a sudden the throne starts shining.

mission.name: Not Worthy
mission.desc: The throne creates a barrier that puts out the fire in the entire room. Once it is cleared, it completely freezes the commander in his place, ending his havoc on Skyhaven.

mission.name: The Arrival
mission.desc: Angels from all over the continent start arriving at Skyhaven. The frogs are now greatly outnumbered. You realize that the mercenary frogs never stood a chance.

mission.name: The Realization
mission.desc: You realize that this was all a setup. A huge distraction for something much bigger, you can feel it in the air now, what Veric told you was coming. You look up and see how the sky is slowly turning purple, becoming tainted by the Void.

mission.name: Interrogation
mission.desc: Caesar was captured and sent into a cell deep within Skyhaven. You have decided to head there and interrogate the mercenary commander.

mission.name: Maniac
mission.desc: Caesar is being held in an ice cell, due to it being his weakness. He seems out of his mind and babbling nonsense. You get closer to hear what the frog is saying, when all of a sudden Caesar bites into you with his sharp teeth.

mission.name: A Spark was All he Needed
mission.desc: A fully armored angel comes in to help you. The angel manages to use its chain to trap Caesar. Unfortunately, the chains create the sparks that he needs in order to scorch the entire cell and free himself from the ice that traps him.

mission.name: Scorch Extinguisher
mission.desc: You start putting out the flames as fast as you can. There is fire everywhere but you manage to create an opening to confront Caesar.

mission.name: Chained for Too Long
mission.desc: Caesar seems weak, you confront him and he does not seem able to put up a good fight against you. Angel reinforcements start arriving at the cell. The commander finds himself cornered and uses his powers one last time to escape.

mission.name: Nice Try
mission.desc: Caesar scorches everything around him, creating twice as much fire as before. Unfortunately for him, reinforcements have arrived and he does not manage to escape from your grip.

mission.name: Void Plane
mission.desc: With the help of Skyhavens angels, you manage to figure out that the Void's energy is coming from the Void Plane. Together with an army provided by Skyhaven, you head there with no time to waste.

mission.name: A Portal to the Other Side
mission.desc: Once you reach the Plane, you see with your own eyes what you feared the most. A huge portal the size of a giant is active, letting all kinds of Void creatures into our world. But what surprises you the most, is the individual responsible for opening the portal.

mission.name: Remi
mission.desc: He who you thought to be nothing but a figment of your imagination, Remi. It was him all along, pulling strings and creating mayhem to distract you from what he was planning.

mission.name: A Bigger Problem
mission.desc: Just when you thought things couldn't get worse, a giant colossus crosses the portal from the void. Its size and powers are nothing like what you have ever seen before.

mission.name: Go Time
mission.desc: You command a small group of Skyhavens army and have them follow you into battle. It's time to banish the Void creatures back to where they came from.

mission.name: The Giant from the Void
mission.desc: You head straight towards the Void giant who happens to be near Remi himself. You are responsible for freeing him, now it's time to lock him up.

mission.name: Portal
mission.desc: You arrive near the entrance of the portal expecting to see a counter attack towards your army, but you realize that something is off. The Void giant seems to be recognizing Remi as another enemy.

mission.name: Away he Goes
mission.desc: Remi looks astonished and proceeds to vanish into thin air. Before you can even process what happened, you see a huge boulder flying towards you.

mission.name: Victory
mission.desc: You manage to dodge the boulder and proceed to command your army to attack. Soldiers start swarming the portal's entrance up until the point where the Void creatures, including the giant, are forced back into the portal.

mission.name: Mecha Menace
mission.desc: Once the creatures are back in the portal, you start to think of ways to shut it down. You realize that the portal is being channeled from a small mecha right behind it. Together with some soldiers, you smash it until it can no longer power the portal.

mission.name: Void on the Loose
mission.desc: Even though you have managed to close the portal, you don't know how many Void creatures had already been set loose. You now also know that Remi is capable of creating portal opening machines.

mission.name: Remi or not here I come
mission.desc: The next steps are obvious, you need to hunt Remi down and lock him up for good. As long as he is free, he can keep creating portals to the Void. He must be stopped before it is too late.

mission.name: Year 2016
mission.desc: Spellstone's 7th Anniversary celebration has begun! Defeat this node's enemies and get amazing rewards!

mission.name: Year 2017
mission.desc: Spellstone's 7th Anniversary celebration has begun! Defeat this node's party titans and get amazing rewards!

mission.name: Year 2018
mission.desc: Spellstone's 7th Anniversary celebration has begun! Defeat this node's party titans and uninvited guests and get amazing rewards!

mission.name: Year 2019
mission.desc: Spellstone's 7th Anniversary celebration has begun! Defeat this node's... (not very sober and voidish) entity of evil and get amazing rewards!

mission.name: Year 2020
mission.desc: Spellstone's 7th Anniversary celebration manages to continue despite the booze-drinking void! Defeat this node's party titan and get amazing rewards!

mission.name: Year 2021
mission.desc: Spellstone's 7th Anniversary celebration continues with some minor landscape damage! Defeat this node's party titan and get amazing rewards!

mission.name: Year 2022
mission.desc: Spellstone's 7th Anniversary celebration is ending, this whole event seems like one huge deja vu for some reason.

mission.name: The Search
mission.desc: You set out to track down Remi after he escaped. While navigating through the Void Plane, the Aether looking goblin shows up in front of you.

mission.name: Blink of an Eye
mission.desc: Knowing him too well, you prepare for an attack. Remi in the blink of an eye manages to vanish only to appear right behind you, but now completely red, covered in chaos. He strikes, but you manage to evade him.

mission.name: The Plot
mission.desc: Remi vanishes once again. You can hear his mischievous laugh all around you. You realize that he is somehow connected with more than one faction. This is probably related to him plotting for the Void to come into this world again.

mission.name: Absence of Them All
mission.desc: You try to make Remi come to his senses, you mention that the Void isn't the combination of all factions, but instead the absence of them. This seems to anger Remi, since you can no longer hear him laughing.

mission.name: Voices
mission.desc: You start to hear different voices, as if Remi was arguing with himself. All of a sudden, you can't hear him anymore.

mission.name: This is not Over
mission.desc: Remi comes out of nowhere and strikes you once again, you barely manage to block him in time. He proceeds to vanish, but as soon as he leaves you can hear him whisper that this is not over.

mission.name: Welcome Back
mission.desc: After Remi escapes you manage to track him down to his last known location, the Salt Wastes.

mission.name: The Search
mission.desc: You begin your search on these hostile lands. Even if you can't find him, you must destroy his technology to stop the Void from coming back.

mission.name: The Hideout
mission.desc: Hidden behind a pile of rocks and dust you manage to spot what seems like an entrance. You can tell that somebody has been here recently and decide to head in.

mission.name: Void Artifacts
mission.desc: You enter the hideout only to see tons of scrap lying around and dozens of makeshift robots. This has to be a mecha workshop. That wouldn't be much of a problem if not for the fact that you can tell Remi is using Void artifacts to enhance his creations.

mission.name: There You Are
mission.desc: After taking a look around you continue to explore the workshop only to catch Remi red-handed. He seems to be doing some small adjustments on a menacing looking robot that is forged out of some purple looking metal.

mission.name: Power On
mission.desc: Before you can even take a step into Remi's direction, you realize he just powered on the robot. The mecha starts channeling a void energy and is aiming your way. Remi has discovered how to use Void artifacts as weapons.

mission.name: Channeled into Destruction
mission.desc: The channeler starts heading your way, you try to strike it from afar but nothing seems to damage it. The mecha starts destroying everything in its path with its powerful weapons system.

mission.name: Powered by the Void
mission.desc: You realize that the only reason for its immense power has to be a Void artifact located somewhere behind its armor.

mission.name: Chink in the Armor
mission.desc: You circle around the Mecha and manage to find a weak spot in its back. This is probably what Remi was trying to fix moments before you arrived. Before it can turn around, you manage to pierce through its weak spot, causing the mecha collapse.

mission.name: Left Empty-handed
mission.desc: Even though Remi has managed to escape, he was in such a hurry that he could not take any of his equipment with him. He has left empty handed and has nowhere to go.

mission.name: Nothing but ashes
mission.desc: To avoid having the equipment stolen you destroy all of Remis Void technology except for one thing. You keep one of Remi's portal opening Mechas, so that next time you encounter a Void creature you can send it back to where it belongs.

mission.name: Duskwillow It Is
mission.desc: When destroying Remi's equipment you find some suspicious documents. You realize that Remi was smuggling Void technology through a pirate organization. You now know where you are heading next.

mission.name: The Creeper
mission.desc: A beast has emerged in Arcantica and its roaming the Salt Wastes to feast on unsuspecting victims until it is satisfied.

mission.name: Trick or Treat
mission.desc: The creature seems to have been inhabiting these lands for hundreds of years and it is out for a treat once again.

mission.name: The Hunt
mission.desc: You set out to hunt the beast and bring peace once again to these lands, but everywhere you look you can only see fire.

mission.name: Blazing Blades
mission.desc: From the flames, the flying beast emerges and heads straight towards you with its razor-sharp claws. You manage to dodge its strikes, but you can not see where it went.

mission.name: Burn
mission.desc: You start heading out of the fire, the heat given off by the combustion in your surroundings is causing you to feel light headed. Just when you get out of danger, the beast emerges again shooting fire out of its hands.

mission.name: Back to Sleep
mission.desc: You see the beast approaching and just when it is about to scorch you down, you manage to strike it, damaging one of its wings. The beast has no choice but to retreat back to its lair and end its threat on Arcantica sooner than what it intended.

mission.name: The Tale of Pumpking
mission.desc: The goblins from Goblin Rise Stronghold retell to Daknak the tragic tale of Pumpking, a king who only wanted to spread goodwill by giving children candy. However, he met a tragic end when his rivals played an unfair trick upon him, cheating him of his rewards.

line.text: Bahaha! Daknak laugh at silly Pumpking story! Might be fooled the first time they promised me rewards, but not this one!
Ooh, Boss! Be careful how many times you say that name; something bad happens if you say it three times!

mission.name: Pumpking's Appearance?
mission.desc: Although the goblins warned Daknak about the power of Pumpking's name, Daknak tests his luck. He departs from the other goblins, laughing at their ghost story.

line.text: Daknak have no fear of Pumpking! Daknak say Pumpking name more times than Daknak!
Daknak say Pumpking, Pumpking, Pumpking!
D-Daknak sorry! Please give me candy and the rewards of the node this time!

mission.name: More Trick Than Treat
mission.desc: The strange apparition lays something by Daknak's feet, before turning and fading into the night. The goblins return in time to see Daknak holding the item.

line.text: Ghost left... a pumpkin full of candy?
Thanks for getting us some sweet candy, Boss! Is this time for real or the devs messed it up again?
Hey, no take! That's Daknak's candy!

mission.name: Help from a Local
mission.desc: You arrive at Duskwillow with your only objective being to find the pirate organization and retrieve any Void artifacts they might have. You spot a tavern and decide to head in and ask the locals about the pirates.

mission.name: The Armada
mission.desc: One of the locals tells you that the organization you are looking for is known as "The Armada". They also tell you that if you want more information on them, your best bet is to speak with their ancient rivals, the Dragon Family.

mission.name: The Dragon Family
mission.desc: You head towards the cliff where the local said the Dragons would be and there they are, a clan formed by dozens of dragons as far as you can tell. A peaceful yet fearsome looking Dragon approaches.

mission.name: Lost at Sea
mission.desc: After explaining your situation to the dragon, it explains to you that the pirates have recently crossed through the border between The Armada and their territory, breaking an ancient truce and forcing them to sink one of their ships.

mission.name: The Artifact
mission.desc: You explain to them that it is likely that they are in possession of a Void artifact which can be used to craft weapons of immense power that nobody should ever wield. The Dragon looks concerned about this information.

mission.name: Dragon Army
mission.desc: The Dragon suggests that you join forces to cross the no man's land and recuperate the artifact before it is too late. You agree and head out to sea on ship, together with an army of Dragons swimming by your side.

mission.name: Barrage
mission.desc: Once you cross the border into the no man's land you can easily spot the Armada of ships. Their black sails can be spotted as far as the eye can see. The pirates waste little time before they start firing your way.

mission.name: Awakening of the Hydra
mission.desc: A fight breaks loose, the dragons start ramming the ships and the pirates start blasting their cannons towards them. In the midst of the fight you can start feeling how something is emerging from the depths of the ocean.

mission.name: The Void Rises
mission.desc: A Void looking Hydra emerges in the middle of the battle and starts attacking both sides indiscriminately. The Hydra proves to be stronger than both the Dragons and the Armadas ships.

mission.name: A Common Enemy
mission.desc: Both sides temporarily join forces and start attacking the Hydra. The cannon fire from above and the dragon's attacks from below prove to be too much for the Hydra, forcing it back into the depths of the ocean.

mission.name: Void Mutations
mission.desc: After the Hydra is defeated, you come to the conclusion that the ship that was sunk before you arrived was probably carrying the Void artifact. A sea creature must have consumed it, making it mutate into what it has now become.

mission.name: Truce
mission.desc: Both sides no longer have a reason to fight each other and without a handshake required, the truce is formed once again.

mission.name: The Alliance
mission.desc: You manage to contact and hire The Armada's fleet to banish the Void Hydra together by using Remi's Machine to channel a portal.

mission.name: Tracing a Plan
mission.desc: Together with their captain, you start to trace a complex and convoluted plan. Meanwhile, The Armada's sailors are changing their cannons for bigger ones, even using some of their goods as shields for the hull of their ships.

mission.name: The Raid
mission.desc: Your feet tremble at the sight of the entire fleet and the sound of the battle cry made by each of the sailors. With the biggest ships in front, like an indestructible wall, you start facing the imponent Hydra.

mission.name: Distraction
mission.desc: With the fleet at the position, the War Galleons started the whirl formation around the Monster, with their sailors waiting to start shooting those horrible heads!

mission.name: Infiltration
mission.desc: Taking your boat and three of the best captain's men to give you a hand, you take the void machine and use the cannon shots to camouflage yourself and go unnoticed by those monstrous heads!

mission.name: Pirates Aren't So Bad After All
mission.desc: An enormous vortex starts to grow in the Hydra's body and swallows it, the monster screams and roars while trying to escape, but it's too late. Your plan was a tremendous success! The Void Hydra is now banished from our realm.

mission.name: Angel Reports
mission.desc: Angel spies have spotted Void activity at Golden Crown Village. You decided to head there immediately with hopes of banishing another creature with the Void Channeler.

mission.name: Tech Adept
mission.desc: As soon as you arrive you manage to spot the threat. A goblin that is clearly wielding one of Remi's Void gadgets. It seems like the trickster still has a couple of tricks up his sleeve.

mission.name: Pulverizer
mission.desc: You head straight towards the goblin and realize that it isn't even looking at you. It fires its weapon and the bolt somehow manages to track its way towards you striking extremely close to your position.

mission.name: Void Strikes
mission.desc: This weapon is more powerful than what it seemed. The goblin continues to fire its weapon, with each strike landing closer than the one before.

mission.name: Eureka
mission.desc: After too many close calls you realize its weakness. You head towards the goblin at full speed and when it fires its weapon, you jump behind the goblin. The bolt continues to track you but goes through the goblin instead, pulverizing it in an instant.

mission.name: Portal
mission.desc: Nothing but a damaged weapon remains from the encounter, you believe to have won but you realize something is wrong. Everything is quiet, too quiet. All of a sudden, you can hear a portal open up behind you.

mission.name: Surprise Strike
mission.desc: You turn around and immediately get struck. Another Goblin wielding a Void gadget has now appeared and it is ready to take you down.

mission.name: The Teleporter
mission.desc: The goblin is wielding a gauntlet that allows it to open and close portals that are big enough for it to fit through them. This allows the goblin to appear wherever it wants to in a matter of seconds.

mission.name: Realization
mission.desc: You try to anticipate where it will come from to no avail. You do manage to realize that as soon as the goblin goes into a portal, it appears at its new location in an instant.

mission.name: Piggyback into the Void
mission.desc: Patiently, you wait for the goblin to strike again. Once it appears, you let it strike you, only for you to jump in right behind it onto the next portal it opens.

mission.name: The Tables Turn
mission.desc: You manage to appear right behind it at its next location, the goblin does not expect this and you manage to strike before it can even realize what happened. Defeated, the goblin uses its gauntlet to escape.

mission.name: The Void is Coming
mission.desc: Before you can turn back, you can hear the mischievous laugh once again. You turn around only to find Remi taking the Void Channeler and then vanishing into thin air. You decide to send a message to Skyhaven, the Angels must assemble the army.

mission.name: Two Old Men Reunited
mission.desc: Malchior has dragged Tarian out of the small shack. The two friends catch up on what they've missed over the last few months, as Malchior has been traveling on the airship.

line.text: Malchior, why did you call me out here?
It's simple, my friend... I require your skills!

mission.name: World's Center Dangers
mission.desc: Malchior takes Tarian past the rocky path, into the snowy forest. They pass many diseased, rotted trees; monsters and undead lurking in their shadows.

line.text: There is an enemy that only you can feel...
Then this must be serious, if you're asking me over your adventurer friend.

mission.name: The Biggest Tree
mission.desc: Malchior stops at a large tree, one of the few that hasn't been tainted by the disease. It grows strong and tall, evergreen pine needles sticking out from its branches.

line.text: Right here! This gigantic pine tree!-

mission.name: Ax of the Lich Lord
mission.desc: Tarian stops cold. He has humored many of Malchior's outlandish requests in the past, but he cannot figure out his motivation behind this one.

line.text: Malchior, my ax is meant for cleaving bone, not chopping firewood!

mission.name: Holiday Presents
mission.desc: Malchior begs Tarian to reconsider his earlier choice. The tree is meant for others who have never seen such things, not for one of Malchior's experiments.

line.text: But think of the Chaos children back in Karthos, and how they'd decorate this big tree!
Fine, I'll do it, but don't you dare tell anyone about this. I have a reputation to uphold.

mission.name: A Dangerous Nap
mission.desc: Krampus was a mean and grumpy fellow, on the night of Christmas, he felt quite mellow, he had no idea that his fate was so dire, for on the next day, he would get lost in the mire.

mission.name: The Day After Christmas
mission.desc: He started to yawn and he started to doze, Krampus fell asleep with his heart filled with woes, he didn't know that he'd be led astray. On the morning of December 26th, he'd lost the way.

mission.name: The Brazen Robbery
mission.desc: Krampus started to wander, his heart filled with glee, he took all the presents, leaving none for thee. He thought to himself he was doing no wrong, but the kids were so sad when the gifts were gone.

mission.name: Looking for the Culprit
mission.desc: Our Hero heard their cries, he had to investigate, he soon realized that their gifts had to be straight, he followed the clues, he followed the track. Krampus was the culprit, and he had to be attacked.

mission.name: The Villain's Punishment
mission.desc: Our Hero fought hard, he fought with all his might, but Krampus was tough, and he put up one hell of a fight. Our Hero was tired and his strength was low, but he was determined to make Krampus go.

mission.name: The Miracle After Christmas
mission.desc: With one final punch, our Hero made Krampus fall. He managed to get all the gifts back for all, the kids were so happy, their faces shone bright. It was a Christmas miracle, and all was alright.

mission.name: The Calm Before the Storm
mission.desc: All the inhabitants of Arcantica enjoyed the peace of vanishing the Void, but you heard that laugh and you know what that means, we need to be prepared. So, as fast as you can, you travel to Skyhaven, to alert the tribe of angels.

mission.name: The Advice
mission.desc: When you arrive at Skyhaven, you realize that the tribe of Angels was hoarding a massive amount of gold in this time of peace. When you give advice about the fact that Remi will return, all the angels start to be prepared for that moment.

mission.name: The Return of Remi
mission.desc: The sound of the Angelical Army getting ready for the combat was silenced by the roar of multiple portals rifting everywhere. Remi has returned.

mission.name: Gain Some Time
mission.desc: The Void ambush was more quick than expected. The angelical army wasn't prepared yet, but you stand against the Void horde with a few angelical warriors at your side.

mission.name: The Fight
mission.desc: You feel like it's an endless horde of creatures from the void, but together with your winged partners resist bravely and start to advance, destroying each enemy that is put in front of you.

mission.name: Reaching the Portal
mission.desc: With all your effort you can reach the first Void portal, but in that moment you hear the laugh of Remi, and a huge explosion pushes you away from the portal. Remi is ready to destroy Arcantica, and it seems you are the only one who can deal with it.

mission.name: The Retreat
mission.desc: Remi and his horde were too much to deal with. You start your retreat, trying to make the way difficult for the enemies, who come towards you totally enraged.

mission.name: Resist the Attack
mission.desc: The Void horde led by Remi is relentless, but you receive reinforcements and a message that says that you need to resist because the angels are getting ready a final weapon to defeat Remi and the Void creatures.

mission.name: Uncommon Allies
mission.desc: The second wave of reinforcements came with a great surprise, the representatives of the three factions joined forces, Alyel, Leyla and Freya appeared side by side flying and destroying all the enemies in their way.

mission.name: The Big Revelation
mission.desc: You see how the horde seems to be multiplied after each hit, the hopes start to vanish from the angelical army and you start to lose your strength, but a massive light illuminates the skies, Midas, The Disruptor was released.

mission.name: The Justice is Invincible
mission.desc: Midas is a giant gold golem and the reason why the angels were hoarding that massive amount of gold, the power of this colossus is unstoppable. With each attack it destroys entire armies of void creatures.

mission.name: The Final Justice
mission.desc: With the invaluable help of Midas you can reach Remi in a one on one battle, he tries to use his tricks and traps to escape, but you are faster and stronger than him, with a final blow you can capture and imprison him, the Justice was delivered.

mission.name: Searching For Cooperation
mission.desc: With Remi imprisoned, the conflict between the three factions of angels return with more power, but you saw the potential if they joined forces. So, now you put a mission to yourself; create the union of the three factions to reveal the true potential of the Angels tribe.

mission.name: The Smallest Doesn't Mean The Weakest
mission.desc: You approach Freya, the commandant of the Wyld faction in the Angel Tribe. When she hears your offer to create an alliance with the other factions, she asks for two things, the first one is, like in nature, an equal balance of power, and the second, a proof of your strength.

mission.name: A Chaotic Reception
mission.desc: Before you can reach Alyel, her troops stop you and ask you to prove yourself worth it so that Commander Alyel spends her valuable time.

mission.name: Even Chaos has its Logic
mission.desc: Alyel was training some new recruits. When you arrived she told you that she knew what you wanted from her, but to just forget about it. She doesn't want an alliance, she only wants more power, so if you can show that to her she will be part of your plan.

mission.name: The Aether Puzzle
mission.desc: When you stand in the magnificent doors of the Aether faction building a sign takes your attention " Everyone that thinks is worthy needs to move across the Invisible Maze and survive ".

mission.name: The Winged Union
mission.desc: When you reach the final of the Aether Labyrinth, you go up some stairs and can see the three Angelicals commanders clapping and congratulating you. Now the Angel tribe is united, your next mission is to do the same with the other tribes.

mission.name: Return to the Cave
mission.desc: You head towards Beetleton Bunker guided by a rumor that there is a new hero capable of unifying everyone with his power inherited from a Saint.

mission.name: Will my Memory be Wrong?
mission.desc: Beetleton Bunker seems a little more peculiar than you remember. It is now adorned with colored leaves and garlands of a goo that glows in a pink pale color.

mission.name: A Surprising Reception
mission.desc: At the entrance you can see a creature similar to a ladybug, but its dots are heart-shaped, and it holds a golden scepter with a bright red heart-shaped stone in its leg. It receives you effusively, welcoming you to the Carnival of Couples.

mission.name: A Guided Tour
mission.desc: This particular ladybug invites you to a tour in the Carnival and the possibility of meeting the great hero that stole the legendary saint sword of Phomora and is responsible for this great festival.

mission.name: A Walk Through the Carnival
mission.desc: While you walk along with this ladybug receptionist you can see a lot of joy in all the inhabitants of the cave, and surprisingly a lot of couples have been made, those insects that before were extremely furious, now are happy and searching for love.

mission.name: The Encounter with the Hero
mission.desc: Now your guide leads you to the throne where you can see a massive cloud of pheromones that makes it impossible to see through. In that place you can see an insectoid creature that seems like a cricket, using a machine to accumulate all the pheromones and feed it with that.

mission.name: A Bad Feeling
mission.desc: When this insectoid sees you, it gives you a warm welcome. It presents itself as Kattoraki the Hero that defeated Phomora, but when it starts to talk about the fight, you know that is a lie, because you remember your fight with Phomora.

mission.name: The Interrogation Begins
mission.desc: After hearing all the story of Kattoraki, you know that is an impostor and that sword is not the Sword Saint Kattos. So you start to ask really precise and incisive questions to Kattoraki to show the deception to the inhabitants of Bettleton Bunker.

mission.name: The False Hero Exposed
mission.desc: Your guide, astonished with this revelation, shouts to the people of Beetleton Bunker that their supposed hero is nothing more than a hoax and that the Phomora threat is still a reality. In that moment Kattoraki jumps to attack your guide but you stop it.

mission.name: The Fight
mission.desc: You start your fight against Kattoraki, after a few hits you think that the battle is near to end but in that moment Kattoraki starts to expel pheromones from his body and all the inhabitants of Beetleton Bunker fall into its control.

mission.name: Crowd Control
mission.desc: All the insects hypnotized by the pheromones of Kattoraki start to defend it from you and attack you fiercely, but you quickly think of a strategy to release them from the Kattoraki control, make them fall into the water at the bottom of the cave.

mission.name: The Truth Always Prevails
mission.desc: Now with all its hypnotized army dismantled, Kattoraki cries for mercy and promises you wealth and power if you let him free. But you don't agree with it, and vanish it to the prisoner's cellar.

mission.name: After the Justice
mission.desc: After the imprisonment of Kattoraki, you ask the inhabitants of Beetleton Bunker to unify all the tribe's factions, because you experienced first hand that if the factions are united, the potential is unlimited.

mission.name: An Impossible Request
mission.desc: The leaders of each faction said to you, that they think they reached that union with the false hero, but now they need a symbol of strength to follow and maintain that union. So they ask you to give them the Real Sword of Katto.

mission.name: On the Way to the Big Test
mission.desc: You decide to go again to The Forgotten Island and face Nophora once more. You know that confrontation must be avoided, your only goal is to leave Forgotten Island alive with that Sword.

mission.name: The Nophora's Cave
mission.desc: At the exact time you put a foot inside of the Cave, the floor shakes indicating that Nophora knows about your presence. You will need all of your skill and a huge amount of luck to succeed on this mission.

mission.name: Facing Nophora
mission.desc: When you reach the Lair, in that exact moment, Nophora emerges, attacking you fiercely. You use all your capabilities to avoid it and face the Katto's Sword, but Nophora is determined to kill you this time.

mission.name: The Success
mission.desc: You reach the sword and, in the exact moment that you have it in your power, a giant rock falls on Nophora, restraining it and giving you a safe path to flee. It's a miracle. Now on Beetleton Bunker, you finally complete your goal: the insect tribe is united.

mission.name: Trader Mentality
mission.desc: You arrive at Tarragon Peak after hearing about a delicious edible delicacy from the region. Your plan is to buy or collect a large quantity of these and take them to be traded with possible big profits as an exotic product.

mission.name: Beginning of the Search
mission.desc: Common sense suggests you start looking at places of commerce. Maybe restaurants, markets and barter shops. So you head in that direction, with the best attitude.

mission.name: No Delicacies to be Found
mission.desc: You pass through the places where there are more inhabitants and buildings. The less inhospitable areas and far from the bubbling hot lava, but you can't find where to get what you're looking for.

mission.name: It Appears You Came Chasing a Rumor
mission.desc: After searching and asking everywhere, no one knows about said delicacy and now you doubt its true existence. Finally, after a long time, you find two familiar dragons to ask about the delicacy.

mission.name: Finally a Clue
mission.desc: You speak with Kuroilong and Howaito and they contradict each other in their stories. One says that he did hear about it and the other assures that this is false. Something in Howaito's look makes you suspicious.

mission.name: Follow the breadcrumbs
mission.desc: Before saying goodbye to the dragons, one of them coughs as if he had something in his throat, his eyes reddened and his gaze placid, but he overcomes it. They both fly away in the direction of the forest.

mission.name: The right place for a delicacy
mission.desc: Between doubt and curiosity to find the aforementioned delicacy, you arrive at a wooded area, quite warm and leafy. Great smells and colors everywhere.

mission.name: The Watcher
mission.desc: A large wooden-looking dragon, with runes and wings that look like foliage, seems to be watching you walk through the forest. Tiendroantun flies through the skies over the place.

mission.name: Protector of Life
mission.desc: After hours of traveling in the forest, you meet the Protector of Life. Tiendroantun comes with heavy steps, walking through the trees. His runes now glow reddish, not the cool blue you remember seeing in the past.

mission.name: The Bet
mission.desc: You go directly to the point and ask about the edible delicacy of the region. Tiendroantun with a smile on his face proposes a bet. If you win, you will be able to take a large sack with you. If not, you will lose a chunk of your gold.

mission.name: Bright Red Fruits
mission.desc: The great dragon presents a wooden bowl with bright red fruits. Tiendroantun says that only if you manage to eat more of these delicacies than him, you will win the bet.

mission.name: Fire!
mission.desc: After the first bite, you discover that they are amazingly delicious. As you sweat and tear your eyes up from all the heat, you think that this really could be a big deal. Luckily, the dragon didn't know that you are a fan of spicy food.

mission.name: The Vengeance is Spicy
mission.desc: With the Fire Fruits in your power, you decide to continue your mission of unifying all the factions for each tribe.

mission.name: Spark the Tribe Leader
mission.desc: Spark tells you that if you want to unify the proud Dragon tribe, you need to defeat the principal cause for this faction's rupture: Vulcanos.

mission.name: Searching for the Lava Nightmare
mission.desc: Spark points to the Tarragon volcano, then tells you that after your recent fight, Vulcanos hid there to heal itself, absorbing all the lava to recover its strength.

mission.name: Climbing the Volcano
mission.desc: You decide to reach the top of the Volcano and fight one more time against Vulcanos to stop it once and for all. Immediately, as soon as you start climbing, a lot of Fire Rocks are being shot at you at an incredible speed.

mission.name: The Top of the Volcano
mission.desc: You can see that Vulcanos is waiting for you. Now it's even bigger and more aggressive than in your previous encounter, but you notice that also it is slower. Besides its power and with all the lava surrounding you, you manage to defeat it without big issues.

mission.name: The Reunion
mission.desc: With Vulcanos finally vanished, you return to Tarragon Peak and all the leaders greet you with roars and breathing fire into the sky. Your goal is finally accomplished: The Dragon tribe is now united!

mission.name: A New Kind of Frog?
mission.desc: During your travel, you are attacked by a small group of an unknown, agressive kind of lava frogs.. You reach the nearest town and ask about them. Someone tells you that they are related to an ancient lost tribe.

mission.name: Suspicious Clues
mission.desc: While doing some research, someone heard that another party with a similar goal went to the mountains and never returned. Also, similar aggressive frogs have been spotted there.

mission.name: Following the Breadcrumbs
mission.desc: You and your party travel to the mountains to investigate. There, you find scattered clothes and equipment. Meanwhile, in the distance, furious croaks can be heard coming from all directions, you've been ambushed!

mission.name: Unexpected Help
mission.desc: You've been surrounded, apparently, by the Lost tribe that you were looking for, but also by a considerable group of ferocious lava frogs that suddenly attacks everyone. You get to fight alongside the tribe against them.

mission.name: An Ancient Evil has been Unleashed
mission.desc: The tribe recites the legend of the ancient evil King, Worf. It was sealed in that mountain, the previous party is aiming to resurrect it! You return to the Wastes to look out for help but only the Tech tribe is willing to help.

mission.name: Unlikely Alloys
mission.desc: The Tech tribe lend you their latest invention: B4RN4B1. Altogether with the Lost tribe, you've returned to find out that Worf is alive and it is marching into the Wastes. Everyone agrees to fight to stop it.

mission.name: Remnants of the Storm
mission.desc: After bringing peace to the Wastes by defeating the evil Worf, there are rumors coming from a town about missing people. You've been asked to investigate it for a generous reward.

mission.name: Hunting in the Town
mission.desc: While searching for some clues throughout the town with the help of Atlatl, the best Hunter from the lost tribe, a group of strange looking, thug frogs follow your steps and demand you to stop the investigation.

mission.name: Time For An Expected Trap
mission.desc: The thugs wore robes with a strange particular medallion and one of them has a scroll with an address with your names on it. You and the party steal these robes to disguise and follow this lead to the center of the town.

mission.name: Under Pressure
mission.desc: Once you reach your destination, you only find an alley with a door. After knocking, you're requested with a password. You've been discovered and surrounded by more thug frogs.

mission.name: A Lunatic Scheme
mission.desc: You manage to get inside and there, you see a lunatic, frenzied frog experimenting with some of the missing citizens and some lava minion frogs. Atlatl quickly attacks the minions while you have to deal with the lunatic frog.

mission.name: Light Shines Upon the City Once More
mission.desc: You managed, barely, to stop the frenzied frog and unmask its true identity: Lunatic Paul. He intended to create its own cult by fusing genes from other tribes into the lava minions, but you've put an end to its evil scheme.

mission.name: Trying to Unify
mission.desc: With the Menace of Paul and Worf cleared, you have the confidence to ask the Frog tribe to dismantle the factions to Unify the whole tribe.

mission.name: The Problem
mission.desc: Atlatl comments to you that there's a reason for the tribes to be divided: Caesar. A being that never stops creating problems between the factions because it simply loves to create chaos and destruction.

mission.name: Looking for Caesar
mission.desc: As you experienced before, Caesar is slippery. So, you ask Atlatl if he knows where to find it. He tells you that there's actually some rumors about some stolen weapons, between the scouts of the factions.

mission.name: A Fast Research
mission.desc: You've spotted a group of scouts fighting intensely. As you come closer to stop the fight, you can recognize Caesar disguised as a Wyld faction scout laughing at the distance with a stolen box.

mission.name: A Fast Pursuit
mission.desc: Your party begins pursuing Caesar and when you think you've lost him, Atlatl spots him and helps you to corner him. Caesar starts to attack you fiercely, he is stronger and faster now than he ever was!

mission.name: The Unification
mission.desc: After a tough battle, you capture Caesar and show the evidence of his plan to prevent the tribe unification publicly. After that, Caesar is imprisoned forever, next to Paul. You've accomplished your mission to unify another tribe.

mission.name: A New Challenge
mission.desc: You arrive at the Gladius Scriptorium, a place where you had once been a champion. You are eager to compete once again but realize that the competition is much tougher than before.

mission.name: The First Clashes
mission.desc: As you start to walk around the place, you see some familiar faces and receive some minor challenges from young fighters who want to prove themselves against you.

mission.name: A Cold Fight
mission.desc: After days in the Gladius Scriptorium, Austra, the Ice Mage, challenges you to a duel. Finally, a deserving opponent.

mission.name: Walking on Thin Ice
mission.desc: That fight was a tough one. Austra was seeking revenge for a previous defeat, and apparently was preparing for a long time.

mission.name: The Flying Nightmare
mission.desc: Then came Gaerriel. The Flying Nightmare is a fierce avian monster. He was expecting to catch you tired and injured. But in the end, you prevail again.

mission.name: Stop the Competition
mission.desc: After defeating them both, you are catching up, getting to know each other a little better, when a large group of bandit Avians enter the Scriptorium and start attacking you all.

mission.name: Defend the Scriptorium
mission.desc: You, Austra and Gaerriel, and the other champions start defending the place. A great battle begins and many innocents are also involved.

mission.name: Gurk's Treason
mission.desc: In the middle of the fight, you and your allies find out that Gurk has turned rogue. He is the one who has made deals with a group of avians who seek to destroy the Scriptorium.

mission.name: Searching the Traitor
mission.desc: You and the other champions must work together to defeat that much bandit Avians lead by The Traitor.

mission.name: Facing the Traitor
mission.desc: Numerous fights test your skill. Many of your allies have fallen, when you finally come face to face with Gurk, the Traitor.

mission.name: Avoiding Traps
mission.desc: The two of you engage in a back-and-forth struggle. You must use all your wits and skill to overcome his tricks and deadly attacks. In the end, you emerge victorious.

mission.name: Another Glorious Victory
mission.desc: After that long battle, you depart from the Gladius Scriptorium, content in the knowledge that you had once again proved your worth as a champion.

mission.name: Asking For Help
mission.desc: After defeating that traitor of Gurk, you tell the Avian Tribe your plan to dismember the factions and unify the tribes.

mission.name: The Real Champion
mission.desc: Ashanti appears in front of you and claims to be the actual and real champion of the Gladius Scriptorium. He says that to consider your proposal, you need to pass his challenge and defeat him in combat.

mission.name: First Challenge
mission.desc: The first challenge is to survive an obstacle course filled with deadly traps. You accept and start the trial. The danger was so high and, on many occasions, you were really close to failing and losing your life.

mission.name: Second Challenge
mission.desc: At the exact moment you reach the goal, you see a group of the fiercest fighters that you've ever seen before, waiting to fight with you, all at the same time. You manage to beat them, but you feel that you are almost fainting.

mission.name: Final Challenge
mission.desc: Ashanti stands up in front of you and praises your skills but, you still need to beat him in combat. He is fast and doesn't have any mercy on his attacks. You don't know how but you defeat him with your remaining energy.

mission.name: Glory to the New Champion
mission.desc: You collapse aside an absolutely exhausted Ashanti and hear all the screams and praises from the audience. You are the new Champion, luck is on your side once again and your goal of unification is one step closer.

mission.name: Rise of the General
mission.desc: You arrive at the Stormy Seastone Citadel to realize that it was taken over by the powerful General Naglar Chainsawpaw.

mission.name: Destroying Alliances
mission.desc: Looking for answers, you find that Chainsawpaw is against any unification, establishing chaos as the main rule for the inhabitants of the citadel.

mission.name: Agents of Chaos
mission.desc: In a matter of time, some spies realized that you've been asking too many questions. Because of that, they sent Agents of Chaos to catch you.

mission.name: Total Madness
mission.desc: Behind every wave of Agents of Chaos, more enemies are coming, only because they enjoy this new regime of madness and destruction and they will try to protect it.

mission.name: Freezing Scream
mission.desc: From the wave of enemies, you hear a deafening war cry: it's Katerina Snowfang, an officer of General Chainsawpaw, ready to destroy you.

mission.name: Partner at Fangs
mission.desc: Once Katerina is defeated, she recognizes your worth as a warrior and joins your forces to face the rest of the chaotic enemies.

mission.name: Crazy for Power
mission.desc: Katerina mentions to you, that General Chainsawpaw is insane. That's why she will help you to get to him. But first, you must make your way to the throne, fighting against all the underlings.

mission.name: Undead Vanguard
mission.desc: Thanks to Katerina's help, both of you were able to reach the castle, ready to face the most powerful soldiers of the General.

mission.name: Crimson Redemption
mission.desc: During the fight against the General's powerful guard, Katerina has been injured and will no longer be able to join you on your quest, you must keep moving forward and face the General alone.

mission.name: Starting Savages Engines
mission.desc: Finally, you arrive at the throne room where General Naglar Chainsawpaw himself is turning on his powerful chainsaws. He furiously roars and challenges you to one of the greatest duels of your life.

mission.name: Naglar Chainsawpaw
mission.desc: Naglar has been one of the best warriors that you have ever faced, his powerful chainsaws give you no truce, but eventually, you end victorious.

mission.name: Reign of Serenity?
mission.desc: After days of intense battles, the citadel finally returns to normality, thanks to the fact that the General and his remaining underlings have been defeated and imprisoned for good.

mission.name: Bad News
mission.desc: You find a mysterious message painted on your Citadel room's wall: ''Naglar was a puppet. There's another. Bigger. Scarier.'' Suddenly, the ground cracks below your feet and skeletal hands reach out to get you!

mission.name: Skeletal Ambush
mission.desc: You survived the first onslaught. Suddenly, you hear a woman weeping. But she's nowhere to be seen. From the shadows, more undead appear!

mission.name: The Crying Lady
mission.desc: A lightning bolt strikes outside and Llorona reveals herself! ''I know about you. I know about your plans. You must be stopped!'', she says while crying.

mission.name: Tears of Unification
mission.desc: The battle moves to other sections of the Citadel. Undead are chasing you, while Llorona wails ''My Chaos will reign! Chaos must reign!''

mission.name: Release the Chaos
mission.desc: ''I'll finish what poor Naglar started. I'll extinguish your life and your childish dreams of unifying all tribes!''

mission.name: An Illusion
mission.desc: Finally, at the Citadel's rooftop. Under a terrible storm, the final battle against Llorona starts. ''Peace is an illusion! There's only Chaos... There can only be Chaos!'' she wails before summoning her last attack!

mission.name: Unsettling Reports
mission.desc: You've been requested to check if some rumors about mysterious kidnappings in the outskirts of Luminis.

mission.name: Misleading Clues?
mission.desc: You've reached the outskirts and conducted a throughly search but the only thing that you've found is several incomplete marks on the ground from, apparently, different animals that do not belong to the area.

mission.name: Retreating for Good
mission.desc: After you decide it's time to return to Luminis to rest, you start to get a feeling that you're being silently watched and followed.

mission.name: Ambushed by Animals?
mission.desc: Just before you leave the forest, a group of angry beasts appears in front and behind you. It was an ambush! Their eyes are completely red and they don't move naturally for some reason, but they're rushing to attack you.

mission.name: A Disturbing Glare
mission.desc: This fight is not that difficult but tiring, since these creatures were made of metal and they won't stop moving 'til they are complete wreckage. You get to see a pair of red eyes watching at your direction through the bushes.

mission.name: A Deafening Whistle
mission.desc: Small but endless waves kept coming to you, until a quite strong whistle is heard. These animals retreat, running through the forest and that pair of eyes is nowhere to be found. You quickly pick some of the metal pieces and return to Luminis.

mission.name: Examine the Wreckage
mission.desc: Immediately after you tell what happened, a team is dispatched to retrieve more wreckage to study these. No one noticed that a small bird was watching everything.

mission.name: As If Nothing Ever Happened
mission.desc: The team returned empty-handed, but they noticed a strange looking bird flying in the middle of the night and captured it. In the distance, that whistle that you heard before is echoing. You suggest that everyone must get ready for an attack.

mission.name: No Time to Waste
mission.desc: The bird won't stop croaking and slamming itself against the cage. It also has the very same red eyes as the animals that attacked you. An explosion is heard and battle noises begin to arise outside.

mission.name: Unlikely Alliances
mission.desc: You decide to help in the battle and there's a bizarre scene ocurring: a mecha zombie is using its blunderbuss against the mecha animals, so you decide to fight side by side with it.

mission.name: An Incredible Sight
mission.desc: After a short while, you notice a glaring pair of red eyes emerging from the fire: it's a robot and it seems to command the swarm of mecha animals. From the sky, you hear a dragon's roar. It's a mecha dragon flying in your direction, breathing fire against anyone who's near it.

mission.name: The Calm After the Storm
mission.desc: You and the mecha zombie, along with the people of Luminis, managed to stop the attack, but the robot is nowhere to be found. Someone reveals that it was a rumor, but it used to be a former scientist involved with the Mecha tribe until its body suffered an horrendous accident.

mission.name: Is There Any Good News?
mission.desc: After the exhausting battle in the middle of the night, you get to talk to the mecha zombie that helped you. It gives you an unsettling but revealing clue about the leader of these abominations: his name is Dr. Mechau and he's being helped by Darkassan himself.

mission.name: Unconditional Help
mission.desc: This mecha hunter shares its own research about that dreadful pair: Darkassan brings the subjects for the Doctor to experiment on and create an army of robots. Since the hunter offered his help, you decide that you'll stick together until they are stopped.

mission.name: Leave No Stone Unturned
mission.desc: You attempted to find the hideout of Doctor Mechau with a little bit of help. While you were gone, the hunter managed to create a device with the robot's wreckage that can pinpoint Mechau's controlling signal and therefore, his lair.

mission.name: A Distressing Signal
mission.desc: The mecha hunter wasted no time talking and marched at sunrise. You manage to catch up with him and find the Doctor's lair. Mechau receives you with Darkassan and a relentless army of robots, attacking you fiercely.

mission.name: Undercover Agenda
mission.desc: Suddenly, in the middle of the fight, Mechau falls into the ground with a hole on his chest and Darkassan smiles behind him. ''Thanks to you, now I can do my will everywhere. This machine will give me endless soldiers!''. He removes the controller from his head and continues the battle.

mission.name: Was Everything an Illusion?
mission.desc: While facing Darkassan, the hunter aims at the machine in order to stop the endless army. An explosion that hurts Darkassan's wings, gives you a chance to knock him down with a ferocious punch, but your ally is nowhere to be seen. You've survived and restored peace once more.

mission.name: Knock Knock
mission.desc: After foiling the dastardly plans of Doctor Mechau, you prepare to depart from the city of Luminis. Just before you take off, you are interrupted by a knock on the ship's hull. It's Dilbert, the insect architect from Beetleton Bunker!

line.text: R-Remember me, adventurer? Oh, gods! It feels like it's been years since we last talked.
The Goblins might have the Spellstone Hammer now, but we've been working around the clock to rebuild our fair city.
Say what you will about him, but if Kattoraki proved one thing, it's that nothing is stronger than love...
So strong, in fact, that people keep telling me the city is too cramped.
With all the new grubs crawling around, there just aren't enough houses anymore.

mission.name: Beetleton Baby Boom
mission.desc: An exhausted Dilbert explains that the next generation of insects is in need of a new home: one that's built even deeper into the Beetleton cave network. But he seems fearful about the prospects of digging deeper...

line.text: We were starting to dig when we found... some real, honest-to-the-gods ancient ruins!
We hoped you could help scout the area, Adventurer. But first, you should see our beautiful city!

mission.name: Joy to the Bunker
mission.desc: Though you aren't looking forward to the 'exotic' insect cuisine, you agree to accompany Dilbert back to Beetleton. The underground city is alive with vibrant leaves, mushrooms, and bugs, happier and busier than ever before.

line.text: This is the harmony our Carnival of Couples has created!

mission.name: We Need to Go Deeper
mission.desc: Dilbert directs your airship past the festivities and swarming citizens, into the depths of the underground. The ship's headlights only barely pierce through the gloom. You grow more and more unsettled the farther you fly.

mission.name: The Crash
mission.desc: A skittering sound echoes through the pitch-black caves, growing steadily louder... then, silence. After a brief pause, something collides with the ship! Gripping the wheel, you're forced to land in unrelenting darkness.

line.text: M-Mayday! MAYDAY!

mission.name: Poisonbolt from the Blue
mission.desc: When you and Dilbert emerge from the wreckage, you spot the cause of the unexpected landing. A foul, green projectile has soaked into the hull. Fortunately, the ship's headlamps still work... It's not much, but it's a start.

line.text: Oh, thank the gods... We're safe!
Wait, where are we?
NONE SHALL PASSSSS

mission.name: Sunless Stone
mission.desc: After fending off the ambush, you follow the headlamps' light to a foreboding stone structure that leads even deeper into the depths. You recognize the style of carvings from the Forgotten Island, where you first met Agatha.

line.text: This is it, Adventurer! The ruins I was telling you about!
But it looks like something happened since my team was here last.
These doors weren't open before... I don't like this...

mission.name: Open Wide
mission.desc: There are obvious scorch marks marring the double doors ahead. You brace yourself for another struggle. Dilbert follows behind you in trepidation as you venture deeper inside, holding an old, beaten-up lantern full of fireflies.

mission.name: Inner Sanctum
mission.desc: You descend the first flight of stairs you see. The moment you enter the next chamber, torches on the walls suddenly crackle to life with crimson flame. The room is bathed in light, and an elaborate mural is unveiled before your eyes.

line.text: Adventurer, look at these old drawings!
I don't believe it! These look like...
It is! This is what Beetleton Bunker looked like when my great-great-great-grandpa was a grub!
But, if this building is related to Beetleton...
Why did no one discover it until recently?

mission.name: The Spraying Mantis
mission.desc: You're about to ponder Dilbert's question when you hear a harsh skittering sound, distant at first, but gaining and gaining fast. A huge, armored mantis darts into the sanctum. Liquid drips from its sickles as it lets out a hiss.

line.text: Aaaah! Adventurer! Watch out!
That creature! I know that scent!
That's the poison that damaged the airship...!

mission.name: Rhynio Reunion
mission.desc: The mantis's head rears back, and its eyes glow a fearsome green. But before it can spit its toxins at you, a bolt of fiery magic strikes it. It manages to fire a gout of green liquid harmlessly against the wall before collapsing to the floor.

line.text: Helvius! That is enough! You will not harm another innocent!
Champion... what brings you here, to this painful reminder of olden times?
We're here to explore these ruins! Beetleton Bunker depends on it.
I am afraid you've dug far too deep for your own good.
This was once a secret haven for the Rhynio, when the Forgotten Hero was my child... my pride and joy.
When the Void surged through our island, a chosen few braved the darkness connecting us to the mainland.
We erected this. A shelter, if the Crimsonwings should fall.
But nobody's here but that... monster!

mission.name: Myth Warden's Despair
mission.desc: A look of grief clouds Agatha's face. She closes her eyes, fluttering over to the wall behind you. Your eyes follow her, and at last you understand. Pictured there is the mantis, applying a green poultice to another insect's wounds.

line.text: Helvius was once the pride of the Rhynio people, beetle.
But when he stayed behind to heal the sick, he succumbed to the power of the Void. Soon, he was beyond even our reach.
Our finest Sun Warriors could not break the curse and return his mind. So, we had no recourse...
We sealed him away in this sanctuary, a place we once called our safe haven from the Void.
And, in the end, the rest of our civilization would follow him into the abyss.

mission.name: A Rock and a Dark Place
mission.desc: Beyond Helvius's sanctum lies a seemingly endless maze of cave passages. Agatha escorts you and Dilbert through the darkness, guided only by her memory. You ask yourself if it's even possible to escape.

mission.name: Weapons, Warnings, Worms
mission.desc: The deeper you travel, the more you spot the discarded weapons of fallen soldiers. Agatha's wings hesitate. She's reluctant to fly any farther, since she can smell something she calls a Phomoran Ogerworm.

mission.name: I've Just Been in This Place Before
mission.desc: Agatha describes a massive, nearly immortal beast with a sharp mind and an aggressive temperament. You can't help but think of Nophora, a foe so fearsome that you only barely survived it when a cave-in saved you...

mission.name: Bold and Boulder
mission.desc: Before you waits a boulder with fourteen writhing legs. You take a hesitant step closer, and it crumbles to pieces! Nophora emerges from underneath, its red eyes full of hate. Orange poison leaks from its body.

mission.name: Phomo-Rollercoaster Ride
mission.desc: The worm lunges at you, but its injuries have made its movements slow and telegraphed. Leaping to one side, you manage to climb onto Nophora's body. It screams. You're forced to hold tight as it goes on a blind rampage!

mission.name: The Last Wriggle
mission.desc: You hold onto the tiny spikes covering Nophora's segments with a steely grip. They act as footholds, even as they dig into your body. At last, you climb to the top of Nophora's head... and plunge your blade deep into its eye!

mission.name: Prologue
mission.desc: Amidst thunder and lightning, mysterious shadows are engaged in a hushed conversation with a hooded goblin witch

line.text: When shall we meet again?
When the battle is lost and won.
Where?
Hover through the fog and filthy air.

mission.name: Up in the Air
mission.desc: You finally make your way back to the surface, as Dilbert and his carpenters do their best to make the ship airworthy again. But after rejoining Ursurio, you notice someone unusual in the distance.

line.text: I think that's the best we can do without the Hammer or finding new parts.
Having surveyed the damage, you should count yourself lucky!
But at least we saved all our food provisions!
Hold up! Why don't we just ask that ship up there for spares?
Whoa there, I recognise that ship! But my eyes must be deceiving me! Was it something I ate?
Curses! The others must also be huntin' for The Hoarder's weapons.

mission.name: Back from the Dead
mission.desc: Confused as to how a very un-undead Xerkahn has returned, you travel to Karthos to seek Tarian for an explanation.

line.text: I'm as confused as you all. I've had no reports of unusual activity, and I'm sure I would have noticed her coming back from the dead.
And you're absolutely certain she was fully alive? Not an undead rancor?
There's no mistaking her and her flagship!
I guess you're all here looking for the same thing I am...
Answers.

mission.name: Double Trouble
mission.desc: The armored goblin continues his surprisingly eloquent tale. It would seem that Xerkahn is not the only goblin that has returned from the dead.

line.text: I'm afraid those goblins always remained loyal followers of Reks. War was inevitable as soon as news spread.
And what's his goal?
To reclaim the throne, I'm sure.
Hold right there, goblin. You haven't told us who you are. For all we know, you could be a spy.

mission.name: If You Stare Into the Void
mission.desc: Tarian is suspicious of the goblin and wants to know who this visitor to Karthos is.

line.text: And you never asked until now. Very well, allow me to introduce myself. I am...
I was once a centurion in Daknak's personal guard. But fear not. I have no quarrel with you.
Rather than work with Boldur, Daknak has gone chasing rumors. He's looking for weapons Remi might have left behind.
But even if they exist, they will be infused with the Void. He is foolish to think he can handle them.
Daknak made his decision. I was not prepared to follow.

mission.name: The Void Stares Back Through You
mission.desc: Armed with the knowledge that Daknak, and likely Xerkahn also, are seeking out a cache of Void weapons, you start pondering on where to begin your search. Little do you realize other eyes were looking at you...

line.text: Well, that would explain why Xerkahn was near Nophora's lair. The worm is known as a weapon hoarder.
Aye, aye, cap'n Sivun. Target spotted!
Ack! I didn't mean it like that!

mission.name: A Civil War
mission.desc: Interfactional fighting has consumed the goblin tribes. Spurred by sightings of their former king, goblins have risen up against Boldur. Compounding the chaos, Daknak has also raised an army, driven by ambition and rumors of powerful treasure, ignoring even his most loyal advisors.

line.text: You will find what you desire at your journey's end.
Daknak find treasure! Daknak use treasure! Daknak do what Boldur does not!
Daknak jump into Void! Daknak owe no explanation to those who stand and watch!

mission.name: Stolen Eye-dentity
mission.desc: Back in Karthos, Xerkahn's goblins have begun an air assault. Far above the mountaintops, you can spot a blind goblin leader shouting orders.

line.text: Nuvis!
That not Nuvis! That Sivun! Nuvis brother! Nuvis steal Sivun eyes as joke at Goblin Military School. Sivun hate Nuvis!
More ships over there!
Hand over the weapons ya got from that worm!

mission.name: When You Come At the King...
mission.desc: The skies fill up with ships from multiple factions. You know you don't possess what Xerkahn is demanding but aren't quite sure how to convince her. Taking evasive maneuvers, you find yourself near a squadron of dragon-riding goblins.

line.text: Well, well, well. I wouldn't believe it if I didn't see it with my own two eyes.
There's our signal lads! Follow Sivun's lead!
BOMBS AWAY!!!
Daknak see Nuvis brother! Daknak order Nuvis attack!

mission.name: You Best Not Miss
mission.desc: Bombs burst in the skies above Karthos as the goblin civil war explodes into an all out air battle. You send out a call for help. But unbeknownst to you, Daknak has boarded your ship. Though some, more so than others, are unhappy to see him, he has come with an offer.

line.text: Daknak see many familiar faces! Daknak not friends with those faces.
But Daknak come in peace. Daknak need help.
Daknak air commander tells him Reks is fake Reks. Nuvis say he see real identity

mission.name: Identity Revealed
mission.desc: You agree to work with Daknak to lure the imposter king into a trap. Your aerial reinforcements from Yuriel and Samael arrive just in time. Daknak sends his air force as bait whilst you send the owl mystic armed with his knowledge of dispelling magic.

line.text: HUH?! What? Who are you?!
Time to find out who you really are!
NO! ARGH! THE LIGHT!
... you!
Damnation!

mission.name: An Angel in Goblin Clothing
mission.desc: You unmask the real identity of the returning king: Gobtoh! But before you can ponder the important questions such as whether Xerkahn is real or whether Reks' followers also saw, you find yourself attacked from all sides.

mission.name: Return to the Convergence
mission.desc: Tailing Gobtoh from the ashes of Karthos, you arrive in the sanctum at the center of Dawnglow Swamp, where elements and factions collide.

line.text: Look! Daknak sees him! Daknak sees Gobtoh!

mission.name: War Comes Home
mission.desc: The rumour of a secret stash of weapons, and therefore the goblins' infighting, has spread all throughout Conflux Convergence.

line.text: Destroy the Chaos scum!
You'll never escape Sivun!
Long live the Aether!
Fear the might of my true self, the great Gobtoh Ascended!!
Ah-hahahahaaa!

mission.name: Aether's Chagrin
mission.desc: From the comfort of the airship, Yuriel, Samael, and seemingly Daknak all watch on with dismay. As members of the Aether, they instinctively shrink away from such anarchy.

line.text: Whooo could just stand there and watch this...? It's senseless.
We must stay the course. You and I once fought the Goblins as one tribe.
They'll be left with nothing if the war continues.
Even the weakest goblin child knows that no one can battle forever.

mission.name: Daknak Plan!
mission.desc: Daknak lets slip that he might know a shortcut to end the war.

line.text: Daknak sees where Gobtoh hid Remi's weapons.
With weapons in Daknak's hand, I rule! Daknak bring peace as king of the Goblins, forever and ever!

mission.name: Final Warning
mission.desc: Samael's face darkens at the mere mention of the Void. As a former victim of its curse, he has sworn never to allow another being under its thrall.

line.text: Daknak, you fool... Your centurion was right! You have no idea what madness you speak!
Anyone who claims they can control the Void is playing with a fire worse than any Chaos's magic!

mission.name: A Warning Unheeded
mission.desc: Daknak refuses to listen to Samael. He leaps from the airship, right onto the battlefield, and draws his cursed blade!

line.text: Bahaha! Angels too WEAK to understand Daknak plan! Just like Boldur! WEAK!!

mission.name: Chasing a Dream
mission.desc: Samael balls his hands into fists and vows to slay every Goblin who dares pursue Remi's cache of Void weapons any farther.

line.text: Traitor! You will pay for your hubris!
I don't care if I have to wield Dyrnwyn against your entire tribe. No mortal trifles with the Void!
Hooo... adventurer, will you go with him?
The last time he got like this, I had to clean the ashes out of my feathers for 11 days straight!

mission.name: Elemental Meltdown
mission.desc: In the Convergence, you notice enraged Elementals that awoke in response to the war. As an Elemental himself, Remi's cache threatens this world's balance.

line.text: WHOOOSH!!
GLOOOOP!!
I was afraid of this... We'll fend them off together, adventurer!

mission.name: Daknak Found!!
mission.desc: You and Samael find Daknak only to notice he has found something too. Daknak reaches for an elaborate pocket watch, which you immediately recognize it as Remi's.

line.text: The secret weapon... is TIME!
With time on Daknak's side, Daknak change the flow of the war!
Daknak turn all Goblins slow with the power of the Void!!!
Hands off that piece of clockwork, Daknak!
Remi the Banished was barred from the elemental plane for his folly!
Who knows what will happen if you try to use his powers for yourself?!

mission.name: Crossed Swords
mission.desc: Samael draws Dyrnwyn, the legendary sword that severs the Void. Angel and goblin battle in a flurry of blades. Black clouds fall over the horizon, portending a decisive battle!

mission.name: Daknak Time!!!
mission.desc: Daknak makes a sudden, valorous strike that stuns Samael long enough for him to grab Remi's pocket watch.

line.text: You don't know how long Daknak waited for this...!
No more Boldur! No more war! Daknak reign supreme over all Goblinkind!
Then everyone listen to Daknak for once!
Everyone stop forgetting Daknak, and treating Daknak like weak outcast!!
Daknak is strong! And goblins finally THINK Daknak strong!
Daknak, you IDIOT! You've doomed us all!!

mission.name: Cataclysm
mission.desc: The instant Daknak touches the watch, a fearsome power emanates from within it! An explosion of Void magic cracks the air open. The cracks spread across the sky. And the world shatters...

line.text: Now look what you've done!
I know this magic. It's the ultimate power of the Void... but it's never done this before!
What's happening...?!
All Daknak wanted was... respect!

mission.name: Isn't It Neat?
mission.desc: After what feels like an eternity, you awaken alone in a cold, forbidding cave. What looks like a waterfall flows down from the entrance. Fishes flit by.

mission.name: Wall of Wonders
mission.desc: Entranced by the beautiful sight spreading out before you, you gaze beyond the falls. The depths of the Pharos Temple spread out before you. The water smells of something foul.

mission.name: She Who Holds the Tide
mission.desc: A fierce-looking woman with blue skin greets you tersely, though she does not look at you. Her hands move with the flow of the waterfall, keeping it intact.

mission.name: A Protean Proteus
mission.desc: The woman introduces herself as Tethys, but before she can say any more, a dark shape bursts through the falls and swings his sword! You narrowly dodge to find... Proteus?!

line.text: Kreeeargh! You shall bow before the might of King Proteus!

mission.name: Float Like a Merman, Sting Like a Bird
mission.desc: Proteus' beard is bedraggled. His eyes are wrong. You can feel them trained on you. He cleaves the air, his sword soaring on invisible wings. He shrieks like a hungry hawk.

line.text: For the glory of the ocean! Let the waters swallow Arcantica whole!
HERETIC!!

mission.name: Tethys' Boon
mission.desc: Tethys' arm drops calmly to her side. Summoned by her magic, the fearsome shark warrior Zolmosh headbutts Proteus from behind! He coughs up black ooze, defeated.

line.text: Keee... For the glory of the... ocean...
Foolish infidel. Lady Scylla yet lives! The Watershaper foretells all!
...Squawk... Kaww...
Now STAY down, Proteus of the Void. You cannot stop our Maelstrom!

mission.name: Prophet of the Falls
mission.desc: Tethys congratulates Zolmosh on a job well done, then parts the waterfall. At last, you can see the skies above... A thunderstorm the color of an oil slick roils overhead.

line.text: Tethys the Watershaper has spoken!
With the ocean king at bay, the Maelstrom is here at last!
Come to us, Lady Scyll--
ARRRRRR!!

mission.name: Sea, Meet Sky
mission.desc: In a flash of crimson, the righteous berserker Alyel descends before you can even see her coming! You blink. Tethys has fallen to one knee. The foul, dark sea beyond you stills.

line.text: Even with the Void returned, these freaks still try to summon Scylla back from the dead...
I will never understand it.
Come on, adventurer. Let's regroup in Duskwillow...
...once that stupid ship gets here, that is. Why is everyone so slow?

mission.name: Dressed to Plunder
mission.desc: The Undead Armada and the Dragon Family arrive not long after, their fleet of battleships now helmed by a strangely familiar new crew.

line.text: So, intel was right. They WERE somewhere near Pharos. But why...?
Zolmosh dares not tell an angel.
Zolmosh especially dares not tell them this used to be the sacred site of Lady Scylla and Lord Typhoeus!
But oh, that fool Proteus. He thought he could be king without the blessings of the--
*Traps Zolmosh in a bubble*
...Shut up. No landlubber wants to hear th' cult of Scylla ramblin'.

mission.name: All Aboard
mission.desc: Your allies welcome you aboard the Undead Armada's ship. Though it's unexpected to see angels working side by side with orcs and undead, you can't help but think Lev would be proud.

line.text: We have the Adventurer! Now, to Duskwillow, and to arms!
You know, Alyel, you're almost sounding like a real leader.
Isn't it a grand thing to share the throne for once?
I don't know why I never considered it sooner.
Aye. Even if the Goblins are fightin', at least we can have a little peace here.

mission.name: Spoken Too Soon
mission.desc: Proteus awakens from his Void sickness. But as you and your uncommon allies; pull away from shore, you have still left Tethys and Zolmosh basically unattended...

line.text: Mother Tethys...? I thought you were retired.
Things change, "King" Proteus. What's forgotten cannot stay forgotten forever. Thousands of Brinesouls came together for this! The Maelstrom is here!
...Why must you continue to use the serpents like this, Mother? The Void has tainted our waters so thoroughly. Not even Scylla's full fury could prevent that...
I don't know. I just thought that our line knew better. Those two are wild beasts. Forces of nature.
Lord Typhoeus would be ten times the king you are.
...Silence, raider.

mission.name: The Maelstrom Begins
mission.desc: The Watershaper grimaces. She's come too far. Tethys raises her arms. The tides rise higher, more violently, until the ocean becomes a cascade that blots out the sky.

line.text: So... that is your answer, Mother.
Maybe the Void should have destroyed us after all.

mission.name: A Quick Regroup
mission.desc: Even with the Seafolk raiders' Maelstrom thwarted, the clouds remain as ominous as ever. Your allies bring you from Pharos to Duskwillow and back to the airship.

line.text: I s'pose you've got to be confused. The skies went dark during the Goblin Civil War, and it's drivin' th' world mad!
After it happened, Samael petitioned the rulers of Skyhaven to send out a search party.
You had disappeared completely, Adventurer.
We were lucky to find you when we did. You were almost another casualty...

mission.name: A Chill in the Air
mission.desc: The triumvirate of angels steers the ship up past the clouds, to a Skyhaven that looks shrouded in an endless night. Only the city lights are able to illuminate your path.

line.text: Strange, isn't it? It's the middle of the day, and yet the Void cloud has covered everything.
At least Samael will be relieved to see you.

mission.name: Put on... Ice?
mission.desc: As you approach the blackened city, sharp shards of frost zip past your craft. Not wanting a repeat of what happened with Helvius, you take the helm and deftly avoid them!

mission.name: Giving a Hoot
mission.desc: You can't shake an ominous feeling as you touch down in Skyhaven. After reuniting with Yuriel and Samael, your suspicions are confirmed. The Void is running rampant!

line.text: Hoot! There you are! Took you long enough!
Adventurer, things are as dire as they have ever been. The Void has been unbound.
It's been spreading across the world... and the delicate balance of the factions is ruined!

mission.name: That's No Angel
mission.desc: Samael explains that the Void's newly unleashed power has infected all of Arcantica. Every tribe is behaving completely differently from their usual selves!

line.text: The Seafolk of Pharos and Duskwillow screech and stare like Avians...
The Dragons of Tarragon Peak mount violent barrages like Goblins...
And the Angels of Skyhaven are--
COME... WITH... US...!
Whooo dares?! Back, you demon! Back!

mission.name: City of the Damned
mission.desc: You repulse the Void underling, only to find the entire city swarming with them. In your brief absence, demons have overrun Skyhaven like an Undead horde!

line.text: Come, Adventurer. Let us take back the capital of the Angels!
Glory to our sanctified cities!

mission.name: Alyel's Pride
mission.desc: You, Yuriel, and Samael step back out onto the streets of the demon-infested Skyhaven. The three queens have already charged into battle, but one fights well beyond the rest.

line.text: Gnaaargh!
HAH, IS THAT ALL YOU'VE GOT?! MAY I HAVE ANOTHER?!?
Save some demons for the rest of us, sister!
BUTT OUT! I'M EARNING THE THRONE FOR REAL THIS TIME!

mission.name: No Mind to Think?
mission.desc: The berserking Alyel tears the demons apart before they can even mount an offense, as quick as the legendary Sword Saint Katto. But when the coast seems clear...

line.text: Hmph! A job well done. Once again, I can call myself an ally of all that is good and just.
Pesky Angel... fast! Call for... aid!

mission.name: Ascending the Chain of Command
mission.desc: The demonic legions regroup and coalesce around a now-familiar face: it's Gobtoh, the angel who had only just served as a pretender to the Goblin throne!

line.text: Heh heh, now THIS will be a battle worth remembering!
Even though that stopwatch I hid is still out there somewhere...
And these demons, I'm sure you can tell by now, are as weak as water...
